ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for your feedback regarding your recent stay at MaRadha Colombo. We are glad to hear that you found our location convenient, with its proximity to the Marine Drive and the train line, and that you enjoyed the sea view from your room on the 4th floor. We appreciate your positive comments about our hotel's modern design and the open roof terrace with its stunning sunset views.

We apologize for the noise issue you experienced due to the lack of soundproofing in the room doors. We understand that this may have affected your sleep and overall satisfaction with your stay. We will take your feedback into consideration as we continuously strive to improve our guests' experience.

Thank you again for your feedback, and we hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back to MaRadha Colombo in the future.

Sincerely,
MaRadha Colombo Team
placeInfo/address: 31, St. Kilda's Lane, Marine Drive, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka
text:
Direkt am Meer gelegen (dazwischen noch der Marine Drive und die Zugslinie Colombo-Galle, welche beide aber nicht stören), Blick auf das Meer toll, unbedingt einen frontalen sea-view room im 4ten Stock buchen. Hotel neu und modern, Bad eher klein.
Top die offene Dachterrasse mit Blick auf den Sonnenuntergang im Meer, der Pool auf der Terrasse ist sehr klein und nur zum Plantschen geeignet.
Fazit: moderate Preise für das Zimmer wie Drinks/Food, einzig besteht eine unschöne Lärmsituation, da die Zimmertüren nicht schalldicht sind, so dass jedes Wort auf dem Gang zu verstehen ist, nichts somit für Frühschläfer, aus diesem Grund nur eine befriedigende Bewertung.
title: neues & modernes Hotel am Meer

text: Over all a good hotel with a great location but the communication with the staff was very difficult and there were many misunderstandings. The breakfast was also different each day and mostly sri lankan breakfast with very little sweet options.

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,
Thanks a lot for taking time to review our restaurant. Thanks for your comments about the atmosphere, welcoming staff, great F & B services, waitress and the pricing & portion. Sorry about the chair that was taken by another guest. We will look at the oil issues. We are changing oil every 6 hours and something must have went wrong some where we will definitely rectify this issue. Thanks for visiting our restaurant. Thanks again.
Regards,
Hotel MaRadha Team
placeInfo/address: 31, St. Kilda's Lane, Marine Drive, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka
text:
We went to Maradha on 2nd March. Atmosphere was good. Welcome was great. F&B service was perfect (sp the Tamil waitress). F&B prices are very reasonable & portion was good too.  

However,
1. At the deck 1 chair was less as it has been taken by the other table guests and there were no extra chairs. So we had to get down and go to a different table
2. The oil which was used to cook the french fires were definitely old and it taste very odd. This was communicated to the F&B staff.
3. The cuttle fish had the same issue with the oil and on top of it they had the string which usually need to be removed and had to struggle with it when we need to cut it to small pieces.

Unfortunately will not be a stop by as I had a bad stomachache next day.
title: Food Quality Needs to be improved a lot

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We are pleased to hear that you enjoyed the stunning location, the cleanliness of the hotel, and the comfort of your room. We also appreciate your comments on the pool, although we acknowledge that it is on the smaller side, and we strive to provide a tranquil setting for our guests.

However, we are truly sorry to learn about your experience with the food during your stay. We take guest feedback on food quality very seriously, and we regret that the buffet and à la carte meals did not meet your expectations. We apologize for any inconvenience caused, particularly regarding the temperature and preparation of some dishes. We have already shared your comments with our culinary team to review and improve our food offerings.

Additionally, we are concerned to hear about the tummy upset that some members of your group experienced. Please rest assured that we follow strict food safety protocols, but we will certainly review our food handling and preparation processes to ensure that such incidents do not happen again in the future.

We value your feedback as it helps us continue to enhance our guest experience, and we hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back for a more enjoyable stay. Thank you once again for bringing these points to our attention.

Warm regards,  
Nuwan Wijerathne  
Resident Manager  
EKHO Lake House Polonnaruwa
placeInfo/address: Pothgul Mawatha, Polonnaruwa 51000 Sri Lanka
text:
The location is stunning and the rooms are very nice and clean. The pool is small.
However, the food is sub par and overpriced.
Three people in our group caught a tummy upset on the day we left. We felt they had cooked excessive food on the first day on the buffet. Some of this was re served again for breafast. 

Alcarte food was luke warm and some of the dishes over cooked especiallythe tuna.

Good hotel with room for improvement especially with the food.
title: Stunning location clean hotel but food needs to improve.

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for sharing your feedback regarding your recent visit to EKHO Lake House Polonnaruwa. While we’re delighted to hear that you enjoyed the serene lakeside seating and some aspects of your order, we sincerely regret the shortcomings you experienced.

Your comments regarding the vegetarian kebabs are concerning, and I deeply apologize for the lack of understanding and the unsatisfactory preparation. This does not reflect the high standards we strive to maintain. I will personally address this with our culinary team to ensure proper training and attention to detail moving forward.

Additionally, I understand the inconvenience caused by the mosquitoes during your outdoor experience. We take your suggestion of providing mosquito repellent incense sticks seriously and will implement measures to make our guests more comfortable while enjoying the beautiful surroundings.

Your feedback is invaluable to us, and we thank you for bringing these issues to our attention. I hope you will consider giving us another opportunity to provide you with a more enjoyable and seamless experience in the future.

Warm regards,
Nuwan Wijerathne
Resident Manager, EKHO Lake House Polonnaruwa
placeInfo/address: Pothgul Mawatha, Polonnaruwa 51000 Sri Lanka
roomTip:
Don't expect a great service for the price being charged. 
Carry your own mosquito repellent if planning on hanging out for long.
text:
I visited to chill in the evening and have dinner. The seating outside beside the lake is perfect to have an evening tea/coffee or a drink. 
My order:
Pinacolada - good
Fried Cashew - good
Vegetarian kebabs - I was served grilled vegetables with yellow rice. The chef and others had no clue what kebabs are really. 
However I bit into what was served only to find both were completely bland, without salt. Sent back to rectify, still was the worst grilled veggies I've had.

Management must make provisions for mosquito repellent incense sticks at least for customers to be able to sit outside for a prolonged time. I had to  hurry through my one drink because of the mosquitoes.
title: Site is good but needs lot of improvement

placeInfo/address: Pothgul Mawatha, Polonnaruwa 51000 Sri Lanka
text: Having read so many great reviews, I was disappointed with this hotel. True, the location is lovely and our room was nice but there were a few problems - a leaking basin, a shower plug that over flowed, wifi that kept cutting out, a much tinier pool than it appeared in the photos, not great service, no chilled beer, very expensive food and drink. Taking all of these things into consideration,  I feel it was over-priced and not worth the money, especially compared to other places I have stayed in Sri Lanka. Disappointing.
title: Overpriced

ownerResponse/text:
Thank you for sharing your detailed feedback about your recent stay. I'm glad to hear that you loved the stunning location and had an amazing experience watching elephants while enjoying the lap pool. It sounds like a truly unique atmosphere!

I apologize for the inconveniences you faced with the room and the bugs. Your concerns regarding the cleanliness and value for money are noted, and we always appreciate feedback as it helps us improve our offerings. It’s great to hear that one of our staff members made a positive impact on your stay; we strive for excellent service and will make sure to recognize him.

Regarding the restaurant pricing, we understand that it may not align with local options, and we appreciate your understanding of the wait time. It’s wonderful to hear you enjoyed the food, especially the Sri Lankan breakfast!

Thank you again for your insights, and we hope to have the opportunity to provide you with a more enjoyable experience in the future. Safe travels!
placeInfo/address: Pothgul Mawatha, Polonnaruwa 51000 Sri Lanka
text:
Is average considering pricing, we were initially shown to king room which looked nicer but needed twin so were moved to room with much better view but is not what I expected for $200 a night. I did find a flea on my bed but think it was just a random as bedding was generally clean. Lots of bugs do get in room and there are no mosquito nets. Has been a bit disappointing as this was us spending it up for some luxury but the $50-$70 per night home stays and villas we have stayed at previously have been much nicer. 

On the positive side, the location is stunning and taking a dip in the lap pool while watching elephants on the distant plains is an amazing experience. One of the staff members here has made the stay a much better experience, unfortunately I didn’t get his name but he was just lovely and always more than happy to help. 

The restaurant is expensive in comparison to local eating places - 2 beers cost the same as our entire dinner the previous night at Jago. However the food is delicious, I had the veggie cakes and my cousin had the curry special (which was enough for two) both delicious but was a very long wait between ordering and food arriving. Breakfast was also delicious - the Sri Lankan brekkie defiantly beats the western breakfast.
title: Beautiful location but disappointing for cost.

ownerResponse/text:
Dear guest,

please be kind enough to note that Lake house - polonnaruwa was not operational in the given period of time and we were shocked to see the review published.

placeInfo/address: 84, Nilaveli Road 3rd Mile Post, Trincomalee, Trincomalee 31000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Don't bother with Trincomalee
text:
This will be a lovely resort but it is not finished and Trincomalee is very forgettable and not worth the hours in a car or more on the train.
The management tried hard to make up for the fact many room plunge pools are nowhere near finished.  The work area is screened off with blue tarps and they try hard to keep workers and truck deliveries away from guests but lights are bright and on until 11pm each night and they toil away from very early until very late.
The food in the beachfront coffee shop was fine, the main restaurant looked yet to open for all but breakfast.  It is indoors but the AC was never turned on and breakfast was forgettable.
We would not recommend Trincomalee in the Sri Lankan island lap.
title: Not finished but open

ownerResponse/text:

roomTip: Wouldn't recommend this hotel its expensive and unfinished. They charged a single room the same price as a couple. Totally unacceptable.
text: The is a very expensive 5 star hotel which does not have the facilities to say they are a 5 star hotel. They have no spa, no laundry service. Which they claim to have on booking.com. The staff are very friendly and helpful and the food is amazing but i wouldn't recommend this for at least another 5 years as its still under construction.

placeInfo/address: No 17 Bloomfield Rd, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed 2 nights at the Chimneys and booked two rooms garden side in the second building.
Luckily the hotel was quiet as we were the only guests which was good for us to relax. 

On the positive side :
- Food was fresh and excellent (too bad your lady cook is leaving)
- Service from Gavin efficient (but sometimes too ‘present’)
- Rooms clean 
- hotel well located in town but in a residential quiet area.

On the negative note :
- the temperature of hot water in our shower was too high and burning . The water taps were not efficient to use and mis functionning and the temperature was not stabilised. I asked them too fix it.
- we experienced an electric short circuits then the lamps bulbs exploded while in the bathroom so the situation was pretty dangerous . Of course run out of electricity. We had to call Gavin to find a solution as we could not stay in our rooms. We then had to pack again and move to other rooms in the main building.
- also in our initial rooms, in the bathroom , an indoor wood made window was positioned towards the corridor so you can hear all the noises and as such the bathroom didn’t felt intimate at all and cold ! It was worth in the second room as the same window had two open panels for ventilation which you could not shut. The temperature was 12 deg Celsius at night so the bathroom was not inviting considering the weather there (cold and rainy during our stay)
- on check in , no one explained how was working the heating system which in fact is a AC unit. So we were cold the first night (the weather was then terrible with great win and rain falls). We found out after moving to the second room but quickly turned it off as it was too noisy!
- as well I don’t understand why they choose to install such heavy doors everywhere occurring unnecessary noise while opening and shutting! I cannot imagine the noise level in the building whenever the hotel is full! 

I believe this hotel has potential but they still have to work in their infrastructure (electricity, plumber, et ) to avoid complicated stays for the guests.
title: Not as expected

placeInfo/address: 48 Janadhipathi Mawatha, Colombo 00100 Sri Lanka
text:
We visited for one night as the last hotel of our tour of Sri Lanka.

The hotel looks grand and opulent from the outside and is a very nice part of the city. The reception area matches the appearance of the outside. However the service we received didn't match the grandeur.

It took us 20 minutes to check in with very little in terms of communication from the person checking us in. Once we been given the key card and told our room number that was it. No directions to the lift, no information about our luggage - nothing. I had to come back down to the lobby to get our luggage. First world problems I admit but not what I would expect from "the best hotel in Colombo".

The rooms were OK. Clean and nicely appointed but the little details let it down. Badly painted ceilings (going over fittings), old carpet, lights in the wardrobe not working, no minibar or complimentary water.

Service in the buffet restaurant, Harbour, was equally poor. It was self service buffet but ordering and receiving a drink took over 20 minutes from sitting down. 

The Sky lounge was the only exception. We got excellent service in this bar and the selection of drinks was good as well (no draught beer though).

This certainly isn't one of the worst hotels but it was the worst one compared to all of the other hotels we stayed at in our 2 week tour.
title: Not as grand as it makes out

roomTip: Go somewhere else or ask for a room away from the noisy pool
text:
It promised so much but we were so let down. Check in took ages but we were upgraded. However things went downhill from there. The extreme  noise from the pool area starts around 430pm & doesn’t abate until 11pm nightly. The hotel is very upmarket in all other areas. For example, in the lobby area they have someone playing on the piano which is quite nice. The noise from the pool is unacceptable. Room windows are not glazed & even on level 8 the noise was incredibly loud. Not only that we were treated quite poorly by the staff. Someone knocked on our door to do a “room check“ when we had slept in but in fact we felt like they were checking on us. I purchased two glasses of champagne to take to the room, I signed for them and then was yelled at in the lobby by one of the staff from the bar telling me that I had to pay cash as it could not be posted to the room, even though I had signed for the drinks, I complained to the manager who sent to cupcakes to the room (!), but then the same thing happened only hours later when my husband’s very late laundry arrived in the room at 8pm as we were walking out and we were asked to pay cash as again it “could not be posted” to the room. We complained to the night manager but it’s simply not good enough. This never happens to us in any other hotel and we do travel extensively around the world. We provided our credit card at check-in. When we complained we were then told that the dry cleaning and the bars were all run separately.  So what? Also, the food & drinks are extremely overpriced ie Australian Oyster Bay worth AUD$17 is a whopping AUD$95 in their restaurants! I also got bitten by a bug that was in the pool which is in desperate need of repair, although fairly clean. There’s only about 10 deck chairs in the pool area, not enough for the amount of guests in the hotel
Beds were comfortable, the room was adequate and clean but the blinds didn’t close up so there’s a lot of light coming in to the room.
title: Extreme NOISE from pool every night

placeInfo/address: 48 Janadhipathi Mawatha, Colombo 00100 Sri Lanka
text:
The staff is friendly and helpful upon arrival and departure, appearing very officious and upscale.  However, the entire experience was tanked by the nightclub they seem to prioritize out at the pool.  Based on the postings in the elevator, it runs until midnight.  I had a 4:30 am flight and was trying to get some sleep prior to leaving the hotel at 12:00 am.  No such luck.  I was on the 4th floor above the pool, and up until I left it sounded like I had a DJ at the foot of my bed.  It was SO loud.  I was not alone in my complaints - the rest of my group hated the experience as well.  

Recommendation to management: pick a lane - upscale travelers retreat or downmarket nightclub.  If you can't decide, go for a third option - turn down the music and shut it off earlier.  I would recommend management try and sleep with it as it is now to really understand the experience you are offering your guests.
title: Nightclub not Sleep

text:
We arrived at the hotel lobby to a scene of chaos. Hordes of people, some trying to check-in, others guests from various functions and staff completely out of their depth. Felt like a railway station. We were a group of 6 and our passports were taken. We then just waited for over 20 minutes with no one telling us what was going on. Finally, when we complained, there was some excuse given about rooms. The chaos in the reception area continued all day and we were told there were 3 weddings and a corporate event being held, all at the same time! It did get better the next day. 

Our “pool view” room actually overlooked a car park, but if we squeezed into a corner near the window we could catch a glimpse of the pool! Our room had a cupboard door saying mini bar but there wasn’t even a fridge behind it. There appeared to have been a shortage of hand towels as all our group only received one between two people.

On the plus side, the breakfast was excellent. The room service staff were pleasant as were those at the reception desk. We had an early start and were provided with a good packed breakfast .

This a 5 star hotel and should ensure a calm atmosphere when guests are checking in or using the lobby area. There should be a separate entrance for private function attendees.
title: Would benefit from some improvements

text:
Been coming back to this hotel for 4 years now. Its a nice property. Breakfast has good spread but there seem to be some sort of miscommunication  everytime an order is placed via room these days. If you need service in room it's  super slow and  too many confusions. Houskeeping operator of evening hour is very rude  for some reason.  I tried Ordering some bottle of water to the Front office operator, houskeeping and in room  dining  thrice but they just wouldnt give me water even when I tried odering for  paid bottles. Spa is mediocre. Rooms need deep cleaning.Also, the rooms had human hairs lying around wash basin / shower cubicle. Houskeeping  ringing bell from 7 am for making room was also kind of inappropriate.  Tv internet is super slow.
Ocean  restaurant has good food in  budget. 
Cakes are amazing from the cake shop. Dont shop at zams jewellery  downstairs. Its a total rip off. Pool is amazing
title: Good property, need some fixing

text: We were here in February 2024 and we thought the hotel standard was acceptable and decided to return. Since our return we observed, the standard was not as we expected as our last time, there were one or two people who had time for us and we felt we were not appreciated as returning guests. to start with our room was basic and water was leaking from the drainage in the toilet giving us a terrible stench at times. The breakfast was fine, but the food served was cold and wasn't up to the standards. Overall the hotel location is great, accessible to restaurants, beach and the One Gallface Mall. Apart from this we are not at all impressed with the hotel, and the treatment we received.  Also as our flight was in the evening we asked for a late checkout, until 4 pm, but they insisted that if we stayed any longer than 3pm there will be added charges, despite us being away on our travels although we had already paid for our room for two weeks. However I'm very disappointed and I don't think we will come here again.
title: Not a good experience at Kingsbury Hotel Colombo

placeInfo/address: 48 Janadhipathi Mawatha, Colombo 00100 Sri Lanka
text:
I recently stayed at this beautiful and luxurious hotel that everyone raves about in the city and I definitely wanted to check it out myself. I travelled from Galle and pampered myself to a two night stay at The Kingsbury. 

The hotel is grand and very welcoming to smiling faces of staff working there and showering their warm hospitality upon everyone. The hotel was busy which was great for the business and team were on their toes to ensure a great experience for everyone staying or visiting. 
 
Coming to the positives - 

1. Food was outstanding everywhere. Tried 4-5 outlets throughout the stay and the food and hospitality at the F&B outlets was divine specially at Yue Chuan and Tenku. The F&B team was great and chefs really definitely did put their heart and soul into the cooking.

2. Spa at the hotel was amazing. Really professional therapists and the team at the reception was truly welcoming and ensured a great experience during the therapies. I did have a suggestion and have already mentioned it to the spa team and that is to keep some loofahs at the spa on request for those guests to do choose to take a shower there itself. 

3. Gymnasium was well equipped and definitely maintained to a great standard.

Unfortunately there were a few hiccups as well. 

1. First and foremost , I was actually given a key to an occupied room on arrival. The guest occupying the room was lady and she was getting her makeup done when I walked in assuming she must be at the hotel for an event. However it was very embarrassing for both of us as she was in the middle of getting ready and I just invaded her privacy unknowingly. I definitely apologised for the inconvenience and went back to the reception and did let the team know. They mentioned that due to Houskeeping’s negligence, the room was marked ready as per their system. I hope they did speak to the guest and made sure everything was fine ! It was surely a very big inconvenience to the guest occupying the room and myself ! Unfortunately nothing was done post that by the team with regard to the same. 

2. I had placed my order for lunch through room service upon arrival in the new room  however the team member who delivered the food requested for the payment to be done at the same time rather than posting it to the room. It was actually the case for all the outlets I visited and none of them billed the checks to the room. Unfortunately not all the in-house guests like to carry their credit cards along to every space of the hotel they visit. Looked quite odd but that might just be the hotel policy unfortunately it was not informed upon arrival. 

3. I had placed an order through the beach club for lunch on the day of departure which took about an hour and a half to be delivered to the room. I had reconfirmed with the employee at the beach club about the delivery and he over excitedly mentioned to have it served without an issue within 20-25 minutes. However after two follow-ups once through the reception and second through the room service, the order was finally served.

There were a few ups and downs about The Kingsbury however overall what I had heard off about the service and hospitality unfortunately that little spark was missing which could have definitely elevated the entire stay experience i was hoping for !
title: Hit and miss experience at the icon of Colombo !

Thank you for taking the time to share your detailed feedback about your recent stay at our hotel. We sincerely appreciate your observations and are grateful for your constructive comments.

We are pleased to hear that you enjoyed the peaceful beach environment, the quality of the buffet meals, and the dedication of our staff. It is also wonderful to know that you had a positive experience with the water aerobics and yoga classes, which we strive to offer to our guests.

However, we deeply regret that certain aspects of your stay did not meet your expectations. We sincerely apologize for the delays during check-in and the issues with your room setup. This is not the standard of service we aim to provide, and we will address these matters with our team to ensure that we are more efficient in the future.

Additionally, we are concerned to hear about the cleanliness of the sanitary facilities in the pool area. Rest assured, we will take immediate action to improve the maintenance and cleanliness in this regard, as we understand the importance of these areas in a 5-star hotel experience.

Your feedback is invaluable to us, and we are committed to making the necessary improvements to enhance our guests' experience. We hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back in the future, with the assurance that we will provide a higher standard of service.

Thank you again for your comments, and we wish you all the best in your future travels.

Warm regards,
Sahan
placeInfo/address: 1 Okanda Road, Hiddaruwa, Naape Hiddaruwa, Naape, Kosgoda 80570 Sri Lanka
text:
Wir waren im Februar eine Woche vor Ort. Aufgrund der Werbung als Strandhotel erwartet man Liegen am Strand, die jedoch nicht zum Hotel gehören, sondern von Einheimischen vermietet werden. Der Strand selbst war schön, sauber, absolut ruhig ohne Touristentrubel und Spaziergänge entlang des Strandes möglich. Eine einzelne Strandverkäufern, die ihre Ware aber unaufdringlich angeboten hat.
Vom Hotel selbst waren wir etwas enttäuscht und von der Sheraton-Familie Besseres gewohnt. Begonnen hat es bei der Ankunft, nachmittags gegen 15:15 angekommen mussten wir fast eine Stunde im Reception-Bereich warten, da das Zimmer nicht fertig war. Abgesehen vom gewohnten Begrüssungsgetränk wurde während der längeren Wartezeit nichts weiter angeboten. Dann endlich im Zimmer angekommen gab es für das Beistellbett noch keine Bettwäsche und einen dritten Sessel für den Balkon mussten wir extra anfordern, am dritten Tag bereits das Duschgel leer.
Was aber besonders unangenehm aufgefallen ist war, dass  die Sanitäranlagen im Poolbereich im Hinblick auf Reinlichkeit zu wünschen übrig lassen. So etwas sollte in 5-Sterne-Hotels keinesfalls passieren!
Positive Aspekte:  Das Essen in Buffetform morgens und abends war ausgezeichnet, mit jeweils sehr großer Auswahl und in guter Qualität. Die Angestellten sehr zuvorkommend und bemüht.
An Sportangeboten haben wir täglich Wassergymnastik mitgemacht, der Vorturner war sehr nett und hat die Stunde auch immer sehr lustig abgehalten. 
Besonders hervorzuheben waren die Yoga-Einheiten, der Trainer war immer sehr bemüht und ist auf die Teilnehmer einzeln eingegangen.
Fazit: Gutes Hotel mit ein paar Mankos, die sicherlich verbessert werden können.
title: Gutes Hotel, sind aber von 5-Sterne-Hotels Besseres gewohnt

placeInfo/address: 1 Okanda Road, Hiddaruwa, Naape Hiddaruwa, Naape, Kosgoda 80570 Sri Lanka
text:
Хороший отель, чистый. Вокруг потрясающая природа, красивые закаты, чистый пляж, волны здесь загляденье! Номера чистые, ежедневная уборка. Еда вкусная и разнообразная, любители острого так же оценят)) так же много разнообразных фруктов, десертов, морепродуктов) Голодными не останетесь! Персонал приветливый старается, подсказывает, все что требуется оформят и принесут. Отдельное спасибо Ольге за помощь при заселении, да и в целом за консультацию) на пляже познакомились с местным гидом Банду, однозначно рекомендую его, вот его номер +94 77 783 6537. Банду хорошо говорит по русски, организует вам индивидуальные экскурсии, на личном авто с кондиционером👍 возил только нас, цены ниже чем у остальных, при чем остальные ездят на групповых автобусах, а тут на своем авто катают) посетили много интересных мест: чайные плантации, катались на слонах и купались вместе с ними)) катались на поезде, фото на 9 арочном мосту) кормили черепах, обезьян, посещали водопады)так же были в национальном парке) и все это Недорого организовал Банду! Если нужно в другие дни съездить в магазин или аптеку, банду абсолютно бесплатно нас так же возил на своем автомобиле! Однозначно рекомендую данного гида👍 Банду от нас привет😁 
В целом отдыхом остались довольны!
title: Отдых на Шри, Косгода

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Claudia,

Greetings from Sheraton Kosgoda Turtle Beach Resort!

Thank you for sharing your feedback with us. We're happy to hear that you enjoyed the beautiful beach and found our staff friendly and accommodating. However, we truly appreciate you bringing the other aspects of your stay to our attention.

We’d like to clarify that shower gel is provided in a pump bottle as part of our sustainable initiative to reduce waste. We understand that this may not have been clear, and we will make sure to communicate this better in the future.

Regarding the beach loungers, these are provided by local villagers as part of their livelihood, which is why there is a charge to use them. We hope you understand that this is an arrangement that supports the local community. However, we do offer ample sun loungers by the pool and in the garden for our hotel guests, free of charge, for a relaxing experience.

We also apologize for the issue with pool loungers being reserved without use. This is something we are actively working on addressing to ensure a more relaxed and enjoyable environment for all our guests.

Thank you again for your comments, and we hope to welcome you back for an even better experience next time.

Best Regards,
Sahan
placeInfo/address: 1 Okanda Road, Hiddaruwa, Naape Hiddaruwa, Naape, Kosgoda 80570 Sri Lanka
text:
Wir wollten ein schönes Hotel am Strand und das würde ja passen
Die Zimmer sind ok aber irgendwie wirkt alles sehr steril.
In der Dusche gibt es kein showergel aber 2x conditioner - eine Kleinigkeit aber es zeigt die gewisse Schlampigkeit die man bei Bonvoy nicht gewohnt ist
Das Personal ist super freundlich und bemüht 
Der Pool ist groß allerdings ist die Zahl der Liegen überschaubar und ein guter Teil wird morgens reserviert ohne das jemand da ist - dadurch ist 
dann so gut wie nichts frei und nur 40% der Liegen sind wirklich besetzt
Der Strand ist schön es gibt da auch Liegen, aber die muss man bezahlen - schade bei einem strandurlaub in einem Strandhotel 
Beim Check out muss man von einem Schalter zum nächsten obwohl 5 Personen herumstehen und nur schauen.
Die Nacht ist mit knapp 200€ nicht so günstig um so viele Kleinigkeiten zu übersehen
title: Sehr bemüht und freundlich aber es fehlt der Charakter und Charme

text: Lovely location. The Staff at this hotel are amazing! So friendly and helpful.  The room was large enough and the bed comfortable, although the bathroom could do with updating. There is a huge pool which could do with being a bit colder to make it refreshing.  The sea is quite dramatic along this coastline and swimming is not recommended , but the beach is beautiful.  There is a little local restaurant a few yards down the beach which does fantastic seafood at very reasonable prices. Food in the hotel is very good . Keminda in the bar makes the best negronis in the world! He is also a lovely guy to talk to and spend time with.  The rooftop terrace  bar although advertised as open, isn't.  I found this out to my peril as I  entered a dark room and missed my step and fell. Staff , including the manager, were more than helpful and thankfully I didn't need medical attention. All in all a really good hotel.
title: Amazing staff !

I am going to simply say that the service in this hotel is amazing, however the hotel can do with some repairs.

But the person who made our stay amazing was our TukTuk driver Narada who was the kindest and most honest person I've seen in a long time. He was such a gentleman. I can't recommend him enough. 

If you want someone who understands all the requirements of a tourist especially those with children he is your man. If you ever stay in the Sheraton make sure you use him for your transportation. He took us everywhere. Even 1 hour drive to far-away locations. He knows the area very well and can recommend things to do with the kids. 

0094 77 841 1531 This is his number. Fantastic guy. Highly recommend.

Подушки и правда мягкие)
Но! Если если ехать в этот отель, то только на все включено. Во-первых, потому что он значительно отдален от таких курортов, как Бентота и Хиккадува. Во-вторых, цены на обед на двоих (по одному блюду и напитку) от 3 000 р. А в ресторане, в котором шведский стол фикса - 4000 р за обед на двоих. Еда абсолютно обычная, отельная, практически нет морепродуктов. Нас поселили на 2м этаже, с видом на детский бассейн (не критично), на балконе практически не проводили время. Но за $1000 предложили переехать на этаж выше, мы отказались. Номера просторные, приятные. Уборка регулярная. Но у нас была теневая сторона, купальники не сохли и не было даже веревочки на балконе, раскладывала на уличные кресла. Территория отеля небольшая. Хорошего размера бассейн и практически безлюдный. Пляж отличный, но опять же, поблизости нет ровным счетом ничего. Волны всегда большие, поэтому спасал бассейн. Персонал отеля приветливый и приятный, но практически никто не знает русский. Есть доступ на крышу здания, от туда офигенный вид на океан и джунгли. Отдельно спасибо официанту Avishka, приятный улыбчивый молодой человек. А ещё будьте готовы, что к любому счету добавят налог+чаевые 30%, и если вы поели на 15 000 рупий, то заплатите 20 000 рупий. Но такова жизнь, такова жизнь.
title: Честно и по делу

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Valued Guest, 

Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback about your recent stay at Sheraton Kosgoda Turtle Beach Resort. We sincerely appreciate your detailed review and are pleased to hear that you enjoyed various aspects of your experience. 

We would like to express our gratitude for your positive comments regarding the pool bar team, especially Gayan, Nuintha, and their manager. It is delightful to know that you found the cooking stations and staff to be commendable. We take pride in our dedicated and attentive staff members who aim to make our guests' stays memorable. 

We also appreciate your constructive feedback on areas where we can improve. We apologize for any inconvenience caused by noise disturbances and will certainly look into ways to mitigate such issues in the future. Your comments regarding insect protection is well noted, and I would like to clarify that Sri Lanka is a tropical country and along with the monsoon rain, we do experience the breeding of mosquitos. We do have a treatment in place to combat the breeding. It is our utmost priority to protect our guests as well as our associates.

I have carefully noted your concern about the temperature of our cuisine and have addressed the same with the culinary team. We understand your observations about scheduled activities and the closure of the rooftop bar during your stay. Please be assured that we are actively enhancing our offerings and facilities to provide a more well-rounded experience for our guests. Regarding your comment about the behavior of some guests, we regret any discomfort you may have experienced. While we cannot control the actions of individual guests, we do strive to create an inclusive and respectful environment for everyone. We appreciate your understanding on this matter. 

Once again, thank you for sharing your thoughts with us. We value your feedback, as it helps us identify areas for improvement. We sincerely hope this experience will not deter you from visiting us in the future, and we are delightfully waiting to welcome you back to extend exceptional service. 

At your service, we remain.  

Sincerely,
Mano Gunasekera
placeInfo/address: 1 Okanda Road, Hiddaruwa, Naape Hiddaruwa, Naape, Kosgoda 80570 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Insektenschutz!
text:
Mäßiger Aufenthalt mit Höhen und Tiefen.
Vorab das Positive. Die Jungs von der Poolbar, Gayan, Nuintha und ihr Boss, waren spitze. Die Kochstationen und das dortige Personal ebenso. Generell gehörte das Personal zu dem aufmerksamsten und besten, welches wir auf unserer Reise erlebt haben. 
Der Strand ist bombastisch. Ziemlich sauber und vor allem leer. In der Nähe sind keine größeren Hotels. Abends spielen die Einheimischen Beachvolleyball und nehmen einen freudig auf. Man wird zwar von ein paar Verkäufern angesprochen, jedoch nicht aufdringlich.
Die Zimmer sind großzügig und sauber.

Die negativen Punkte. 
Sollte ihr Zimmer auf der Ostseite liegen, lassen Sie sich mindestens eines im zweiten Stockwerk geben, denn im Erdgeschoss sind private Pools mit entsprechender Geräuschkulisse. 
Das Hotel ist von einem Wassergraben und viel Natur umgeben. Sobald die Dämmerung eintritt, ist Insektenschutz nötig.
Das Essen war zwar reichhaltig, international und lokal, jedoch kalt.
Für Gäste mit unangenehmen Gewohnheiten und Manieren, wie Russen und Chinesen, kann das Hotel zwar nichts, manchmal habe ich mir jedoch einen Aufruf zur Mäßigung gewünscht.
Terminierte Aktivitäten wie Sport haben selten stattgefunden und die Rooftopbar war leider während unseres gesamten Aufenthaltes geschlossen.
title: Höhen und Tiefen

placeInfo/address: 1 Okanda Road, Hiddaruwa, Naape Hiddaruwa, Naape, Kosgoda 80570 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Dont think you will get an Ocean View room. Its only partial ocean view.
text:
Do not go by the claims of Ocean View rooms of the hotel. All their rooms have only a partial Ocean View with most of them having the view of Mangroves and a small view of the Ocean. The hotel is misleading customers by advertising a Ocean View. Only their suites have a complete Ocean View. 

That being said, the hotels location is by the beach, it has a wonderful and large pool and the food is superb, be it breakfast or dinner. 
The rooms are fine, though my room had a clogged overflowing bathroom and despite complaining and the personnel trying to rectify the situation, the bathroom was still overflowing.

However, others in our group were pretty happy with their rooms, except for the Ocean View part, which we felt ripped off, and have deducted 2 stars for that.
title: Good Hotel, false advertising of room views

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for choosing to stay with us and for taking the time to provide this feedback. We greatly appreciate your input.
And, we would like to address the concerns you raised during your stay.

 As my team informed you on-site, we conducted a comprehensive investigation into the matter you mentioned. Our findings, however, indicate that there might have been a misunderstanding regarding the situation.

I would like to clarify that our hotel does not offer an all-inclusive meal plan. Your agent reserved a room for you on Full Board basis, which covers three meals—Dinner on the arrival day, followed by breakfast and lunch on the subsequent day. To accommodate your preference, and as a gesture of goodwill, we offered you lunch instead of breakfast on the following day incurring an internal cost.

Our standard check-in time is 3pm. Nevertheless, we were pleased to arrange an early check-in and had the rooms prepared ahead of time. Our commitment is to prioritize the comfort and satisfaction of our valued guests, and our team works diligently to uphold this standard.

The delay in the check-in process was due to a delay on the part of your agent in finalizing the reservation and payment. We took every measure to ensure your comfort during this time, extending all possible assistance until your agent completed the booking process. Ideally, such procedures should be completed in advance, similar to how they are handled for our other guests.

We acknowledge your feedback regarding the dining time. In line with standard practices at upscale hotels, we inform our guests of the dining hours to ensure that everyone has ample time to enjoy the buffet service before it concludes.
As part of the world's largest Hospitality Company, we adhere to strict guidelines regarding food safety and health. 
Cooked meals are served and disposed of within approved timeframes. Our buffet service does not exceed four hours, and any refilling is carried out under the supervision of experienced professionals. The removal of food adheres to Marriott International standards, as it is our hotel's policy.

We consistently strive to comprehend the unique preferences of each guest, as your satisfaction remains our top priority. I am always happy to personally meet with guests, provided I am available on-site, and discuss any matters if time allows during your stay.

Your comments have been duly noted and shared with my team for potential improvements. Our ongoing goal is to make a positive impact through exceptional service, and we regret that you did not fully experience the renowned hospitality that Marriott is known for on this occasion.

We sincerely hope you continue to enjoy the current stay with us and to have the opportunity to welcome you back.

Best Regards,
Paul Sun, General Manager
placeInfo/address: 1 Okanda Road, Hiddaruwa, Naape Hiddaruwa, Naape, Kosgoda 80570 Sri Lanka
text:
Перед поездкой всегда читаю отзывы, бываю готова к негативу и в��бираю его осознанно. От этого отеля ожидала гораздо больше. Это моя 26 страна, в последние годы отдыхаем в отелях такой же ценовой категории. 
Началось с заезда. Приехали, нас оформили, попросили подождать пока не готов номер. Ок. Не сезон, низкая загрузка, но приготовить 3 номера вовремя невозможно. У нас все включено. Время 13.30, в последний раз ели вечером в самолете. Сотрудники сообщили, что если мы пообедаем сейчас, они нас не будут кормить завтраком. Это просто невероятно, то есть если нам задержат вылет, то в этот день нас кормить не будут, только за деньги. Почему то, что люди не будут есть, когда едут на экскурсии, они не считают. 
Далее по поводу работы заезда. В 15 часов сотрудники сделали нам сообщение, что от турагента нет оплаты, они нас не заселят. Никаких предложений, полное равнодушие. Пару, которая приехала с нами заселили. Пока мы выясняли, поднимали всех на ноги, платеж нашелся, нас заселили в 16 часов. Отельный гид сказал, что они просто не успели подготовиться, ведь накануне было воскресенье. Никаких извинений, никакого сочувствия даже от главного менеджера не было, всем все равно. Даже в нищей танзании и бедной кубе такого отношения я не встречала. 
Кормят вкусно, наливают местные напитки, средне. Еду, номера описали верно во всех предыдущих отзывах. Номера хорошие, новые. Отель очень маленький, особо там делать нечего. 
Еще маленькая ремарка, характеризующая отношение. На обеде в 14.45 всех обошли сотрудники, сообщив, что столовая закрывается в 15.00. Видимо, тех кто не успел, выведут) 
Все- таки первое знакомство с нацией начинается с общения с сотрудниками отеля. Сейчас могу сказать, что в мире много стран, где за эти деньги можно отдохнуть с большим комфортом, с лучшим отношением. Я больше не вернусь однозначно и советовать эту страну никому не буду, если отель такого уровня так относится к гостям.
title: Неоднозначный отель

placeInfo/address: 1 Okanda Road, Hiddaruwa, Naape Hiddaruwa, Naape, Kosgoda 80570 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed for 1 night at the Sheraton Turtle Beach at the end of our trip around Sri Lanka.  

We arrived at the hotel at around 12 noon and told our room wasn't ready yet.  We decided to visit one of the nearby turtle hatcheries while we waited as it was only a few minutes up the beach from the hotel.   This visit only took about 20 mins as they usher you through very quickly and the beach area is very dirty with a lot of litter and glass so we returned to the hotel and sat in the pool bar to continue waiting.  Service was quite slow as the hotel seems to offer an all inclusive option as well as standard guests (and we didn't have a room number yet to add our drinks to).

Our room was available at 2pm and we collected our keys from reception.  We had been upgraded to a Junior Suite which had a great view over the pool  and had an extra lounge area.  Bed was very comfortable and good wardrobe space.  There was a safe in the room however it didn't work.  

We spent a bit of time at the pool which is huge and was relatively quiet until about 5pm.  Towels are provided and there are plenty of sunloungers.

When we had booked the hotel we had understood the hotel to have a number of restaurants and bars, however the  pool bar only really offered snacks and the main restaurant is a buffet restaurant for the All Inclusive guests so not really what we wanted.  We saw a sign advertising a Happy Hour offer so decided to check it out... however we were the only people there in an odd conference suite set-up with 2 different sets of music playing and slow service.

We went to the SHO Lounge in the reception area for dinner as it advertised a Tapas menu.  Realistically it has a small menu of bar type food of which we ordered a starter to share and burgers each as a main course.  My husbands burger arrived.  He ate as it was already going cold (with overcooked fries).  I chased our other food.  Our starter then arrived.  Then finally my burger arrived.  Really poor service and no apology.

This was a 1 night stay and opportunistic to see the turtles (which the experience is really not worth it) and reduce our travel time back to the airport for an early flight.  The rooms and the pool are nice enough, however the F&B offering in the hotel is a disaster and this is important when you have a hotel in the middle of nowhere!  Quite honestly if I had to book it again, I wouldn't.
title: Not a great experience

text:
Property was excellent. We stayed at the Ocean Suite from 30th Oct to 1st Nov 2022. We were just not happy with front desk staff. We had requested an extra bed as we were 3 of us.They just put an extra bed without a blanket. I called at the front desk for the blanket, the lady on the phone bluntly refused by saying that they don't usually provide a blanket for extra bed. We were shocked as we paid booked their suites and yet no blanket was provided. But then she said if you want we can provide as if she was obliging me. We felt very bad. This experience was like a 2 star hotel. And imagine with the AC on the whole day how one can sleep without a blanket?
That was very rude behavior of that lady. I called them up thrice after which they sent. We never expected such sort of an attitude.
For the food quality I will rate it 5 stars. 
An Indian Chef Mr. Bhagat Singh was very very courteous. As we are pure vegetarian he provided us with the excellent vegetarian dishes. The taste was outstanding. Two full days he really took very good care of us. Also Mr. Ajit Kumar was another  brilliant chef, he provided us with excellent breakfast every day. We would like to sincerely thank them for their hospitality. Restaurant service also was outstanding. But we were just not happy with front desk staff.
title: Below average hospitality except chefs, who were great

text:
I stayed at Taj Samudra from December 14th to 17th and had an overall average experience. The twin bed in my room was uncomfortable, and despite requesting assistance from the Front Office team, they couldn’t provide an alternative, which made it difficult to get a restful sleep.

Additionally, the room was in need of maintenance — the drawer handle had fallen off, and the drawers were in poor condition, posing a safety risk. I was also given a room on a renovated floor, but the addition of a bathtub wasn’t a great option as it took up unnecessary space and wasn’t functional for me.

On a positive note, the restaurant offered a great selection of food, and the variety was delicious.

While the dining experience was enjoyable, the room quality and comfort left a lot to be desired.

Overall Needs More Care !!
title: Stay at Taj Samudra

text: I stayed with my family at the Taj Samudra.  The overall experience was very average and not up to the standards of Taj or a 5-star hotel.  First the positives: the pool and gym are great.  The check-in process was made remarkable by the unhelpfulness and attitude of the person at the check-in. It was almost as if she was uninterested in us and in answering any questions.  The room itself was okay, good view of Galle Face and the ocean but a little dated, and soon we discovered a number of issues - two outlets did not work, the fridge didn't work, the AC didn't cool, there was no kettle, etc. The maintenance person came by and tried to fix most of these or found some workaround. However, the experience got more bizarre as they seem to have a policy of rationing the towels.  On one day we were given no towels whatsoever and had to call to get more.  On other days we were not given enough towels.  We then ordered some sparkling water and asked the person to leave the bottle opener so we could open the bottles.  He said it was policy to not leave a bottle opener!  I understand that they may have their reasons, but it seems ridiculous to stay at a 5-star hotel and have to worry about there not being enough towels in the room, or not being left a bottle opener.  Finally, the food was moderate - the kids enjoyed the chicken nuggets but the dinner buffet was nowhere near what the other 5-star hotels in Colombo have to offer.  Overall I was really looking forward to our stay at the Taj but it was a very underwhelming experience, I would not stay here again.
title: Wouldnt go back

placeInfo/address: Kaluwamodara, Beruwala 12070 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Pool facing rooms are the best as you can see the beach as well.
text:
After some lovely hotels on our Sri Lankan tour this was a little bit of a let down. It has apparently had money spent on it and from what we could make out it was spent on the reception area and common rooms. The rooms themselves were of very average quality. Our first room had wallpaper that appeared to have seen stained all over for a significant period of time. The room doors were very ordinary and showing their age. My wife wiped the cloths rack used to dry clothes and the cloth was so dirty it was beyond belief. The alternative room was a little better and we decided to make the best of things.
The restaurant was of a reasonable quality given that it was the international buffet variety.
The staff were the main asset of this hotel. They went out of their way to be helpful and the concierge was excellent. Be aware the tuck tuck fixer on the door is open to significant negotiation. He offered us one journey at 7,000 rupees but when challenged dropped it to 5,000 and even this was on the high side.
There are a lot of hotels in this area. This one is OK but they are going to have to buck up their ideas and spend some money on the rooms if they are going to compete.
title: Maybe a little overrated in it's own opinion

On the matter of the all-inclusive menu ordering process and wristbands, we apologize for any inconvenience caused. Your comments are invaluable to us as we continually refine our guest experience. We will look into these aspects to ensure smoother and more comfortable dining and leisure experiences for our guests. The upkeep of our beach area is typically of a high standard, and we are disappointed to learn of the litter issue you encountered. The Management,
Occidental Eden Beruwala
placeInfo/address: Kaluwamodara, Beruwala 12070 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Avoid the ‘Garden’ Rooms.
text:
We recently stayed at the Occidental and overall had a pleasant experience. The hotel itself is lovely, the food is decent, and the staff are exceptionally friendly and attentive.

However, there are a few areas where improvements could be made to enhance the guest experience. For example, the entertainment schedule wasn’t clearly advertised. While the live singers and bands were talented, the sets felt repetitive, with the same songs being performed every night. A bit more variety would really elevate the atmosphere.

A word of advice to future guests: avoid booking a ‘garden’ room. The view from ours was quite unpleasant, and despite raising the issue with the staff, the alternative rooms offered had either the same or worse views. We ultimately paid for a room upgrade at $25 per night, which improved our experience significantly, but it’s a shame we had to do so to fully enjoy our stay.

One small inconvenience we encountered was being asked for our room number and to sign a receipt every time we ordered food or drinks from the all-inclusive menu. While minor, it became a bit tiresome over time.

Another point to mention is the all-inclusive wristbands. They were surprisingly sharp, and we found ourselves having to modify them to avoid constant scratching.

It would also be helpful if the hotel advertised that you can order from the all-inclusive menu at the à la carte restaurant between 3-6pm. We stumbled upon this by chance, but clearer communication on this perk would be appreciated.

Lastly, while the hotels beach was well maintained, the area directly next to it was littered with rubbish. This really detracted from the beach experience, and we only visited once because of it.

Overall, we had an enjoyable stay, and with a few adjustments, this could be an even better hotel experience.
title: Enjoyable stay with room for improvement.

ownerResponse/text:

roomTip: Do not expect international food items in Buffet Breakfast & Meat products in the A-la-carte menu to International standards.
text:
Breakfast - a very few and poorly prepared international food items were on the buffet. Hence, my husband hardly enjoyed the breakfast. Regarding LIVE cooking station there were long queues since only 1 staff on each was preparing. Though many management/supervisors going around yet did not pay attention for it and resolve the problem.
Pool - on our last day there was extremely high music played just on the edge of Pool Bar towards the pool.
Room - there were some toiletries missing so we had to request.
Dinner in A-la-carte restaurant - my husband ordered Pork Chops, and he received a pork chop not only thinker than 0.2 centimeter but 80% of it was full of bones and fat. He shown that to the waiter & supervisor. They seen it and offered another one, but my husband refused. Then when the bill presented, they did not remove it, then my husband asked do I have to pay for 20% meat & for tiny bit of vegetables?? Then only they said we will remove the item from the bill.

When we reserved it was mentioned on the Booking.com that late check-out is possible if rooms available. When we were there, we were told by staff only 60% occupied since it was "off season" in that area.
Since we were coming to Colombo for another few day’s holiday we wanted to spend bit more time in the Pool, so requested a late check-out, just 2 hrs. more.
Receptionist we asked about it said he will come back to us since the Manager is having his meal at that time, and he is only one know rooms allocation (a strange comment?). We told him we are going to the Pool now (it was around 10:30 hrs.) still he said he will find us & inform. He never turned up, then 30 mts. before normal check-out time i.e. 12:00 I walked to the Reception with bathing cloths to find him to understand whether we can or cannot. He was not there, and another receptionist said the hotel is fully booked, so we have to check-out at 12:00 hrs. That time we had only 20 mts. left to go to the room, have shower, pack & leave the room. While we were rushing in the room another Receptionist called 5 mts. before 12:00 & said we have to check-out at 12:00 hrs. We said that is what we are trying.
We were very disappointed & annoyed that the 1st Receptionist who we talked did not bother to inform us in advance it is not possible to late check-out (though half of the hotel was empty), but was very much busy in rushing us out from the room.
title: Disappointed with food & service though the Hotel is a nice property

placeInfo/address: Kaluwamodara, Beruwala 12070 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Watch out for weekends, food options are limited on all inclusive and make sure you watch the sun sets!
text:
We chose this hotel for a family holiday booked via TUI for a special milestone birthday celebration, and like many of us was hugely influenced by Tripadvisor and google reviews.

I know this is important to the hotel so I will start with a few words on the staff who are out of this world, they genuinely care about making guest experiences as best as possible. I would specifically call out the bar staff, pool guys, beach/garden and the restaurant team. Collectively and individually outstanding. 

It is no way a 5 star resort, it’s 4 on a good day and a million miles away from what Barcelo describe.

Postives

The staff - as mentioned above the best.
The beach - although you have to get over being approached by people trying to sell you a river cruise that literally hang around the gate leading to the beach/sea, an assortment of wild dogs that are super friendly and a family of cows.  The beach itself is stunning as are the sunsets.  Just be very careful in the sea as massive rip tides which saw a number of swimmers needing rescuing.
The food at the SIPPI restaurant and amazing service from Anthony and Madu.

I also want a say a massive thank you to all the staff who arranged for a birthday celebration on the beach. Beyond memorable.

Areas of improvement 

The food.  If you go all inclusive I know it can differ from hotel to hotel so to avoid any misunderstanding this is what TUI offers from their website

You can pick from a trio of restaurants, including a buffet place.

Or Barcelo who proudly state 

You will be amazed by the exclusive culinary experience provided by the hotel restaurants and the wide variety of dining spaces on offer. 

The reality as an all inclusive guest was very limited, very confusing and with the exception of Sippi not very good.

To start with there are rules that seemingly change depending on who you talk to and when.

To be very clear as an all inclusive guest. Breakfast is served in the restaurant as is lunch (although you can take it at the pool bar or sippi after 2,30 - not before). Dinner is average and very repetitive buffet and served…yep you guessed it in the restaurant.  Unless you want to eat in SIPPI where you may get a 30% discount. We hate eating in the same place every night and made the choice based on the descriptions from TUI and Barcelo, which are simply not correct. It took a major escalation to get a deviation away from this for lunch and really left a sour taste in our mouths. No pun intended. I will also mention the hotel executive who intervened as my wife, by now was distraught. I was ready for book another hotel!

There is no roof top bar which is also comedically advertised.

The interior of property itself is tatty, paint peeling off walls and I appreciate it’s difficult with the humidity but this is meant to be…a 5 star resort.  The rooms are ok although we did have to move half way through our stay as we had a termite infestation, which resulted in termite poop all over the coffee area that wouldn’t be able to be fixed in the short term. Although curiously our former room was occupied the following day.

One thing also to consider is the hotel run promotions for locals which means at the weekend it can get very busy. To the point of being advised to get to breakfast before 7.30 to get a table. The same on a night when they ran out of tables. I understand the need to get paying guests in but when you can’t move and the hotel can’t get enough food out, it’s just not what you want for that exclusive Barcelo culinary experience.

The oddity of all this is that we would probably return, purely because of the staff who made us feel so welcome and 100% not via TUI who were beyond useless and have a feel that of the £9k we paid them, not a vast amount ended up with the hotel.

Final point, and this seems to be more an more common. Reviews, we were asked to make one within 24h of arriving stating staff members names as the Hotel is in competition with another. I really don’t like this and when I look further into the reviews many only have one, so question the authenticity plus consider how many management responses are made to those that are less than positive.
title: A truly honest review of the Eden Occidental - read before you book!

roomTip: Maybe if you get a great discount it will be a a good deal.
text:
The best part of this hotel are the grounds. They obviously take great care with the plants, the floors are polished multiple times a week. There are no stray dogs or annoying crows or aggressive squirrels to ruin your time at the pool/beach. But that also about where the justification for the high price ends. 

The rooms are small. We had booked a triple for two adults and a child and they first tried to pass off a double room. They fixed the mistake when we complained but at this price, it just should not have happened. 

The bathroom is mostly clean, but goodness, the fixtures are totally disgusting. We even tipped the cleaners extra to clean the fixtures properly and they did not. 

The food is ok - if you don’t count the day they served raw chicken skewers off the grill. The buffets are extremely repetitive , last nights dinner rolls are served for breakfast the next morning so…. 🤷🏼‍♂️

It was not worth the price we paid and I don’t think I would go again. 

The service was good, but honestly, I have never been to a beach resort in Sri Lanka with bad service.
title: Overpriced

ownerResponse/text:
Cher hôte,

Merci beaucoup pour le temps que vous avez consacré à partager vos impressions personnelles sur votre séjour au sein de notre hôtel Occidental Eden Beruwala, A Member Of Barcelo Hotel Group. Nous accueillons toujours de bon gré les commentaires de nos hôtes car ceux-ci nous permettent d'améliorer constamment les expériences que nous délivrons.

Nous sommes navrés d'apprendre que certains aspects de votre expérience n'ont pas répondu à vos attentes, notamment la qualité de l'eau de baignade à marée basse. Votre commentaire nous est précieux et nous prenons note de cette situation.

Nous regrettons également que la literie n'ait pas été à la hauteur de vos attentes et que la vue depuis votre chambre n'ait pas été des plus agréables. Concernant la nourriture, notre équipe s'efforce de proposer une cuisine variée et nous sommes désolés que vous l'ayez trouvée trop épicée. L'indisponibilité du snack a manifestement été un désagrément et nous regrettons les inconvénients causés.

En ce qui concerne l'animation, nous sommes désolés que vous n'ayez pas pu en profiter pleinement lors de votre séjour. Soyez assuré que cela ne reflète pas notre standard habituel de service.

Cependant, nous sommes ravis de constater que vous avez trouvé notre emplacement face à l'océan idéal et que la propreté de l'hôtel ainsi que l'accueil de notre personnel ont été à la hauteur de vos attentes. De plus, nous sommes heureux que les excursions et les interactions avec les locaux aient été des moments forts de votre séjour, vous permettant de découvrir la beauté et la culture de notre pays.

Encore merci pour votre aimable appréciation sur notre hôtel, nous espérons vous avoir à nouveau bientôt parmi nous. 
Cordialement

The Management
placeInfo/address: Kaluwamodara, Beruwala 12070 Sri Lanka
text:
Nous avons séjourné dans cet hôtel suite à une réservation Framissima Prémium
Nous n'avons pas trouvé les services habituellement proposés pour une telle réservation ce qui explique la note générale et celle concernant le rapport qualité / prix
L'emplacement semble idéal face à l'océan, c'est une belle carte postale mais en fonction de la marée, on se baigne dans l'eau de la mangrove (eau douce et marron). Après avoir visité la mangrove, on se rend compte que c'est une poubelle ! Il y a des courants se qui limite la baignade
L'hôtel est propre, le personnel est accueillant mais pas francophone. C'est donc parfait pour un hôtel étape ou partenaire
Pour nous la literie était inconfortable et la vue pas terrible (usine de traitement de l'eau)
La nourriture est très épicée même lorsque c'est indiqué le contraire. C'est difficile de se rabattre sur le snack car il n'est pas ouvert. Après quelques jours, nous avons compris qu'il fallait négocier avec le bar pour commander car les plats sont préparés au restaurant.
Concernant l'animation, inexistante la première semaine car le personnel était malade ou absent. Le soir, une ambiance musicale au bar. Avant notre départ, nous avons assisté au spectacle des animateurs (limite malaisant et d'une durée de 30mn)
Nos vacances n'ont pas été gâchées pour autant car à l'occasion de plusieurs excursions nous avons rencontrés des personnes touchantes et visités un magnifique pays. A aucun moment, nous avons eu le sentiment de tomber dans un attrape touriste. D'ailleurs la plus pas du temps, il y avant autant de locaux que d'étranger dans les endroits visités.
Il faut prévoir de la route pour se rendre sur les lieux des visites
title: Hôtel agréable

ownerResponse/text:

Nos complace saber que la ubicación de nuestro hotel fue de su agrado, ofreciendo un fácil acceso a la playa y una experiencia agradable en la piscina.

Atentamente

Дорогой гость,

Мы рады слышать, что Вы оценили чистоту нашего отеля, а также ежедневное обслуживание номеров и бассейна. Наша команда прилагает все усилия, чтобы поддерживать высокий уровень комфорта для наших гостей.

Касательно Вашего опыта с заселением, мы искренне сожалеем о возникшей ситуации и понимаем, как важно ощущение комфорта с первых минут пребывания. Мы постоянно стремимся улучшать процесс приема гостей и хотим заверить Вас, что Ваш случай был исключением из правил. 
Что касается номеров с видом на океан, мы стараемся четко информировать наших гостей о характеристиках каждой категории номеров, и мы приносим извинения, если предоставленная информация была не достаточно ясной.

С наилучшими пожеланиями,

The Management
placeInfo/address: Kaluwamodara, Beruwala 12070 Sri Lanka
text: В целом отель не плохой для Шри Ланки, имейте ввиду что 5* на Шри-Ланке это не 5* той же Турции, гостиничный фонд изначально уступает. В гостинице чисто, номера и бассейн убирают каждый день, еда стандарт по гостиницам, голодными не останетесь, есть из чего выбрать, вкусные блюда с морепродуктами, с мясом дела не очень, все жесткое, но остальное очень даже прилично. В пешей доступности ресторанчиков не видели,  хорошо что взяли все включено. Есть номера с видом на океан, НО на самом деле вид на океан есть в исключительных номерах высшей категории, коих не много, гостиница в виде подковы, и  номера с видом на океан на самом деле с видом на бассейн и если повезёт с этажом, то увидите клочек океана. У нас была не приятная ситуация с заселением, бронировали номер с видом на океан, дают номер с видом на стену, номер убитый, оторванные металлические планки от мебели, сильный запах плесени и сырости. Мы сказали, что бронировали другой номер и в этом жить не будем, долго ждали менеджера, который нам сказал, что сейчас нашего номера нет, заселяйтесь сюда, а завтра дадим номер категории выше, но дело в том, чо номер категорией выше особо ни чем не отличался от нашего, и тот номер в который пытались заселить не пригоден вообще для проживания, далее долгие споры с менеджером и библио глобус, одно из самых неприятных, что привели нас в этот убитый сырой номер делая вид что так и надо, не сказав ни слова о замене, мы сказали что в сыром номере жить не будем, по итогу на сутки заселили в другой номер с видом на сад, а потом уже с "видом на океан" но вся эпопея заняла часа 4, мы летели всю ночь, устали, хотелось отдохнуть, а не портить настроение, потеряли по сути день отдыха. Но хочется отметить весь остальной персонал гостиницы, очень вежливый, улыбаются, просьбы выполняют, разговаривают с гостями так что ты чувствуешь себя действительно желанным гостем, за это хотим сказать спасибо, они быстро исправили наше настроение и отдых прошел отлично! Так же понравился бар в бассейне. Гостиница для тихого отдыха вдали от суеты
title: +-нормально

ownerResponse/text:
Sehr geehrter Gast,
vielen Dank, dass Sie sich für einen Aufenthalt im Occidental Eden Beruwala, A Member Of Barcelo Hotel Group entschieden haben und für Ihre ehrliche Bewertung.

Es tut uns leid zu hören, dass Ihr Zimmer mit Meerblick nicht Ihren Erwartungen entsprochen hat und die Sicht auf das Meer nicht so klar war, wie erhofft. Bezüglich der Preise für unseren Wein möchten wir klarstellen, dass es Unterschiede zwischen Haus- und importierten Weinen gibt, jedoch sollten diese klar kommuniziert werden. Wir werden dies intern noch einmal ansprechen, um Missverständnisse in Zukunft zu vermeiden.
Wir freuen uns jedoch, dass Sie den Strand und das Meer genießen konnten und die Qualität des Indischen Ozeans loben. Auch Ihr Hinweis auf die leckeren Speisen in den Strandbars und Ihre Empfehlung des Maharja ist für uns und andere Gäste sehr wertvoll.

Wir hoffen, Sie beim nächsten Mal gänzlich von uns überzeugen zu dürfen.
Mit freundlichen Grüßen,

The Management
placeInfo/address: Kaluwamodara, Beruwala 12070 Sri Lanka
text:
Nach Ende einer Rundreise haben wir dort noch 5 Tage Badeurlaub verbracht.
Die Empfangshalle ist pompös, das Zimmer mit "Meerblick" war es leider nicht.
Relativ klein und das Meer musste man erahnen. Die Liegen unter den Schirmen waren bereits in der früh reserviert. Der Strand und das Meer haben dies allerdings wieder wettgemacht. Indischer Ozean vom Feinsten.
Das Essen ist Durchschnitt und Vorsicht beim Wein. Hab für Glas Rotwein unterschiedliche Preise bezahlt. Angeblich gibt es Haus- und importierten Wein.
Wurde aber bei der Bestellung nie gefragt. Ist einfach nicht fair.
Mein Fazit: Das Hotel ist ok, aber bucht nur Frühstück. Leckeres und viel billigeres Essen gibt es an den Bars am Strand. Maharja kann ich nur empfehlen
title: Viel Schein statt Sein

Dear Guest,
Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback on your recent stay with us in CPB. We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed our selection of Sri Lankan cuisine, the spacious pool area, the well-maintained grounds, and the helpfulness of our staff. It's also great to know that you found your room to be a good size and the air conditioning quiet.
We appreciate your positive comments regarding the manager's assistance with the Coke Zero. We also understand your disappointment with the inclusions in our All-Inclusive package, particularly the exclusion of wine and bottled soft drinks.
We continuously review our offerings to ensure they meet the expectations of our guests while also allowing us to provide value. We note your feedback regarding the wine and will certainly take this into consideration as we evaluate our All-Inclusive options moving forward. We aim to be transparent about what is included in our packages, and we are sorry if this aspect of your stay was not entirely satisfactory.
Thank you again for your valuable feedback. We hope that the positive aspects of your stay will bring you back to visit us again in the future.

roomTip: Check what your All Inclusive package includes.
text: Great selection of Sri Lankan food.  I don't bother with the international offerings.  Pool area is massive with plenty of space to swim.  Grounds well maintained. Staff really helpful.  Rooms are a good size and the air con was quiet enough to sleep.  Unfortunately the All Inclusive didn't include wine and bottled soft drinks but the manager was very helpful regarding Coke Zero.  The low rating is because the All Inclusive package was disappointing although I understand that some premium drinks (eg Malt Whisky) may not be included.  I had to pay for wine, it wasn't expensive but I found it annoying.
title: Nice hotel but disappointed with the 'All Inclusive'

IL MANQUE CRUELLEMENT DE SERVICES AU RESTO.

Nous avons fait des excursions en dehors de l’hôtel avec un Guide local : il s’appelle Sasha que je recommande son numéro whatsapp +94 719699455.

placeInfo/address: Beach Rd, Marawila 61210 Sri Lanka
text:
Вот и закончилось наше путешествие на Шри-Ланку. Отель выбирали по отзывам и близости к аэропорту , так как ехали с детьми . Зайдя на ресепшен , увидев их стол , поняли , что 😂 «немного» приехали не туда 😂 
Были очень удивлены, что мало кто пишет о том, что номера просто ужасные ! Пол красит ноги . Доп кровати только за доплату и в принципе не понимают зачем нам доп кровать для ребенка и почему они не могут спать на одной 😂( возраст детей 8 лет и 10 ) , а кровать односпальная . Матрасы ужас ( такое ощущение, что на местом рынке на них сидели , а потом в отель приволокли₽! 
В 1 день добились , чтоб нам постелили 2х спальный матрас , а не 2 односпальных , но удивлению не было предела , когда на следующий день этот матрас исчез ! И ни хрена его не вернули (представитель от Анекса пытался-пытался этот вопрос порешать)  , но смог предложить только за 4 дня( а отдыхали мы 13 ночей) до выезда переселение в другой номер! И слава богу , что мы отказались 😂😂😂, так номер с выходом на канализацию, через пальмы 🌴 и деревья . 

Еда - макароны, рис (рис в рисе , рисом завернут 😂) , овощи (капуста, огурцы, помидоры). Фруктов толком нет (арбуз режут на квадратике , чтоб по-больше на тарелке было ) . Все острят так , что караул ! 

«все включено» - сразу говорю не такое как в Турции и Египте . Здесь завтрак/обед/ужин 
Заявление перекусы -это хлеб с маслом 😂, пирог и иногда могут кусочки рыбы в кляре дать - и всееее 🤷‍♀️🤦🏼‍♀️
Алкоголь до 23:30 и с 23:00 следять , как церберы , чтоб больше 2х бокалов в одни руки не давали .
На пляже лежаков 20 - все всегда заняты полотенцами.
На бассейне лежаков хватает , только , когда массовый выезд людей из отеля .

Прохладительные напитки 😂 - фанта/кола/вода (фото стола с этими напитками приложу).

Анимация -нулевая . 2 раза за день подойдут к микрофону , чет скажут и пропали .

Бассейн по длине норм , но он требует реставрации .

Уборка каждый день . Но только в номере 😂 балкон они номером не считают , но это мелочи .шампуни /гели сами не кладут (ну у нас так было) приходилось искать уборщика и просить . Потом плюнули и купили в магазине себе шампунь и гель .
Фен допотопный, хорошо , что взяли свой . 

За территорией все глухо . 4 ресторанчика поблизости , но готовят там хорошо . Рынок местный на тук-туке 5-10 минут . 

Единственный плюс -это территория. Большая , зеленая, ухоженная и восхитительная. Но живности кроме собак, котов и ворон нет 😂

Вернемся ли мы в этот отель ? Однозначно нет !
title: «Капля дёгтя -в бочку с медом»

placeInfo/address: Beach Rd, Marawila 61210 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Let's choose another hotel...
text:
I am surprised by the positive opinions about this hotel - in reality, it is a nicely located hotel with a three-star standard. Much would have to change in it to be considered a four-star hotel. A few examples of the terrible service we encountered:
- we arrived in the morning at around 6:00 and it turned out that our hotel day starts at 14:00 and that supposedly there were no rooms available at the moment... Half an hour later, a proposal suddenly appeared that if we pay 40 USD, a room would be found for those few hours... Embarrassing. An hour later we saw that there were many rooms available.
- we were also informed that we had to pay 26 USD for breakfast, despite the fact that we came for 14 days with all inclusive. Complete lack of respect for the customer and understanding of the principles of operation of good hotels in the world. I talked about it with one of the management people (I told him that I would describe everything on portals) - he only mumbled that these were their "procedures".
- it was similar when we left - we were allowed to stay in the room until 1:00 p.m., but we couldn't eat dinner at 12:30! We were told that we had to pay extra for dinner 29 USD. At 12:10 a member of staff approached us specifically to cut off our all-inclusive band!! In none of the good hotels I've been have I encountered such treatment of a customer! - after waiting we got a nicely located room, where the hot and cold water could not be adjusted in the shower and after a minute of showering it became water because the drain was clogged, the repairman came twice before he fixed it,
- the room was usually cleaned around 4 or 5 pm, which was irritating,
- there are no animations in the hotel, at our request they once organized water gymnastics and it was the only activity of the "animators" for the guests for 14 days,
- the bar by the pools did not work at all, we had to walk 100 meters to the bar in the main building for drinks,
- in the canteen during meals dirty dishes are cleaned of leftovers at one of the posts almost in the middle of the room in front of everyone, which is totally absurd,
- the safes in the rooms are not attached to the wall, so you can safely take them out of the room,
- dogs that do not have collars indicating vaccination against rabies are constantly wandering around the hotel, they go under the sunbeds,
- the beach is very small and has a big drop with big waves,
- the hotel is already worn out, for a 4 star it would have to undergo many renovations.

The advantage of the hotel is definitely the people from the service, who are helpful and smiling, but with the idiotic "procedures" introduced by the management of this hotel, unfortunately it does not change the low opinion of this hotel.
title: Poor hotel in nice location
