roomTip: Wake up early if you want a sun lounger. Book any transfers and activites through a 3rd party, as you will be significantly overcharged.
text: Very average resort. Rooms are basic and mostly clean. As with most resorts, they have about 30 sun loungers and 200+ guests. Despite signage everywhere starting sun loungers cannot be reserved, you will not get one unless you wake up early and place your items on it. The food is average, a selection of western and sri lankan items, the quality of the meat is poor. The alcoholic drinks included in the package are low quality but will suffice. Staff are friendly if you get their attention and ask them to do something, you’ll die of old age before you are offered a drink with your meal. I wasn’t able to book any massage / spa services during my 5 day visit due to no availability. It seems you are treated much better at this resort if you are booked as part of a tour group, reserved tables, activities and treatments are all given to them as a priority. There isn’t much nearby the resort and as soon as you step outside the very small private beach, you will find it very dirty. By no means a bad resort, but somewhat lacking for the price.
title: Very average resort

text:
купили новогодний тур в этот отель. Прежде чем покупать , прочитала массу положительных отзывов. Постараюсь быть объективной при написании отзыва. Отель уставший, но чистенький, сказать, что это четверка, нуу, наверное если кубинская и египетская, то да, если эмираты то 3 точно)  если не обращать внимание на огромных крыс которые бегают на ресепшене по стенам ) и жителей которые живут в номерах. 
Номер который нам достался, был крайне уставшим, жутко гудел электрический щиток, лейка в душе не работала должным образом, открутили и мылись под струёй воды) убирались каждый день, мыло и шампунь мы видели только в первый день) потом видимо персонал видя, что есть своё не посчитал нужным положить) 
Постельное белье, чистое, но очень застиранное( холодильник при открытии так паханул, что дочь сказала, кто там повесился)) Сейф работал, выдали по просьбе адаптер для зарядок. 
Басеин, достаточно большой и чистый, в час пик с лежаками и полотенцами беда) 
По ресторану, нууу.....тут отдельный разговор, сказать, что мы были голодны нет, но 90% еды очень сильно перченая либо с огромным количеством специй. разнообразие не великое, но в общем норм, не вау, но и не совсем ужасно.
Теперь про океан, берег крупный песок, об который можно с легкостью ободрать колени очень сильные волны почти всегда , к океану идем через территорию отеля и дорогу. возле океана вообще ограниченное количество лежаков. С утра бегом туда) на берегу продают коктейли безалкогольные, можно купить тарелку с нарезанными фруктами, и вам предложат экскурсии) скажу сразу, информацию о местах куда вы поедите лучше прочитать самим, никто вам ничего не расскажет, говорят по русски очень плохо. 
Торгуйтесь везде кроме супермаркетов, если что-то хотите купить просто посмотрите на карте где больше ТЦ и туда, там гарантированно будет дешевле, чем вам впарят по пути) все же понимают, они работают на проценте )) 
Магазин на территории отеля и за его пределами у Саши, безумно дорогой, но это опять таки ожидаемо , это бизнес, ничего личного )
title: Коротко о главном)

de l'hôtel ils sont très gentils et c'est moins cher et surtout je vous conseil d'y dîner un soir sous leurs payottes sur le sable au menu (demandé à le voir lorsque vous réservé ) demi langouste énorme crevettes frites salade et vin blanc un délice pour environ 45 euros par personne j'ai pas réussi à tout manger et même s'il pleut pas de soucis bien abrité sous l'énorme payotte 
Le personnel fantômes club lookea on les voit pas souvent ils apparaissent vers 10heures 30 pour aquagym à 11heures 30 à part ils font pas grand-chose heureusement l'hôtel organise des soirées avec les locaux

roomTip: Bring a hairdryer the hotel one is not powerful for long hair
text: I would give the staff at hotel six stars! All friendly and helpful in all areas of the hotel. The food was excellent and the waiting on staff quick to refill water glasses and choice of green tea breakfast tea and coffee you could get. The bar area was nice. We were on half board so paid for drinks which were 5 star hotel prices. Only one man made good strong cocktails,  so we didn't want to taste only juice so stopped drinking them. The pool very clean and nice to swim in but a less fit person might find it difficult getting in and out due to the layout. The hotel grounds and gardens well kept. We had relaxing stay here but I must mention the hotel needs improving. Our mattresses were very hard and lumpy and badly stained. Only an old plastic table and chairs to sit on on veranda, it needs sunbed and comfortable chairs. NO ROOM SERVICE MENU which we would have ordered lunch so now hotel has lost a way to make money, and phone we could not hear person speaking at other end. Very good laundry service and the room always cleaned to a high standard. Handle on  sliding door broke twice but immediately fixed. And socket not working also immediately fixed. Very stupid that there is only 1 room key because as soon as you need it to go out, the electric goes off so everything in fridge goes hot! Activities seem to be very limited except when groups of local people stay. I was told aqua aerobics on and only me got in pool so man disappeared which was rude! The hotel is excellent at managing a lot of people and groups without impacting on service well done for this. We have had a relaxing time and enjoyed the food,  and would like to thank the excellent staff for looking after us. But this hotel needs to be improved before we would consider return visit.
title: Great Staff and food. Loved pool

roomTip: Avoid staying at the hotel during long weekends
text:
Review of Club Palm Bay Hotel

My experience at Club Palm Bay Hotel had its ups and downs, but overall, it was a mixed bag. I will start with the negatives before moving on to the improvements.

On the first day of my stay, I encountered several issues that left me disappointed. The dinner buffet was a major letdown as there was a shortage of food options. It was disheartening to see empty trays and limited choices, which definitely impacted the overall dining experience. Furthermore, I found the room service to be extremely slow. It took over two hours for my order to finally reach my room, which was frustrating and inconvenient. The delay in delivering the food tarnished my perception of the hotel's efficiency and customer service.

Another major drawback was the loud club music playing at the main restaurant. The ambiance was completely inappropriate for a dining setting. It was challenging to hold a conversation due to the overpowering noise, and it detracted from the overall dining experience. This aspect was definitely a letdown, as I expected a more serene and relaxed environment to enjoy my meal.

However, I must say that the hotel management took note of these issues and made improvements the next day. During breakfast and lunch, I was pleasantly surprised to find a better spread of food options. The variety and quality of the dishes were significantly improved, which made the dining experience much more enjoyable. It was reassuring to see that the hotel took the feedback seriously and made an effort to rectify the initial shortcomings.

In summary, my first day at Club Palm Bay Hotel was marred by a shortage of food at the dinner buffet, slow room service, and inappropriate loud club music at the main restaurant. However, the hotel management showed their commitment to customer satisfaction by addressing these issues promptly. The following day, the lunch buffet had a better spread, indicating that the hotel took the necessary steps to improve the dining experience. While my initial experience was disappointing, the hotel's responsiveness and efforts to rectify the situation left me with a more positive impression overall.
title: A mixed bag

placeInfo/address: Sittrakala Estate Chithragala, Hambantota, Tangalle 82100 Sri Lanka
text:
We had an overall nice stay at the Shangri-la Hambantota. The facilitates are lovely and the sunset pool was great for us as a couple, however as this is the adult pool maybe more policing is needed. The room was nice however we did have a small critter problem with a large insect found in the bed and quite a few insects around the room. 

We were staying over the Sri Lankan New Year which the hotel had on events for, this led to the hotel being very busy and might have caused some of the problems we faced such as a lack of service (waiting a very long time for drinks and meals, along with the problems from housekeeping). We booked day trips through the hotel which were good however overpriced and the day tours were just drivers and whilst friendly enough were not particularly knowledgeable about where we were going and maybe a lack of communication between the hotel and drivers along with rather over-enthusiastic descriptions of the trips. 

The hotel recommended a city tour of Hambantota which consisted of the botanical gardens and bird zoo which we were unaware of, we had to pay 4,500 as foreigners for the bird zoo, which turned out to be birds in small cages - we did not enjoy this. The driver then told us the botanical gardens had a long wait time and he didn’t recommend it, so we paid $60 to be driven to two locations only 15 minutes away, one of which was very disappointing. 

The food was average, as a vegetarian there was a lack of options to choose from at some of the restaurants, however a good dinner buffet selection. The Sera is quite overpriced especially considering the quality of food we received. 

The grounds are beautifully maintained and the safaris are worthwhile as there is fantastic nature. I would recommend as a short stay for the safaris.
title: Good for a short stay

text:
The property is good and well maintained...
We booked a suite category room with an ocean view and the disappointment began there...the ocean from our room was barely visible...and upon frequent calls n discussions they gave another room just above the room provided...now what we can see is a trace of ocean n that too at a distance...
Also it was located at a noisy place near the pool, we wanted a peaceful place to reside in...so we had to adjust in the room which 
1. Does not offer an ocean view 
2 located at a noisy place...
The image updated on the website, does not match the room we checked in...

As it was a vacation, we let it go as we didn't want to spoil our mood. 
We are vegetarians and mentioned that at the time of booking and check in. If a 5 star property is accepting bookings for vegetarians then they should make proper arrangements for the Indian vegetarian guests... unfortunately their Indian chef was on leave and we could not find anything on the menu that can be eaten by us, except a cheese pizza..
One night for dinner we had that barely as we are not pizza lovers, second night we again got a pizza but it came 45 min post giving na order n that too very cold as if someone forgot to serve it...
 The food was the biggest challenge in the hotel, it is at a remote location so a tuk tuk or a cab does not come easily. The hotel charges hefty if we book a car through them. Hospitality and service is 0 especially at restaurants. 
What one expects from a hotel, a classy room with a great view, good food and hospitality, especially when you book a higher category rooms, which charges 30k-35k INR per night. 

The hotel is well maintained and made considering families in mind but for people looking expecting such things out of a vacation can reconsider before booking this
title: Red Flag for vegetarians

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Dinesh
Thank you very much for taking the time to share your feedback following your recent stay at Shangri-La Hambantota. We are truly pleased to hear that you enjoyed our beautiful property, beach access, and the culinary experience — especially the personalized attention provided by Chef Dharmendra Shah. Your kind words will certainly be shared with him and the culinary team; he’ll be delighted to know he made a positive impact on your stay.

That said, we are sincerely sorry for the inconveniences you experienced with housekeeping and the air conditioning in your room. It is disappointing to hear that these issues affected your comfort, and we fully understand how unsettling that must have been.

We are pleased to note that our Rooms Division Manager had the opportunity to speak with you personally at the time of your departure regarding these concerns. Following your report, our engineering team did attend to the air conditioning, and we hope it was brought back to a satisfactory level during your stay.

With regard to the pest issue, please accept our sincerest apologies. While regular pest control is indeed carried out across the resort, it is likely that recent fumigation activities in nearby room blocks may have caused cockroaches to appear temporarily in your room. We understand how distressing this must have been. Our housekeeping team has since conducted a thorough deep cleaning of the room in your presence, and we have taken immediate corrective action to prevent any recurrence.

Your feedback is extremely valuable to us, and we assure you that maintaining the highest standards of cleanliness, comfort, and guest satisfaction remains our top priority.

We truly hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back in the future, and provide a seamless experience that reflects the true standards of Shangri-La hospitality.
Till we meet again please take care.

Refhan Razeen
General Manager

placeInfo/address: Sittrakala Estate Chithragala, Hambantota, Tangalle 82100 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Please check your invoice before signing anything at this hotel as they may pull a fast one (based on our experience stated in review).
text:
We checked into this hotel for two rooms on 16 March at around 13:25. 

Upon checkin we were given an invoice which had a rate of more than 20k to that which was agreed (135k vs agreed 115k). Upon enquiry of the rate we had to at first show our email with agreed rate and booking confirmation.

After back and fro we were advised that the extra cost was for early checkin (35 minutes before check in time of 2pm). As goodwill the hotel was happy to waive the extra charge for 35 mins early checkin.

Concerns regarding above;
1. If we were going to be charged extra then the  hotel should have advised us instead of quietly getting us to sign the booking sheet with extra cost.

2. 20% extra cost for 35 mins can be considered excessive when early checkin was not requested.

If the above was a mistake in the booking process we would have been more understanding.

The hotel generally was good. Room 247 has timber flooring that is warped and hence pinch the sole of your feet.

The tambili at breakfast was empty and not filled despite quite a few requests. The hopper ladies were great. 

The life guards and in particular those at the beach were great.

Pools were great.

In summation, in our view this hotel does not stand up to the hype. I would suggest the hotel concentrate on giving people a welcome that inspires trust as opposed to drums etc.
title: A hotel that fails trust upon checkin

text:
Nur noch ganz ok, aber nicht mehr. Die besten Jahre des Hotels sind vorbei.So viel wurde schon geschrieben , sogar vor mehr als einem Jahr, passiert hier ist leider gar nichts.Gewisses Mobiliar zerfällt buchstäblich, es fehlt ein frischer Anstrich.Der Service braucht eine Aufsicht die gewisse Linien für ein 5 Sterne Hotel einhält. Schön das alle lächeln , es ist aber doch nicht immer genug. Für mich wirkt die Anlage sehr verschlafen,langweilig. 
Die Musik im Hauptspeiserestaurant ( Katzengejammer) so nicht passend und einfach schrecklich. 
Die Reviews werden gelesen, dankbar angenommen und mit denselben Blabla beantwortet. Das Hotel Brauch jemand die Ideen bringt alles überwacht und endlich auffrischt.
Wunderschöner einsamer Strand , sehr gutes Essen… ich glaube findet man auch an vielen anderen Orten hier. 

Sri Lanka ist ein Traum und wir werden sicher wieder kommen.Shangri-La Hambantota  nicht nochmals besuchen!

PS
Liebes Management bitte den Service Personal mal neue Schuhe bestellen!!!
title: Nicht mehr 5 Sterne !!!

placeInfo/address: Sittrakala Estate Chithragala, Hambantota, Tangalle 82100 Sri Lanka
text:
There is lots to like about this hotel, comfy beds, great air conditioning, lovely setting and friendly staff.

It just isn’t up to Shangri La standards in terms of food and service. Th main restaurant resembles a canteen (although the live music is  a real bonus). Tables aren’t properly wiped and every meal something was missing cutlery wise.

Having a wine list only works if you have the wine’s - one evening we had to go through four to find one in stock, we should have given up as each request took at least 10 mins before being told that it wasn’t available.

The coffee is dreadful and oddly there is only orange juice on request; again this took at least 15 minutes to arrive.

The adult pool bathroom needs cleaning far more regularly.

We did enjoy our stay but having visited a number of Shangri La hotels across Asia this just doesn’t live up to expectations.
title: Good but not great…

placeInfo/address: Sittrakala Estate Chithragala, Hambantota, Tangalle 82100 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Go to Galle or Bentota
text: Unfortunately, what could be an amazing hotel is let down by poor service, which must be down to poor training (this is a REAL review. There are a suspicious amount of individuals leaving 5 star reviews). Drinks often take over 30mins to arrive, with hot drinks turning cold and cold drinks warm. Comprehension of English from staff seems poor, despite the high number of  English speaking tourists. Orders have to repeated multiple times, but still delivered with errors e.g. order a Margherita pizza which came with Pepperoni on. Ask for no cheese in Burger, arrives with cheese. Ask for a fork, takes three attempts to deliver this. Try to place a booking for one of the activities is a convoluted and confusing task. Reception tells you to go to one area, who have no idea it is supposed to take place, who direct you somewhere else to only find out it’s unavailable (example is the Henna tattoo service which is advertised throughout the resort). However, the opposite is true of the Cleaning service and Kids Club, which is EXCELLENT. However, since the resort is isolated from any major attractions or towns, it is a destination in itself. Therefore, if you’re plan is to enjoy your holiday in Sri Lanka, go north to Galle or Bentota, or inland to Ella etc.
title: 2 star service in a 5 star hotel

text:
3 ку поставил только за отношение/ взаимодействие отеля с туроператором и клиентами. Приехали в отель и решили доплатить за ужины, за 2 номера. Доплату произвели одновременно за два номера и спокойно пошли на ужин. По итогу: один номер подтвердили,  второй типа пропустили и выставили счет за ужины на 4 человек!!! На 12000₽ на секундочку.., на следующий день тоже самое, просто тянули время чтобы снять дополнительные деньги за ужины!
По итогу: после претензий и объяснений главный менеджер обещал удалить оба счета и предложил фирменное чаепитие с закусками, но по факту удалил один счет а в первом выставил счет за 3 человек, что тоже очень неприятно. Но чаепитие было действительно хорошее. 
В остальном все было отлично. Уборка номеров и особенно уборщик Hasitha на 5.
Океан отличный можно плавать и развлекаться в волнах, пляж отличный. Лежаки всегда есть свободные и на море и у бассейнов. Еда вкусная.
title: Все ок

text:
Schöne Anlage, leider fest in russischer Hand, das Zimmer (Deluxe Double-Room) groß, mit kleiner Terrasse mit Blick in den Park, Meer war zu hören, war sauber, das Bad sehr groß mit Dusche und sep. Badewanne - nichts zu meckern.

Restaurant: es gibt á la-Card Restaurants und 1 Buffet Restaurant, welches wir am ersten Abend besucht haben, da es hieß es wäre in unserer Buchung dabei - war es nicht. Das Essen war am Buffet abwechslungsreich und für jeden etwas dabei uns wurden dann 130€ für 2 Personen für das Buffet (ohne Getränke) berechnet, 2 Cappuccinos am Pool kosten 11€, auch das Restaurant am Golfclub ist nicht gerade billig, Steak kostet 45-60€, über das Preisniveau kann man sicher diskutieren.

Golfplatz: Sehr schöner Golfplatz, anspruchsvolle Löcher, gepflegt, aber für das Greenfee erwartet man sich ein besseres Niveau - als Hotelanlage durchschnittlich.
Caddys sind sehr freundlich, Carts allerdings in einem erbärmlichen Zustand, Sitze und Feststellbremse kaputt und ziemlich in die Jahre gekommen. Ein weiterer Nachteil ist, dass man nach den ersten 9 nicht direkt am Cubhouse vorbeikommt, es aber auch keine Half-Way-Station gibt, bei der man Getränke oder einen kleinen Snack kaufen kann, was bei der Hitze schon Sinn macht. Ein Golfplatz auf dem Niveau sollte auch einen Bar-Wagen haben, der am Platz rumfährt und Getränke verkauft - auch dies Fehlanzeige - auf dem vom Hotel versprochenen Niveau eigentlich ein Unding.

PS: Sylvester Gala Dinner kostete 250€ pro Person, alle anderer Restaurants im Hotel hatten geschlossen, so wenn man im Hotel bleiben wollte, war man gezwungen das "Angebot" anzunehmen..
Das Dinner war in Ordnung, Essen etwas schöner angeboten, als im normalen Buffet, aber den preis nicht wirklich Wert..

Fazit: 1x und nie wieder - Preis/Leistung und selbst gestellter Anspruch passt überhaupt nicht - man sollte auf alle Fälle Halbpension buchen, sonst wird es teuer
title: Ernüchterung

placeInfo/address: Sittrakala Estate Chithragala, Hambantota, Tangalle 82100 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Don’t stay here :)
text:
What went well:
- The service in Bohunjala was excellent, especially from Vihanga
- The food in Bonhunjala was excellent 
- Rooms were clean with comfortable beds

What didn’t go so well
- The front desk are poorly trained
- Check in was prolonged and messy due to the front desk’s incompetence - they kept getting different bookings confused. They also didn’t want our passports then asked for them later 
- Guests in adjacent rooms were smoking cannabis and the smell came into our balcony and rooms. The front desk did not take this seriously at all and the duty manager Sunil (who didn’t know I can understand Sinhalese) initially smirked when a member of staff told him. We also received an inappropriate response when we complained on WhatsApp - “That's great to hear. Have a good day ahead.
-Service Center”. Sunil later appeared to try and help but stated there were no rooms with king beds we could move into. I find this hard to believe when the resort is so huge. 
- The front desk are unable to handle simple queries. Even with small queries, they walk around like confused and constipated ducks, talking to at least 6 colleagues before replying to you. 
- My son cut his food on the tiles in the kids pool - the staff showed no concern
- The non paying AGM guests were treated better than the paying tourists. 
- we will not be returning.
title: Great food but poor front desk

placeInfo/address: Sittrakala Estate Chithragala, Hambantota, Tangalle 82100 Sri Lanka
text:
Sadly disappointing. 
Have wanted to stay here since it was built but sadly wouldn’t return or recommend. 

Rooms (delux garden) comfortable enough but view of the near by factory was not great (hotel was quite empty according to staff so we were surprised we were not 1) upgraded to a better view room or 2) offered to pay to upgrade the room. 

I think that the issue is the language barrier. The staff have a very limited knowledge of English which can be frustrating when requesting something simple - operator simply hung up on me 4x as she didn’t understand my request… (asking if my telephone was blocked to make outside calls) … 
That said, the staff are ALL absolutely charming and couldn’t be more helpful …they are a credit to the hotel but some language training would be a benefit to non Sri Lankan visitors. 
The hotel is pretty shabby sadly (maybe due to us being out of season) with building work making access to restaurants from pool impossible without  to go back to reception. 
I feel bad writing such a negative review but do feel that, for the prices being charged - and the use of a “luxury brand” name, improvements need to be made. 
If youre looking for a luxury stay, I’d recommend the Fortress - approximately 1 hour down the coast. 

Postives, comfortable clean  room, nice pool, good food and lovely staff !!
title: Sadly cannot recommend

text:
The hotel is generally great but there are a few things that let it down. It's about 10 years old and needs a good update. They were doing some renovations while we were in the wing we were staying in! They have 4 wings why not shutdown a whole wing and renovate that and move on to the next one rather then have guest walk through sanding dust all day! Common sense really.

Whe we got to the pools there are generally in good condition. However the san beds were disgusting! Completely covered in black mould!!! At a 5 start star resort this is totally unacceptable. I raised this with customer service and was giving your standard answer of oh sorry for the inconvenience I ask to speak to the manager and they sent a duty manager who also apologies. I said does your generally manager not care enough about the hotel that he doesn't do regular walk around the hotel at least 1 ever 6 month to check on the status of his hotel? If he had he would have picked up on that many other issues too.

I will say the next day they immediately started replacing them. So they knew but didn't care until our group complained!

Food prices for kids is ridiculously expense of what they got. Kids burger is the size of a large boiled eggs and cost us $10!

See photos of all I have said as I never exaggerate or lie.

placeInfo/address: Sittrakala Estate Chithragala, Hambantota, Tangalle 82100 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Use it as a base hotel, not a resort where you stay within the walls and intend to do so. More than 5 nights feeels like a long time....
text:
So, how do you describe this resort? It is good, but it is neither a resort nor a hotel and suffering from an identity crisis. The Shangri La are typically city hotels with polished service and support that know people are busy and are there for a short period. This resort is very relaxed but has the undercurrents of business hotel that do not work together well. As resorts typically are very welcoming, they know they need to make your life as easy as possible, with the small touches making a big difference over longer periods. This resort feels like they know turnover is quick and that by the time the client is looking for the finer details they are gone….   This hotel has none of that warmth that you get through other 5-star resorts, but it's not a bad resort; it just does not know what it is. This hotel feels more like a corporate events hotel than a holiday location. The pool is great for little ones up to about 10, and the pools are shallow at 1.2 meters which is a bit shallow for me (even the adult pool). The beach is very dirty, with a lot of plastic waste which a resort should always be collecting as it’s the frontage. Also it did not feel that safe with a lot of stray dogs and I was worried about cleanliness, the water in August is extremely rough with very big waves so this is a beach facing hotel only, the beach is not usable or even very walkable. They take safety very seriously with life guards all the time and the staff are very friendly. It was a little odd that even after two weeks they were asking how long we were staying and treated us like a new customer each day, which for a resort is strange, you would expect that they would know who you are at this point. Some staff did but as per the warmth comment earlier it did not feel like anyone really knew who were and that we liked tea in the evening which was questioned every night as an extra and not included. In one case they even refused to serve it, which was odd considering it’s a 5 star and its tea and Sri Lanka where tea is from. The food was good, but cooperate events hotel good, and very Sri Lankan not international resort good, the food was a on the weaker side compared with other 5 star resorts I have stayed in.  A major complaint is they did not change the table cloths so you sit down for breakfast or dinner and they would already be stained with ‘fresh” stains of chocolate or food form the morning, so I found myself choosing a location by where and which was clean. The activities were also a bit badly organised and English was bit of an issue in general, and getting information was hard (in the resort on a whole), considering this is a base for the national parks it needs to be easier and we paid two different prices and strategies which was also odd. One where we hired their car and paid the driver of the jeep ourselves and one where they arranged all, with a big differences in price, honestly I don’t know why they just did not make this easier and we only learnt about the former after a few trips as it was not offered. You also need to keep going to reception to pay off your balance as they take a deposit and when that runs out you have to pay it off and start again, this over 2 weeks was annoying, and for a resort strange. The kids club is very good and they enjoyed it, it does close for 1 hr per day so its not a club you could leave the kids all day if you wanted to, not that we would. We also did the bike trip which was strange experience and not recommended, the bikes were not in good working order, to say the least an in an extreme state of degradation, I did not even know bikes could work in those conditions. The 15mk route was alos a little strange and not what we expected, thy also could have provided water or something, not that I needed it for 15kmn as we are very fit cyclists but…. Its 35 oC and if someone needed water /food what would they do, again it felt like we had booked this and they did not know what to do but felt obligated. No stops, no views, no real agenda to the cycle just a circular route on the streets. As you pay 7000rps  per person you would expect something, or a cycle to a location if interest? 

In short, the hotel feels like its recovering and the outside areas are subject to the battering of the weather and in need of repairs. The rooms were very clean and good condition, and in a new state. 

Finally we would like to thank Rashmi in club hours, and Nishan and Chathurya in the main restaurant. 

Depsite this reading quite negative we had a lovely two weeks and the hotel was a great base for the national parks, but I would advise using it as such and not staying longer than 4 days and using it as a hotel more than a resort. 

Thank you to the hotel, I hope you see this a positive and constructive feedback.
title: A hotel with contradictions

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Valued Guest,
Thank you for choosing Shangri la Hambantota for your first visit to Sri Lanka, and for taking the time to share your detailed feedback. We are delighted to hear that your overall experience was positive, and that you enjoyed the spacious rooms, the beautiful pools, and your excursion to Yala.

We’re especially glad to know that the greeting you received upon arrival was fantastic, and that Sathdani was able to make your stay more enjoyable. I will be sure to pass on your kind words to her.

We appreciate your comments about the areas where we can improve. I apologize for the inconvenience you faced with the towels in your room and the condition of the sunbeds by the pool. We will address these issues immediately to ensure that our facilities meet the highest standards of comfort and cleanliness.

I also regret that you found the buffet food repetitive and that there were instances where certain dishes and drinks were unavailable. We are always looking to enhance our dining options, and your feedback is invaluable in helping us do so.

Your experience at the spa and the positive comments about Sera restaurant are greatly appreciated, and we are glad you enjoyed them. However, I’m sorry that there was only one therapist available during your visit. We will look into improving this to better serve our guests.

Lastly, we’re glad you enjoyed the music and DJ events, and that you had a good experience with the trip to Yala organized through the hotel.

Once again, thank you for your feedback. We hope to welcome you back to [Hotel Name] in the future, where we will strive to provide an even better experience.
Till we meet again please take care.

Refhan Razeen
General Manager
placeInfo/address: Sittrakala Estate Chithragala, Hambantota, Tangalle 82100 Sri Lanka
text:
This was our first visit to Sri Lanka. The transfer from Columbo airport is around 3 hours, which makes a difference to the travel time. 
The greeting at the hotel was fantastic. Especially Sathdani, who was helpful throughout our visit.

The rooms were big and nice. We were short of towels and several days had to ask for extra. 

The pools are really nice. The sunbeds would be nice, but the seating is left out when it rains and were really mouldy. Several also had rips in them. This really needs upgrading. The pool bar  is ok. 

Service overall was generally really friendly, but could be very slow in all areas. 

The buffet food became a bit repetitive. There is a wide range of food available. Sera restaurant was nice. One issue we experienced frequently was dishes and drinks being unavailable, such as apple or orange juice.

We went on a trip to Yala organised through the hotel which was really good.

The beach has huge waves and not swimable in August.

The spa was good value but only one therapist was available.

The hotel was quiet during the week, a lot busier at weekends. There is music and a DJ on some days.
title: Nice hotel. Some improvements needed

text:
Some good some bad elements.

Firstly we were staying with a 6 & 4 year old. They loved the pool but adored the kids club, Dineshika & Sureshani were excellent with the children. 5 stars on the above. 

The overall review score is a more general reflection on the hotel. 
The hotel is quite tiered and in need to modernising. The most frustrating though was the waiting staff who were very hit or miss. On one occasion it took 35 minutes to get a bottle of water, and we were sitting in the bar. In the end I told them I’d get it myself and they jumped into action. 

Also they fumigate the hotel twice a week, which is great for mosquitos but meant that on one of the days we were staying there were thousands of black insects, ladybird size all over the corridors that kept coming into our room.
title: Great for young kids, no so great for adults

placeInfo/address: Sittrakala Estate Chithragala, Hambantota, Tangalle 82100 Sri Lanka
text:
The dinner and breakfast restaurant was exceptional regards to food and service. The restaurant manager was really friendly and welcoming. The bar staff and Pro shop staff was also very friendly. The second room  we received was lovely. This was after the first room was close to children’s play area and it had a musty smell. Room service and cleaning staff was really friendly and very professional. 
If you want a quite room ask for it to be located near the adult pool. 
However, I would not recommend this resort if you are going with friends. And we are not party animals. Just looking to relax. (Ages of friends between (37- 45.)
Mostly caters for families and couples. 
The traditional dancers were not at the resort as advertised on various bookings platforms. This was a reason for booking this stay. Please enquire before hand if this is what you expect. The photos on the various platforms do not look like the property itself. We took the half board option and without it we would have spent a fortune. The ++ on the menus is service and tax charges and it can get expensive. The pools are not cooled, so in the dry season when it is really hot the pools are not very refreshing. There isn’t really a sea view from the rooms. The hotel is situated away from the beach and palm trees are between the hotel and beach. The closest we got to a view, was getting a room closer to the adult pool section. 
And finally, this is NOT a swimming beach. Currents are too strong and it gets deep very quickly. It was a bitter sweet stay. And we were a little disappointed as we booked three days and wanted to relax after a busy couple of days exploring the Kandy area. We will unfortunately not be back.
title: Bitter Sweet Stay

placeInfo/address: Sittrakala Estate Chithragala, Hambantota, Tangalle 82100 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Be prepared to wait a long time to be served drinks and food in all restaurants.
text:
The hotel is simply stunning with big and beautiful grounds are beautiful where the two pools are situated. These are great for relaxing in. The golf course is a bonus if you like to play and the staff are very friendly and warm. The rooms are  very nice and very clean. For a family holiday this is the perfect hotel although there isn’t much to do outside the resort itself.  Trips to local safari’s, tea plantations and a turtle sanctuary as well as Galle can all be arranged through the hotel and these are highly recommended. The beach enjoys stunning views with crashing waves and beautiful sand, and is great to walk along when it’s not too hot.

Whilst all the staff go out of their way to make you feel very welcome, unfortunately, the service was extremely slow and it was not unusual to wait for long periods to be served food and drinks at the bar next to the golf club  or next to the  poolside.  For all the efforts the staff go to in the main restaurant, the quality of food at the buffet is poor and lacks choice for a five star hotel. Every night, the food was pretty much the same, which became boring. The hotel also lacks atmosphere, most notably in the evenings. Bring a good book to keep yourself entertained after evening meals as there is nowhere in the hotel to go and indulge in some good, worthwhile entertainment. It would be a real unique attraction if there was a programme of entertainment for guests to enjoy each evening.

Sri Lanka is a beautiful place to visit with lots to do. We stayed for 7 nights at the hotel before continuing our adventures around the rest of the country. Three or four nights instead at the Shangri La Hambantota would be enough. Easy tweaks with food, service and entertainment would give much better value for money and would provide a much better all round guest experience.
title: Great hotel where small tweaks would make huge difference

text:
Stayed for one night. Check in was super smooth , thanks to Shamini , she was really caring and helpful. 
As the occupancy was less so they prepared the dinner and breakfast as per our request. Food was awesome and the restaurant staffs were very good. Mohon , Vino were really kept their eye on us for everything. Chef Buddika was good at his job. Pastry chef Anthony was fabulous to make excellent breads.
Rooms were cozy and relaxing.

Modernity required in the hotel. Style is a bit dated. 

Though SPA timing is from 10am to 10pm but no one available at 5PM and SPA was closed.

Too much of wooden work here and there. They should remove the smelly carpets.
title: Lack of modern amenities.

placeInfo/address: No 10 Glenfall Road Nuwara Eliya, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text:
Painting was happening on our floor. I was told by staff. The smell was so strong it gave me a headache. Then we got into the room and although it was a pleasant cool in the hallway the room was stuffy and warm. We couldn’t open a window as they were locked and there was no aircon or fan! Only a heater. It was very difficult to sleep I’ve never experienced this before! There obviously are times of the year you need heating but there are also times when you need cooling!
The massage experience was very ordinary. I expected more from a spa in a hotel at 14,000 rs. The room was brightly lit, the music wasn’t soft. Not a serene and relaxing experience at all. Would’ve been better from the ladies in town!
I have to say all of the staff were very attentive and most helpful. One of the staff in the restaurant asked if we liked the dinner buffet. When we asked why there wasn’t more Sri Lankan food. He went to the kitchen and very kindly surprised us with a lovely chicken curry. 

It’s a pity the room experience has clouded our judgement.
title: Disappointing room

placeInfo/address: 340 Galle Road, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Avoid this area unless you are backpacking.
text:
The only positive thing about this place is that it is situated on the beachfront (although it’s not safe to swim because of all the rocks and the beach further along is heavily polluted). The entrance to the hotel has no parking out the front and the hotel is old and dirty ,however the front of house staff are friendly and welcoming. Our room wasn’t ready so they wanted to leave our luggage unattended in the foyer which didn’t sit well with us and we asked for it to be put somewhere safer. Our room was small with little space to move and an even smaller bathroom had no amenities (shampoo etc.) barely any hot water and one small bar of soap for 3 to share. The outside toilet had no toilet paper and hotel signage threatened charges for food and beverages brought in from external sources. The food offerings for breakfast were very average, basic western style dishes which were just warm and the Sri Lankan foods on offer were nearly empty by the time we got there and they were not replenished. There was a resupply of fresh fruit though which was nice.
If you want a beach to swim in, this is not the hotel for you. If you want comfort, this is not the hotel for you. My advice, head further west to Bentota and you’ll find both these things aplenty.
title: Very basic hotel with few amenities

placeInfo/address: 340 Galle Road, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
roomTip: This was mentioned as a 3-star hotel, but nearby 3-star hotel has a larger pool with better choice of food for the same price.
text:
21/04/2023

The bathroom was small but nice and clean. The room was also nice, the balcony had a good view out to the beach. The pool was small and the sea was rough but we enjoyed the pool. The food was OK but it was not a buffet, we asked for some ice cream and Malli and I shared it. After that, we went to the balcony and watched the stars and I looked for constellations. We saw a bottle in the sea and a box and some pieces of pipes. The sea was NOT very clean, it was quite dirty. 

The TV did not have kids' channels for us :( only cricket and news and some grown-up stories.
					
22/04/2023

The beds were nice and comfy. Today there was a breakfast buffet but a very small variety of food was there. There was some lettuce, tomato, cucumber,croissants, buns, thosa, chicken curry,pol sambol, omelettes, chicken sausages and guava and mixed fruit juice. For me, the food was quite disappointing. 

The sea in front of the hotel in parts was VERY rocky. We went to a nearby beach (a 3-minute walk) to snorkel. We really, really enjoyed that!

Lunch was served as a sit-down meal and so was dinner. 
							
23/04/2023

Today is the last day of my stay. Breakfast was better than yesterday, but some buns were hard and there were flies. We went to the turtle beach nearby and the sea was a bit rough but there were lots of fish and there were reef sharks too. There was a new world underwater, there were baby sea snakes, lot of sea urchins and lots of other fish.
 
The staff at the hotel was friendly and always smiled with my brother and me.

This was mentioned as a 3-star hotel, but our usual 3-star hotel nearby was full :( and I prefer that over Coral Rock!
title: I prefer our usual 3* hotel over Coral Rock

text:
Given Sri Lankan prices at other hotels that we stayed at on this trip I was expecting a 5 star room forthe price I paid. In all fairness, my friend had booked the premium room for about the same price and it was close to perfect. We were next door to each other. My room only had one plug for recharging devices. Bathroom shower didn't have anywhere to put soap and shampoo except the floor. The hotel provided shampoo, conditioner and bar soap. My room looked a bit shabby and could use a fresh coat of paint. Needs a coat of paint.  I  had to ask to have my room made up one day and so did my friend. The door to the balcony, overlooking the ocean, was difficult to open and close and the handle fell off a few times because I had to pull extremely hard to close the door. On a positive note, the staff were great..very friendly and helpful. Any time I called the desk the problem was solved immediately. Check in was wasy, the lobby and pool are beautiful with a view of the ocean.
 Good breakfast and good wifi. Great location on the beach. Snorkeling beaches are 5 minutes walk away. I know the better hotels on the beach are higher priced so perhaps this is a bargain for waterfront but not worth it for me. If I were to come here again I would book a place on the other side of the road for a fraction of the waterfront price.
title: Didn't meet expectations for the price.

text: When we first arrived we were greeted with a cold towel and cold drink which was wonderful. Our room was large and overlooked the pool and ocean. Looking closer I noticed that the bathroom really wasn't that clean, mould in the shower, hair left in the shower, the curtains in the room were very grubby and so were the doors. We had to wear shoes in our room because the floor was so dirty. On the last night the air conditioner started dripping on the floor so we couldn't use it. The fan made a squeaking sound and blocked out the sound of the waves. The rooms could definitely use a makeover. We also did not get our complimentary foot massage as the person doing it was not in. The breakfasts were excellent though, food was hot and the pancakes were the best I have ever had!

placeInfo/address: 340 Galle Road, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text: We stayed in an ocean view first floor room and paid $80 USD per night for 3 nights. We consider this old run down hotel very poor value for money compared to every other place we have stayed in our month long Sri Lankan holiday. The rooms are very dated. The photos on the website were obviously taken many years ago. The desk staff have very poor skills when dealing with customers. Upon arrival, we were given a bill for our room charge and the woman from the front desk hovered over me (even though I said that i would bring the money to the desk in a minute) until I handed over the money. In all my years of travel, I have thankfully never experienced anything like this in the past. It was rude and unnecessary. Perhaps if we had seen the room before paying, we would have changed our mind and gone elsewhere. I must add though, the food at the hotel restaurant was excellent and I would highly recommend eating there.
title: Poor value for money

placeInfo/address: 340 Galle Road, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text: just an ordinary hotel. nothing to impress. the room is not so tidy. only the pool and the beach view you will like.the price of hotel its not worth it.the service and the food not good.bring your own food if you want to stay in hotel.

placeInfo/address: 340 Galle Road, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
roomTip: MAKE SURE YOU ASK FOR A SEA-VIEW ROOM (unless you want to be overlooking  the traffic on the Galle road).
text: We stayed there with a group of friends recently. The hotel is built on a narrow stretch of land between the busy Galle road and beautiful HIkkaduwa beach. Rooms were comfortable with a small but clean bathroom. Bed-linen and towels were clean and spotless. Sleep quality of the bed and pillows was excellent. However, the lay-out of the electrical sockets in the room was ridiculous: with electrical socket in the bathroom dangerously close (within the splashing distance) to the wash basin, and the one for the electrical kettle, right under the table (as expected the wire of the kettle was too short, so that unless you creep under the table, you cant plug the kettle!). There is no mini bar in the room but there was a working fridge. Although the website says 'tea and coffee making facilities', there was no milk or coffee mate provided. Food was far below the usual Sri Lankan standards (surprisingly, though it was a beach-side hotel, sea food, particularly more expensive items such as prawns and crabs, seem to be scarce). Even the need for a electric toaster at breakfast seem to have escaped their minds. Staff was friendly and obliging and appeared to be working under stress as they were short-staffed. For Sri Lankan visitors travelling in their own vehicles, be prepared to park the vehicle overnight across the road (security provided). Though the hotel itself is feature-less place (trying, but failing miserably to create a Japanese interior), there is ample beautiful beach and enough activities around that you can enjoy during your stay.
title: A character-less roadside hotel with a nice beach

placeInfo/address: 340 Galle Road, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
roomTip: The second floor should be the best! Ask for a sea view room unless you want to keep looking at the buzy Galle Road!
text:
Visited this hotel in September with a group of 8. The hotel is located right on the Galle road and has quite a lot of parking opposite the hotel. From the outlook this hotel presents itself as an upscale hotel without too many frills. The service was quite fast at the reception and we were in our rooms in no time. Me and my wife got a room in the up most floor and had a lot of open spaces outside the room. The rooms were very clean and was not packed with too much furniture. The issues we found with the room were, though the room was set up as a double it did not have a double bed. It was two single beds brought close together. This plus the sound directly from the main road did affect the sleep quality. The washroom was quite spacious and the clean. 

The hotel had quite a nice pool which was not too big and we were able to have a decent time in it as September is not really the season in Hikkaduwa. But I seriously have my doubt how this pool can accommodate the guests during the peak season starting from Oct/Nov. The beach right outside the hotel was not really maintained and there was quite a bit of litter close to the hotel premises. The sea seemed to be safe for sea bathing a little right to the hotel. 

The hotel did offer breakfast $8, but we thought it was not too great and did not have too many varieties for the price. There are many restaurants close by to this hotel if you want to get a decent meal. 

Overall a good hotel if you want to have a relaxed time in Hikkaduwa, but remember it is for some reason a little pricey.
title: An average hotel which is a bit too pricey!

Thank you for your detailed review   and we are delighted that you have enjoyed your stay at TTGR.

placeInfo/address: Veyangoda Rd, Katunayake, Negombo 94000 Sri Lanka
text:
The hotel is nice and made of independent little houses scattered on a huge park. The apartments are comfortable, clean and spacious. The personnel kind and ready to help. Ideal for a late arrival or early departure at the super close Bandaranaike airport.

I won't give 5 stars though as the restaurant closes ridiculously early (9.30 pm), so does the bar. We are not all Norther Europeans having dinner at 6 pm! :)
title: Nice stay. Green, clean and comfortable - Shame for the restaurant

placeInfo/address: Veyangoda Rd, Katunayake, Negombo 94000 Sri Lanka
text: The good things about this hotel is that it is closer to the airport, it has quite a nice pool and the restaurant staff are very helpful.  On arrival we explained we had to leave for the airport at 0715 hrs the next morning.  The receptionist said the restaurant did not open till 0730 and we would be have a packed breakfast ready for us.  On departure nobody appeared at the reception desk to enable us to check out until 0725, and there was no packed breakfast - however the restaurant had clearly been serving breakfast to other guests since at least 7am.  To their credit the restaurant staff produced a packed meal in a few minutes.  The rooms (in a bungalow in the grounds) were very dated and depressing but clean and the services worked.
title: OK for a night by the airport. But in need of better management.

placeInfo/address: Veyangoda Rd, Katunayake, Negombo 94000 Sri Lanka
text:
Was allotted this hotel for an over night transit by the srilankan airlines. Place a cool 10-min drive from the airport. Check-in was a little delayed as many were waiting. Low lit open reception, with a few old British period chairs. Allotted 14A. Shown direction by a hotel person to find my way in the dark garden. Found out a house, 14A and 14B. Entered the cottage, inserted the key, lights lit, here we are to a British period railway colony house, quite worn out but they have tried their best to renovate. Living room, kitchen, wash room and toilet then the fourth room is the bed room.
Positives:-
1. Clean and neatly tucked white sheets
2. Bottled water, coffee mug, etc.
3. Calm and serene
4. Nice food and good staff at the restaurant
5. Evening music at the restaurant
6. Nice swimming pool
Negatives:-
1. Old, run down looks
2. No carpets
3. All alone finding my way in the large woods carrying my luggage
4. Unclean wash basin
5. Broken bath tub and a nasty cementing done on the white tub making it not a welcome place to step into for a bath (as a matter of fact I preferred to wash at the airport lounge later)
6. Pooling of people for drop and pickup to the airport (there seems to be a nexus between some staff and the transport personnel from Srilankan airlines-usually for business class passengers they ensure privacy of transport)

To sumup, not spook bad, but not good either, for sure a place grudgingly one could accept if no other choice, but when there are many available, why should I accept this is the question.
title: An okay place for transits, quiet tranquil but rooms need repairs/facelit

placeInfo/address: Veyangoda Rd, Katunayake, Negombo 94000 Sri Lanka
text:
This hotel is near the airport which is why it was chosen for us after a long flight; it is in a lovely setting with a good pool area. Our room was  a bungalow with a sitting room, bedroom and large bathroom but it is in need of modernisation.
We tried walking to find a restaurant but it was along a busy road so we had to eat in the hotel and we were almost on our own. The food was fine although nothing special.
title: Good first night hotel

placeInfo/address: Veyangoda Rd, Katunayake, Negombo 94000 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed here the first and last night of our wildlife tour of Sri Lanka. It is handy for the airport but far enough away that there are no airplane engines to be heard.
The hotel is set in several acres of grounds with mature trees that is great habitat for lots of birds. There is also a lovely looking outdoor swimming pool.
The accommodation is in large semi-detached bungalows. Each has a living room with seating TV and a fridge, bedroom with double bed and bathroom.
The first bungalow we stayed in was in need of decorating and needed a good clean. The second bungalow was much better decorated and much cleaner.
The breakfast was buffet, with lots of choice. On a first stay there was a particularly good egg curry.
The evening meal is also buffet with plenty of choice. Unfortunately most dishes were tepid. Chef was kind enough though to cook a fresh dish of fish Masala for our table when the buffet ran out.
Free wifi was available.
Would definitely stay here again if visiting Colombo
title: Handy for the airport

text:
Went for a day out this week end to this hotel with family.
Welcome was fine but we didn't like the welcome drink.Pool was nice and pool guy was friendly.All the staff were friendly and helpful throughout.

placeInfo/address: Veyangoda Rd, Katunayake, Negombo 94000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: very comfortable room
text: I would say it is a three star hotel,  I arrived around 7pm only on transit for about 5 hours. My first impression was the hotel is nice, quiet but the service was very slow.  To check us in was very slow especially our time was short.  Room very nice though and comfortable.  Food in the restaurant were cold even the soup.  No attention give to guests and you have to find your way around.
title: On transit stay at Tamarind Tree

placeInfo/address: Veyangoda Rd, Katunayake, Negombo 94000 Sri Lanka
text: We only stayed here for one night and the place looks nice on the surface but there were a few things that annoyed us.  The construction of the doors and stairs were off.  Also, the price of food at the restaurant was way over priced.  It was our most expensive meal in Sri Lanka.  The location was fine for the safari but if you are looking for value I think you can find better.
title: Looks nicer than it is

placeInfo/address: Veyangoda Rd, Katunayake, Negombo 94000 Sri Lanka
text:
The setting is lovely with attractive cottages spaced widely in a quiet garden, close to the airport but not noisy, with a nice pool. But it all lacked attention to detail and some normally expected facilities as well as a limited food offer. The cottages were large but only the bedroom had ac so the rest was difficult to make good use of - the one fan was insufficient so the choice was open windows and insects or closed windows and stuffy. There were no safe and no coat hangars and the standard of cleaning was not high.  It wasn't busy so the buffet was limited - in fact the second night was a set menu and the coffee pot looked it had been in permanently for the two days we were there.  The dining room was quite warm despite some ac with large windows that couldn't open to allow air in and there were no fans. In contrast to the rather grand reception the dining room was furnished with metal folding chairs designed for the much smaller Sri Lankan and uncomfortable for a tall family. 
So a bit of a curates egg - could be a real gem but needs work!
title: Could be great...

ownerResponse/text:

Tamarind tree hotel
placeInfo/address: Veyangoda Rd, Katunayake, Negombo 94000 Sri Lanka
text:
stayed for 2 nights, food is average, drinks overpriced, service average rooms are very tired.If you require anything from water to soft drinks, sunsceam etc etc it requires a walk of around 400 metres to the shop outside the front gate.
The pros are it is close to the airport and the swimming pool is OK the grounds garden etc is kept in good condition and is very quiet.
I would opt to going to Negombo 10 or so minutes up the road as there are some nice hotels there as well as many restaurants,of various food and price close by, Heritage hotel is one that comes to mind.
title: average hotel

placeInfo/address: Veyangoda Rd, Katunayake, Negombo 94000 Sri Lanka
text: I stayed one night in a 'basic' room, and another in a 'villa' type room. The basic room was average at best. The Bathrooms needed to be cleaned better. The villa was nice, but again the bathrooms could be cleaner. The hotel was supposed to cover my $8 airport transfer, but refused to. It's not a big expense, but more about principle. The woman at reception wasn't accommodating or helpful, and their mistake delayed my airport transfer 30 minutes. The staff and services (food, pool) are average for Sri Lanka.The hotel is close to the airport, so convenient, but otherwise I wouldn't spend the relatively higher cost to stay here again.
title: Average hotel and staff. Relatively costly.

ownerResponse/text: Thank you for a great review of your stay at Tamarind Tree Hotel Katunayake. We are happy that you like our food and facilities. We appreciate very much your positive feedback and your constructive observation. Thank you for staying with us and we do hope to see you again soon.
placeInfo/address: Veyangoda Rd, Katunayake, Negombo 94000 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed here for one night at the start of a tour of Sri Lanka. The hotel is easily accessible from the airport. Check in was smooth and efficient.  The accommodation was in bungalows which was very spacious with separate lounge and bedroom areas. The bungalow were well equipped with tea/coffee making facilities, TV etc. Wi-fi was not accessible within the room (only able to access by reception).
The lounge was very warm smelt stale and smoky but the bedroom and bathroom were fresher and cooler. Air conditioning in the bedroom worked well.
The grounds were extensive, clean and well maintained. There was a small patio area outside and a nice pool area.The food here was ok but a little overpriced.
title: Nice setting

placeInfo/address: Veyangoda Rd, Katunayake, Negombo 94000 Sri Lanka
text:
This was my second stay at Tamarind over the past two years. Sadly, the hotel is at the end of its glory days. I imagine is was once a marvelous hotel, with garden paths to wander and nice cabins. Unfortunately the hotel today is rundown. Maintenance and upgrading is sorely needed. Air conditioning, when it works, is available only in the bedrooms. The bathroom and sitting rooms are sweltering. The rooms are also ragged and worn looking. Tamarinf Tree needs an injection of capital for renovations. 

The food is not up to the standards of other hotels in the area. I certainly will not stay here again.
title: The Tail end of Glory

placeInfo/address: Veyangoda Rd, Katunayake, Negombo 94000 Sri Lanka

text: I was in a flight long back years in 2007 from manila, hongkong then stop over in colombo for one night stay in this hotel "tamarind tree" as part of inclusive deal of my trip to Saudi Arabia. The hotel was good, breakfast was good and there was good pool.
title: Overnight  stay

placeInfo/address: Veyangoda Rd, Katunayake, Negombo 94000 Sri Lanka
text:
Stopped here 1 night as part of tour with Exodus. Nice hotel in pleasant grounds, away from any restaurants so only able to eat in hotel restaurant. Evening buffet had a good choice of different foods, but a little pricey for Sri Lanka at R2200 (£11) each. Large beer £3. Good choice for included breakfast.

Typical 3 star hotel, but bungalows in need of updating. Bathroom very tired

Pool immaculately kept and very clean
title: Nice typical 3 star hotel in pleasant grounds

placeInfo/address: 831 1/3, Pelwehera Road, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka
text:
Отель находится в сердце джунглей. По утрам звуки как в зоопарке. Очень колоритно. Сервис  хороший. Ужин по меню, на выбор по два блюда из основного и закусок. Напитки за деньги и не малые. Бокал красного обычного вина 9 евро. Для Шри-Ланки это космос. В других отелях около 3 евро стоит. Номера уже устарели. Воняет канализацией. 
Бассейн чистый, есть душ.
title: Отличное место, но номерам требуется ремонт.

placeInfo/address: 831 1/3, Pelwehera Road, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka
text: Set deep in the Sri Lankan countryside near Dambulla this hotel has very nice staff, who try to be as helpful as possible - especially the manager.  However, the building itself and the public areas & rooms need a bit of care and love: some rugs on the floor (plenty being sold on every roadside stall!) some pictures on the walls, and some low level warmer lighting would cheer it all up enormously as it is rather grey and dark being surrounded with many lovely trees and bushes. We had torrential rain on first night (we stayed for 2) and it was really noisy pounding on the rather strange roofing arrangements - and it was also possible to hear other guests in adjacent rooms ....not always what one wants to hear! Some rugs and wall hangings would thus damp down the noise.The rooms we had were called "deluxe" but we don't think they really were. We'd love to come back to SL and help you make the place rather less austere!  A very warm welcome from the staff was delightful though!
title: Lovely staff & very quiet location (other than when other noisy guests are shouting at 6am!) - rooms need some attention

We spend 3 nights here.

The room is big and modern, unfortunately  with 40 bugs and mosquitos.

When we arrived the next evening from the tour we found our room was not cleaned. What normaly doesn't bother me at all but with 40 dead bugs all over the floor would have been nice.
Room was then cleaned on the third day after asking, but no towels changed. 
The bed linen and towels had a very bad smell and were very dirty. This needs to improve a lot.
Really disgusting, no other words for this.

Food was really good. But a lot was too spicy for  my taste.
Also communication was hard some times.
Asked for one thing got another etc.
Pool is really lovely 
We were the only ones in the hotel at that time.

text:
This is a great hotel, if you don't mind a desolate lonely place that's far away from it all. The insects and mosquitoes can also be an issue. The lake is not exactly right by the hotel, you will need to walk a distance. it is not visible from the hotel either. 

There is practically nothing to do at this hotel. There is nothing to entertain yourself with other than stare at the grass grow, though my kids had fun chasing after the stray dogs in the yard. 

The phones worked intermittently in the room. The light from the walkway outside shone in very brightly and couldn't be turned off, I only learnt when we were leaving that you could do this by walking to the end of the corridor and turning it off. 

The food was fantastic and the cook must deserve credit. The hotel staff try their best to make your stay memorable.
title: Far from everywhere, not bad, INSECTS for friends, not everything works

Spent three days at Calamansi Cove located on a beautiful piece of beach in Balapitiya. 

The villas were extremely well designed and were comfortable. The pool was great too. 

The head chef had only joined three days before we arrived but all the items on their (limited) menu were very well presented and tasty. The chef - Thushara and his staff including Dulaj, Dilshan, Amila etc went out of their way to make our stay as comfortable and memorable as possible. Their service was outstanding. 

The only downside we encountered was with the quality and cleanliness of their linen. It was very old, discoloured and looked well past their use-by date. Hopefully, they can look at this seriously as it wasn't very pleasant for a good nights sleep or to use to towel yourself after a shower.

placeInfo/address: Wijerama Road Brahakmana Watte, Balapitiya 80550 Sri Lanka
text:
We booked a 5 days stay at Calamansi cove as a short honeymoon. If you're looking to be away from noise and light pollution, then this place is for you. A romantic relaxing getaway with an exclusive access to a somehow private beach..

In terms of location, this place is a gem. But when you think of the area (balapitiya), there's not much to do there, except for the nearby river and lake activities. 

Now the hotel itself is something else, the rooms are very nicely designed and all, but you can see they're getting slowly rundown. The amenities are not bad, but also not so great when considering the experience that you would expect from such an "exclusive" place. 

The pool is nice and clean. Well maintained as well.

The restaurant and bar are next to the pool. Restaurant menu is OKAY but again, you'd expect a lot more from a place like this.. The bar's menu is not so rich, with a few cocktails and beers and some spirits..
It's worth mentioning that the chef is very good and the food was delicious.

The breakfast menu is also not very rich, offering a western breakfast with fruits and mains, in addition to a local breakfast option.

The staff are very welcoming, friendly and very hospitable. We felt really embraced by everyone there. And the service was great. Actually this place is lucky to have such an amazing staff.

Overall, I believe this place is overpriced when compared to what you're getting in exchange for your money.

Hope this is helpful, personally we might go back if we're passing by that area, but to stay for one or two nights MAX.
title: Could be much better

placeInfo/address: Wijerama Road Brahakmana Watte, Balapitiya 80550 Sri Lanka
text:
It is a lovely place to stay but so expensive. For the price we expected everything to be a little better than it was. Room service come at random times of the day, and we found several thick black hairs around the room from the previous guests : ( 
The room is lovely, as is the bathroom and there is an outside shower which is fun. The aircon is pretty loud and really blasts air out at you and you cant change the setting, so we didn't sleep amazingly. The beds and huge and very comfy. 
We were surprised how little English some of the staff spoke, it made it difficult to resolve a couple of problems we had, although Sharlini spoke very good English and was really helpful. 
The pool is amazing and the beach is lovely, especially if you walk left to the rocky part, feels like your own private beach although don't swim near the rocks as the locals told us that is where the sewerage from the village flows. 
Breakfast is great, but it is incredibly expensive to eat here and the food, although beautifully presented, is average. There is an amazing restaurant called Bord'eux in town that served incredible chicken curry. 
All in all we had a very relaxing stay here but wouldn't come again as you can get more for your money eslewhere
title: Very expensive

the landscape is very well maintained and the general ambiance is great.

placeInfo/address: Porutota Road, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka
roomTip: If you are staying in any Jetwing Hotel, make sure you confirm your reservation up to the day of check-in by the person who made it.
text:
My family and I enjoyed a memorable night at Jetwing Beach Hotel in December, and we enjoyed many aspects of our stay. Our rooms were very big and specious and the food was absolutely fantastic, room service was prompt and pleasant. The pool and beach made for perfect relaxation spots, accentuated by a range of 5-star amenities.

However, our check-in experience left a lot to be improved. Despite having made the reservation, and my father even came the week before to confirm the reservation, the reception staff wasted almost 20-30 minutes to check us in and insisted on my father's ID card to complete the check in process. Although my parents were in another car and arrived about 10 to 15 minutes after us, nothing was done to facilitate the ease of our check-in process. Our bags were not even moved from the entrance to the reception. My wife and brother had to stay with them and were not even offered a cool towel or drink while they were with the luggage. Also, they required a second ID for the second room which I could have provided had they been more proactive. Finally, when we were taken to our rooms, my father mentioned all of the time wasted at check-in to the staff member who took us to the room, and all she had to say was there is new staff at reception and they have not been properly trained. What kind of excuse is this?

Disappointingly, this was not the first time we faced this issue. We had a similar check-in experience during our stay at Jetwing Blue Hotel as well, where our time was wasted by the reception staff due to apparent disorganization and inadequate training of new employees. Given that they serve as the initial point of contact for guests, it's crucial that reception staff are well-trained by upper management.

While everything beyond the reception experience was delightful and up to our expectations, it's clear Jetwing has a serious issue in employing and properly training the reception staff. The initial check-in process needs significant improvement, because first impressions upon entry is a key KPI in maintaining a hotel's standard. If the initial encounter is not met with satisfaction, it does not matter what the rest of the experience is. Hopefully, our next check-in experience will be smoother, or we might have to consider staying at Jetwing's competitor hotels in the future. Nonetheless, Jetwing Beach remains a favourite, and we hope to see improvements for a more enjoyable experience in the future.
title: Good Stay but Improvements Needed at Check-in

The food from in room dining also a big positive.Breakfast is decent with ab ala carte menu. Overall the stay was average with the highlights being the pool and the food

ownerResponse/text:

We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and found the tranquil and scenic environment at Jetwing Blue appealing. Your kind sentiments shared towards our associates is appreciatively acknowledged.

placeInfo/address: Porutota Road, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka
text:
The Jetwing Blue has been my regular stop before hopping a flight back to the US for year. This time, I was visiting with about 20 of my friends from the US. Hotel and rooms are still exceptional, and staff is attentive and accommodating. 

The only negative is that the hotel caters heavily to day visitors (not staying at the hotel) and maybe cannot keep up with service for the guests who are actually staying at the hotel. This is especially noticeable at the bar, where they could use some extra staff.

It remains my go-to hotel near the airport as both the pool and beach areas are exceptional!
title: Still the best place to stay before catching a flight out of Sri Lanka

placeInfo/address: Porutota Road, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed at Jetwing for two nights, one either end of our stay up in Trincomalee. We stayed the night we arrived into Sri Lanka before transferring and again the night before we flew back to the UK. 

Because of this, we can't comment on the pools, facilities etc. as we didn't get a chance to use them. 

However, the staff are really welcoming and helpful from the moment we arrived. The welcome drink and cold towel when we first got in was appreciated! We had a really lovely room, nice and spacious with tea/coffee making facilities, modern TV and access to Netflix for when the monsoon rains hit! 

The food in the restaurant was really good, breakfast was the highlight. The set menu does make it quite a bit of food so make sure you go hungry (!) but it's really well presented and tasted lovely. 

Our only issue was the noise levels. On both nights that we stayed, we were woken multiple times during the night by either dogs barking/howling on the beach, guests or staff talking at really loud levels in the corridors/rooms and the staff clearing room service plates. 

The final straw came when someone was clearly collecting room service plates for a large party and spent a good 20 mins outside our room door scraping food and noisily piling plates up at 2am! It seemed common sense to us not to do this loudly in the middle of the night but when we asked the man to be quiet, he seemed quite shocked as to why we asked!

It's a shame as if it wasn't for this, we wouldn't have hesitated to recommend the hotel.
title: Fantastic staff, nice hotel - just noisy!

placeInfo/address: Porutota Road, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka
text:
In the month of April 2023 we had availed to the services of Jetwing (6 travellers).
Our Dirver & Tour Escort Mr. Chandana Karunasekara was  perfect in his encompassed services and brilliantly portrayed the Sir Lankan & Jetwing hospitality.
However, one major hitch with is very much regretted and was the consequental experience of not having Wifi ervices on the vehicle utilized and allocated during our 4 days stay in Sir Lanka.
We have written to the Management of Jetwing regarding the issue after our return from the holiday.  No response as yet from them.
Wifii provision on tour operated vehicles is an imporant amentity and must be mandatory.
Accessing the Internet especially during our travel/tour has become internationally so engrained in our day to day necessaity rathan than a mear leisure that having to pay for it (or worse still, not having access to it at all) seems well...... rather ridiculous.
It would be worthwhile mentioning and bringing to Jetwings attention that having access to free and fast WiFi on tourist travel vehicles means that guests can stay in touch with their families at any given time during the road travel.  And happy guests mean better tour travel experiences. Provided free and fast WiFi access will help them feel relaxed and satisfied making the most of their holiday and avoid the Guests additional roaming internatinal charges.
Through this posting in TripAdvisor I hope Jetwing seriously considers this vital amenity as absolutely essential to their tour experience.
Jetwing please try to make a difference to your outlook in providing guests with basis connecitivity rahter than being penny wise pound foolsh.
title: Jetwing Wifi Mttters !!!!!!! For All round communiction

placeInfo/address: Porutota Road, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Large spacious rooms but poor service and no Covid safety measures
text:
Rooms are spacious and comfortable. However service was terrible,
Had to go and stand in the dining area waiting until a waiter was available to come and show a table. Took a long time to clean and lay the table. Tables were not sanitized properly. 
No temperate checks or sanitisation for guests on arrival. No safety measures taken whatsoever. Very concerning the completed disregard for Covid protocols. Other hotels have take stringent health safety measures. 
Staff are under trained and clueless. Very poor service.
Food was good. 
Beach front is large and wide. But the sea itself in this area not friendly for swimming or sea bathing so not much you could do besides using the pool, walking on the beach, and sleeping in the room!
View of the sea from rooms blocked to an extent by coconut trees so view isn’t great from upper floors. Ground floor is adjacent to the pool so may get noisy when the pool is full of people. 

Also car park is on the opposite side of road from the hotel. Guests must unload bags and drive to the car park and cross the road!!! Not ideal
title: Large rooms but terrible service and no Covid protocols whatsoever

Wouldn’t feel I was getting value if paying over £100 for 2 b&b.

placeInfo/address: 16 Park Road, Colombo 00500 Sri Lanka
text:
Sunday I came to the ME Colombo International Buffet. Really, there was no international quality. I was disappointed. The pasta smoke chicken salad was spoiled. I can't even imagine. I am a pasta lover. That's why I know the taste well. It's my first time. 
It was the first time that I found a spoiled pasta with a bad smell. Is there no one to check the quality of the food produced in the hotel and test it? I wanted to talk to the executive chef about this, but unfortunately it did not happen. 
It is disgusting that a buffet in a hotel is at such a low level. The pasta salad in the buffet was not good, so I took one from Action Kitchen. I am sorry to say that it was not made as described. It also had no taste. I am thinking about this. 
The management needs to pay attention. I can't recommend this buffet at all. But I must say that the staff of the restaurant provided good service.👍
title: A buffet of spoiled food🤮
