placeInfo/address: 16 Park Road, Colombo 00500 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Nosiy roof, no sound proofing so the higher the better i guess
text:
I have tried to add categories about the hotel - hope this is useful
Overall not a bad hotel if you are looking for a cheaper room in Colombo zone 2 (hotel district i am told)

Pool
There was a rooftop pool that looked lovely and was great views at the top of hotel, the pool was freezing however and there was no sun loungers and the pool was covered but would not have been able to sunbathe
Staff
Upon check in they were really friendly and even upgraded our room to one with a balcony
When we decided not to stay a second night the staff were really helpful and helped us arrange a taxi
Room 
The bathroom is just a glass wall with a see through blind so if someone if using the toilet you can see and hear everything
The room itself felt quite small, it was long but it felt squashed, it was well decorated and it was comfortable and the bathroom had soap and shampoo
At night there was some kind of party with really loud music ( we had a long day travelling) it did stop before we went to sleep but you could hear the road noise 
Hotel 
The decor of the hotel was nice very modern and it has everything you need, with a rooftop bar and pool and a restaurant. The ground floor just had a reception and a small business room and one toilet and everything else was on a high floor. The stairways were quite narrow.
The bar was on the rooftop and when we arrived there was a DJ playing and we were informed the bar would close at 10.30pm. We did not have a drink but it seemed a nice atmosphere
Good WIFI throughout

Food 
We only ate breakfast here, there was a small selection and it was help yourself but there was enough to eat, well stocked and fresh

Location 
I didn't check out what was local other than the supermarket and that was super close, the hotel could have arranged a taxi if needed
title: Nice hotel but not sound proof

placeInfo/address: 16 Park Road, Colombo 00500 Sri Lanka
text:
Me and my 5 yr old son stayed at Me Colombo for 2 weeks in Dec/Jan, we were in room 403, even though the room was on a higher floor we could still hear every passing vehicle on the road, the hotel should improve more on a noise cancelling system in order to give a good nights sleep to their guests. 

Also the hotel should improve more on the skills of their restaurant and kitchen staff, every time we ordered room service we had to wait  for long time to get our food and drinks, we had to call & ask why it’s taking too long. It’s not that the hotel was full it’s simply the lack of skills of the staff, One day when I ordered food and drink for my son, we waited for more than an hour & as usual I called & checked & was told the food will be delivered soon, but after another 15 minutes the guy came only with the drink and no food, we were told that they are unable to accommodate our request, this they told us after waiting for the food for more that an hour which they should hv told us when we placed our order, I was so angry because by then my son was crying as he was super hungry and I had to order food from an outside restaurant. I was very disappointed with the hotel that day.

Special thanks to Nadeeshani & Nissanka at the front desk for exceptional customer service during our stay.

House keeping guys did a great job everyday.

The location of the hotel is excellent very convenient.

I would definitely think twice before booking Me Colombo again.

P.Ranawaka
Australia
title: Our stay at Me

placeInfo/address: 16 Park Road, Colombo 00500 Sri Lanka
text: This hotel looks nice, sure it’s a designer hotel. The room was ok, apart from all the flies and mosquitoes that were permanently inside (despite not being able to open a window) and no hot water. The breakfast was average, the second day we didn’t even get all the breakfast we had to ask for the fruit and pastries and didn’t even bother with the juice they never gave us. We were also told the brekky was going to be $10 it was $28. If we had of known we wouldn’t have eaten there. The staff were friendly enough. The pool was great. Just make sure you take insect repellent and a tonne of cash for all the extras they add onto the bill.  We were also charged an additional 1000rupees for the ‘shuttle’.
title: Pretty average for 4.5 stars

placeInfo/address: 16 Park Road, Colombo 00500 Sri Lanka
text:
A little bit disappointing as, probably, my expectations were high, also because of the online reviews I had the chance to read.

Nice design property, located in Colombo 5.

CONs
- room not ready at the time of check-in (but, true to be told, they granted us a free upgrade for that)
- charge on credit card not completely clear (they billed me in advance in USD and because of a "bizarre" rate exchange 97,74 USD seem to be equal to 98,07 EUR ! 🤔)
- some work of maintenance is needed all around the hotel (i.e.repainting some walls, changing some cushions with holes, etc.)
- small bathroom and with no privacy (at night, the curtains does not work properly)
- no licence for alcoholic drinks (yet) but, despite that, they (already) have a menu full of cocktails and liquors
- restaurant at 1st floor not available for dinner, because of a private event which would have been held the next morning/afternoon
- poor value for money

PROs
- attentive and helpful staff (greatly appreciated the advice about the metered tuk tuks and the "PickMe" app: thanks a lot!)
- delicious breakfast
- swimming pool at the rooftop
title: Disappointing

placeInfo/address: 16 Park Road, Colombo 00500 Sri Lanka
text:
The positives - the hotel is in a great location overlooking the cricket pitch. On the roof you can lie in the pool and watch the matches being played, a great way to spend a lazy afternoon. The staff were very friendly and smiley, when they could be found. 
The negatives - Although a new hotel it is quickly showing signs of wear and tear. Strange decisions seem to have been made in the planning, for example there are no sunbeds around the pool area. On the rooftop bar & pool area they have a toilet, but no sink for hand washing - bizarre! 
While staff were polite, they were extremely difficult to locate and did not give clear information. We ordered mini burgers&fries with an extra side of fries and they charged us 1,000 rupees for the fries - more than the cost of the burger. When we queried this, they brought us a menu from a different F&B outlet in the hotel to try and justify the hiked up price.
title: okay, but could have been much better

placeInfo/address: 16 Park Road, Colombo 00500 Sri Lanka
text: The staff is very nice and the rooms are nice and comfortable. There is a beautiful swimming pool but no sun beds ?!? So you can go to the pool but impossible to relax around it. Disappointing. This is why I’m giving 3.
title: No sun beds around the pool.

placeInfo/address: 16 Park Road, Colombo 00500 Sri Lanka
text: Spent two nights here upon arriving to Sri Lanka. Modern artchitecture. Rooms on the small side. Funny warm water were you had to turn a switch 10 min Before taking a shower. Beds were quite hard and not to my liking. Breakfast and lunch was excellent and we had an enjoyable afternoon by the pool which was nice and relaxing.
title: OK but a bit off the track

ownerResponse/text:
Greetings from ME Colombo!!!

Dear Mrs.White,

Thank you for staying with us and for bringing to our attention some issues you faced whilst with us. 

We are still at soft opening stage, hence all inconvenience raised accordingly. We are going to have our grand opening very soon with all fully equipped bar facilities .We truly appreciate your time taken to observe and comment constructively on areas where there were lapses. While we regret for the lapses on our part, 

However we apologize for the inconvenience caused to you during your holiday.

We hope you will give us another opportunity to offer you the best of service after grand open . Until then, best of luck for your future travels.
placeInfo/address: 16 Park Road, Colombo 00500 Sri Lanka
text: The place is lovely but the information about the pool bar was misleading. I booked that spot because it claimed to have a rooftop bar... they do have a pool but they don’t have a liquor license.... I was really disappointed it was advertised as a bar because I had hoped to have drinks after touring around hot Colombo in the day.... the service they did provide was slow to say the least.... like 30 mins to get a cup of tea..
title: Not operating at full capacity

ownerResponse/text:
Hi Sally
thanks for your review and sorry to hear that you were not happy with your stay. Our double rooms have 25m² plus 10m² bathroom plus 12m² balcony. They feature kings size double beds with good mattresses and mosquito nets. They have air condition, fridge, locker, water cooker, telephone and satellite TV. The bathrooms have big showers with hot water with high pressure. So I think they are not so basic. Correct, they do not have a closet but a rack for suitcases and hooks to hang things, as most guests only stay for one or two nights.
The list price for the winter season 24/25 for a double room with breakfast is £67. Half board is £7,40 per person for a 3 course menu. You are always welcome to convert this amount to a la cart order from our menu. I don't know where you paid the £200 per night.
Sorry for the noise from the workers. We'll try to avoid that!
placeInfo/address: 2066 1/2 Ekamuthugama, Usweliara, Udawalawa 70190 Sri Lanka
text: Overall, we enjoyed our stay here, but mostly because of the activities we did away from the hotel. The staff were friendly but the room was basic, no storage for clothes, it could have done with a deep clean and the bathroom was full of insects. Our company had booked us for half board, but the food choices were limited, just 3 options, and they weren't great. Breakfast wasn't much better with cold eggs and the worst jam ever encountered. Drinks were expensive. We went for a swim and for an hour a groundsman used a very noisy power tool right next to us. We asked him to stop, which after 5 minutes or so he did. A manhole cover was left off at the pool surround. After some time, my husband replaced it as no staff were apparent to do so, and it was dangerous. We enjoyed sitting on the balcony, although there was no view, but we did see some birds and a giant squirrel. Conclusion, OK, but at over £200 per night, far too expensive for what it is.
title: Could do better

ownerResponse/text:
Hello Sunny

thanks for your review. Sorry to hear that the cats were annoying. We have 3 of them and they usually don’t bother our guests, but one of them was in season, so all neighbours cats showed up at our place to have a party. Meanwhile we visited the vet with our cat, so this type of party shouldn’t happen again.
If you are allergic you can always use the first floor of our restaurants. Cats don’t go there.
The new signs for our access road are already in production - we had to move the rocks with the arrows to the other side of the road, due to construction works.
Thanks and enjoy your visit to Sri Lanka
placeInfo/address: 2066 1/2 Ekamuthugama, Usweliara, Udawalawa 70190 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed one night at this hotel while visiting the Udawalawe park. These are the the pros & cons of the place:

Staff members are very nice & helpful. A very special thank goes to Naamal.

The rooms are very clean & spacious and the balcony opens up to a nice woody area that allows bird watching.

Swimming pool is open 24 hours and is nice & clean.

Cons:

There are too many cats in the dining area mewing and jumping on to your lap making dining there very unsanitary & annoying. If you have a cat-allergy, avoid this place by all means!

The food was so so. We had our breakfast on the balcony to avoid the dining room and it was good with plenty of fruit.

The entrance to the hotel has very confusing directions that can easily be corrected if the owner or a worker spent 10 minutes with white paint & a brush.

It was sufficient for our visit, but we may not come back here. Sorry Naamal!
title: Nice place but too many cats in the dining hall!

ownerResponse/text:
Hi Freddy
sorry for the inconvenience. Our cook was on leave and his substitute fell sick. Usually we serve a real good curry as you can read in many review. 
Our double rooms have 25m², a big bathroom with hot shower, a private balcony, air condition, a supersize bed with mosquito net, flat screenTV with satellite channel and a set for making tea and coffee.  

Best regards
Gernot
placeInfo/address: 2066 1/2 Ekamuthugama, Usweliara, Udawalawa 70190 Sri Lanka
text: If i could give 3.5 rating then i would, this place is a good stop off for your safari. They organised us a great private tour. The rooms are fairly basic and for our two night stay they had no curry available so we had to settle for fried rice both nights so that was a little disappointing.
title: Just average

placeInfo/address: 2066 1/2 Ekamuthugama, Usweliara, Udawalawa 70190 Sri Lanka
text:
I was torn between 3/4 stars for this accommodation. 

We stayed for 3 nights, it’s basic but I think it has everything you need, nice pool, big spacious rooms, mosquito nets, air con.

Communication with the staff wasn’t the best, they asked us to order dinner in the mornings with a set time to eat. And on arrival 3pm we asked for Sri Lankan curry (vegetable) as we don’t eat meat and they said it wasn’t possible but would try for the 2nd night, so we had veg rice and veg noodles (the only other option) 

2nd/3rd night curry was good, although not sure they grasped the not eating meat as chicken was served first. 

Packed lunch for Safari wasn’t suitable (apart from fruit) but we weren’t given another option. 

Loved the resident Cat (Lynx) and the dogs who occasionally showed their faces. 

Overall it was good, but I’d probably try somewhere else next time.
title: 3.5 - Good

placeInfo/address: Mahagastota Hill Climb Blackpool, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text:
Die Umgebung ist wunderschön. Schöner Pool. Das Personal höflich und zuvorkommend. Das Essen schmeckt gut, nur war es meistens kalt. (Buffet aber auch Teller service)
Das Hotel ist sauber, dürfte jedoch etwas renoviert werden. (Teppich)

placeInfo/address: Mahagastota Hill Climb Blackpool, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text: Das Hotel liegt sehr schön umgeben von Feldern und Teeplantagen etwas außerhalb . Zimmer sind zweckmäßig aber auch schon etwas in die Jahre gekommen nicht alle mit Kühlschrank.  Das Essen war ordentlich aber das Kochen im Essbereich führt leider dazu das es nicht nur im Restaurant sondern im gesamten Haus nach Essen riecht. Ein absolutes no go.

placeInfo/address: Mahagastota Hill Climb Blackpool, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text:
I think the location is great and the rooms are rustic with speactaculatt view. The staff was king. They are taking great initiatives to be plastic free. 

What we felt might have let us down is the hotel bar not being upto the mark ( maybe cause of the off season). 

Pool table being charged when absolutely no one being in the hotel. 

Swimming pool was to be be heated but was not functional ( again maybe due to the weather) 

House keeping was not upto the mark.

placeInfo/address: Mahagastota Hill Climb Blackpool, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text:
Het hotel zelf is van de buitenkant minder mooi dan van de binnenkant. Fijne kamer die eigenlijk 4 bolletjes waard zijn. Alleen s avonds hadden we een wat minder prettige ervaring, het bier was heel duur van Sri lankaanse standaarden. Meer dan 5 euro per biertje. Ook moest je betalen voor het poolen. Hiervan waren de ballen overigens niet helemaal normaal, het was meer een soort stuiter-versie. 
S ochtends werd mijn moeder (omdat ze jarig was) wel verrast met een taart en happy birthday door de speakers. Het is voor dus eigenlijk een 7.
title: Jammer van het poolen

placeInfo/address: Mahagastota Hill Climb Blackpool, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text: Het hotel is verder van de plaats gelegen en dient vervoer te nemen. Het eten wordt geserveerd d.m.v. een buffet en menu. De kamer zijn ruime maar zijn wel wat verouderd. Bedden en beddengoed zijn netjes en slapen goed. Het Onderhoud / schoon  houden van het hotel laat de wensen over. Maar is blijkbaar bij de meeste hotels de standaard.

placeInfo/address: Mahagastota Hill Climb Blackpool, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text:
The hotel looks nice from the outside. Staff is friendly but restaurant staff leaves you with a mixed feeling about the place. The food was good and the lady in charge of the servants was attentive and friendly but the majority of the staff in the restaurant was slow, didnt seem to understand English and on one occasion we had to ask 4 times before we got the water we wanted ! 
We visited the spa. Staff was friendly but the room was very cold and didnt leave us with a true spa feeling.

placeInfo/address: Mahagastota Hill Climb Blackpool, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text:
Our next stop was The Blackpool hotel in Nuwara eliya.  
The hotel is beautiful with both the hill view and the garden view.
The room offered to us was neat and tidy with a small balcony facing the hills and the tea plantations.  
However, the towels were worn out. The room refrigerator wasn't working, hence were given a replacement. But, that too had the same problem.
The spa rates were skyrocketing and not worth the try.
We had opted for buffet breakfast and dinner while booking the room. But, were left with very limited choices as they had not layed the spread. Hence, being vegetarians were forced to stick to the set of very few options available at their end.
The service in the restaurant was also average, as they would frequently forget to serve the ordered items. 
Overall, a good hotel but overly priced.
title: Good hotel which burns a hole in the pocket!

title: Average

text: Stayed for just one night on a busy tour.  A lot cooler up there so was looking forward to the "hot" pool but it was very cold so not able to use it. placeInfo/address: Mahagastota Hill Climb Blackpool, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text:
Warm and personal welcome including a cup of hot chocolate. Room was very good as well, not large but well equipped, incl. a faux fireplace. However, other parts of the hotel lack flair, eg the bar. 

Service is good and staff very eager to please, with a tendency to be obtrusive. We received various calls/visits to check if everything is in order. 

Dinner was disappointing. There is only a buffet option at LKR 3,200 pp. Buffet was huge but mainly catered to Chinese guests, with a small corner of local curries. Quality was mediocre and value for money not good, maybe we were unlucky that evening. On the other hand, local breakfast was very good. 

Bottom-line: not a bad hotel at all but too expensive for the product experienced, maybe due to the generally high price level in April.
title: Mixed impressions

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Pizz,

Thank you for the comments you have shared in the TripAdvisor.

We are glad that you enjoyed your stay at The Blackpool Hotel.

The hallmark of The Blackpool Hotel has always been the food and the service. The Hotel was running full house and all comments received by guests were recorded as extremely good. However, we are surprised to note that your food was cold.
We have carefully checked the comments given by other guests and all comments record very high rankings. Therefore, we disagree on the views expressed by you.

We wish you ling life, happiness and peace.

R.Muthuramesh
Leader of the House
RESIDENT MANAGER
THE BLACKPOOL HOTEL

placeInfo/address: Mahagastota Hill Climb Blackpool, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text: Stayed here for 3 nights and had an upgrade.  Large King bed and spacious room.  The hotel is set among local tea and vegetable properties with the locals going about their daily routines.  We loved the room and the staff were very helpful  Would like to give the hotel 5 stars but the dining was very poor.  We had two dinners and two breakfasts.  Whilst the staff did their best they did not seem to have any idea how to present food other than the local curries. The buffet breakfast for example was cold .  When this was mentioned to the hotel management they did not seem to understand that the warming trays had to be hot.  The bacon was cold, bake beans cold and the same with other items.  The only warm food was the eggs because they were cooked fresh plus the local curries.
title: Great location and lovely hotel

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Piyumi,

Thank you for staying at The Blackpool Hotel.

We have noted your compliments. on the staff, rooms. welcome and food.

It is customary at The Blackpool Hotel that during dinner time all guests are met and interacted with.

In the process of the conversation we do request guests to share their experience in the TripAdvisor as it is a widely read and many guests do plan their destination based on the reviews.

We sincerely apologize  if you were offended by our approach which is certainly unintentional, Please do stay with us on your next visit to the Hotel.

bEST WISHES,

placeInfo/address: Mahagastota Hill Climb Blackpool, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed at Blackpool for our anniversary and here I have some pros and cons found during our stay

Pros:
Hotel is beautiful. The staff was very friendly. We were given a warm welcome and well looked after. Rooms are spacious and there’s a nice fireplace to keep you warm in the cool clime. Food was very delicious. 5/5 for their hospitality. 

Cons:
The room amenities. THEY ARE REUSING SLIPPERS AND LAUNDRY BAGS! So better to have your own if you are going to stay at this hotel. 

I am not a person who is social media friendly and I must say that I had to create this TripAdvisor just to give you this ‘GOOD’ comment according to your GENERAL MANAGER. 

We were insisted to comment on TripAdvisor from the general manager whenever we were seen to him (particularly around the dinner table, we all were given business cards (He’s mistaken them to leaflets I believe haha) when we did not even ask for any from him. I find it very disturbing and unprofessional. We have been to many hotels but this is the first time we had to come across this kind of an experience. 

Comment is something we heartily give if we are beyond our satisfactions but this was a complete impel I would say.
title: Our hill country experience

placeInfo/address: Mahagastota Hill Climb Blackpool, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text: The hotel is located about 20 minutes drive from the center of Nuwara Eliya (Grand Hotel, Post Office), not in a very good neighborhood and almost across from a small Christian cemetery. As others have mentioned, there's nothing to do around it and you'll have to drive 15-20 minutes if you want to buy something, look for a place to eat or just take a walk in the quite dusty, dirty and characterless city. Our room was large and  had all amenities expected, the bathroom was large and had bathtub as well, and there was also large/long balcony overlooking the pool. The furniture of the room was a bit strange, perhaps more appropriate for a certain type of residence than a hotel, at least in our view. The overall attitude of the personnel was average, at the best. The reception staff was quite inquisitive about personal issues and perhaps their records should be better kept, considering that upon checking out we were asked to pay for a dinner bill that did not bear our signature and did not belonged to us.The person in charge of the restaurant was summoned, was quite aggressive at the beginning, but the mistake was realized, apologies we given and accepted. The whole process, however, took longer than it should have and did not leave us with a good feeling. I believe that the hotel staff could use some serious, professional,  hospitality industry type, customer service training. For us, it was an experience we are unlikely to repeat...
title: Newish hotel, average service, poor location

ownerResponse/text:
There is much about this review that concerns us. We have held a management meeting this morning about the points raised and would like to make the following observations.
Re the antagonistic Service mark of 1/5 - this compares with a run of reviews where our service is persistently highly praised. If the guest was so aggrieved by the confusion shown over the breakfast menu a la carte by a temporary steward we regret that any concerns were not raised with a senior member of staff which would have provided an immediate and amicable solution, and addressed the guest's "uncomfortable" feeling. Life is so much happier that way.
Re the "miserable" steward - as we do not believe this was not raised at the time, we are unable to make any worthwhile conclusion. But we are disturbed by the unfair implications in the somewhat overwrought suggestion that the guest did not like to use the courtyard pool because "they" were "congregating" around it. We are made uncomfortable by the word "they" in this context. 
Re the high mattress - it is true that we replaced all our mattresses in the past year and, as our commitment to the highest available quality we did opt for an extra mattress depth of 2 inches. If this makes the mattress higher on our antique four-poster beds, we think it is a small price to pay for the quality. We could have provided a stool on request.
Re the "dated" hotel - we believe we are a rare thing, a historic Sri Lanka hotel on the beach. We remain committed to large investments in keeping with the hotel's essential character and the provision of all modern amenities. At the current time, all our ground-floor bathrooms are having a full refurbishment, for example. That historic nature is our USP and it is why so many guests love us. People who want an obviously contemporary hotel should take more care when planning to book a contemporary hotel. We make this absolutely clear to all guests booking with us.
David Hopps, on behalf of Suite Lanka management
placeInfo/address: 868 Galle Rd Thiranagama, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text: Hotel is dated on a quiet section of beach. The room was clean ish, air con worked and we had pleanty hot water, the bed was quite high up for a shorter person not easy to get on it lol. Breakfast was a set menu or you could choose off the a la carte to a certain amount ££ which confused the staff!! issue i had with one member after questioning the spend amount resulted in him being rude and ignorant for the rest of our stay! majority of staff were ok this bloke was simply miserable and i was made to feel uncomfortable!! The hotel is quite a distance from the cemtre of Hikka but tuk tuks are readily available outside the hotel. The pool is in a ridiculous place within the hotel its in the middle in a small courtyard and after the incident with the waitor as that was where they congregated i didnt feel comfortable using it we also found the sea VERY rough so cooling down in the heat became a problem. I wouldnt stay at this hotel again due to the issues endured there are plenty choices in the centre of Hikka that looked better in my opinion.
title: Ok could have been better

ownerResponse/text:
Certaines de ces questions ont déjà été discutées avec le monsieur concerné, d’autres non. Maintenant qu’elles sont publiques, nous aimerions poliment faire les observations suivantes : nous acceptons le paiement à l’arrivée (le client peut voir la chambre s’il le souhaite) pour ce que nous considérons comme de bonnes raisons. Nous sommes surpris que le client n’ait pas vécu cela au Sri Lanka auparavant. Nous savons par notre propre expérience (j’ai personnellement travaillé en étroite collaboration avec des centaines d’hôtels de premier plan au Sri Lanka au cours des 20 dernières années) que c’est une pratique courante et nous pensons qu’elle crée une relation plus saine entre le client et le personnel. Cela signifie également que nous ne perdons pas de temps à courir après les clients pour obtenir un paiement qui pourrait être mieux utilisé pour servir tous nos clients d’une autre manière. Et cela signifie également que les clients ne partent pas (délibérément ou accidentellement) sans avoir payé. Et parfois, que cela nous plaise ou non, ils le font. La politique restera donc la même pour le bon fonctionnement de l’hôtel. Cela attire environ trois plaintes par an, ce qui est toujours décevant mais nous pensons que c’est nécessaire. En ce qui concerne les investissements, nous avons beaucoup investi dans Suite Lanka au cours des quatre dernières années et nous continuerons à le faire chaque fois que les fonds le permettront.
En ce qui concerne la performance des stewards sur la plage, nous considérons que les critiques sont largement fondées, car notre performance au cours des deux dernières semaines a été inférieure à ce que nous attendions. Cela est dû en partie – mais pas entièrement – ​​à l’absence inévitable du personnel pour des raisons personnelles. Nous avons nommé un nouveau steward cette semaine et une formation sera dispensée aux stewards actuels pour garantir une approche plus proactive. Nous sommes reconnaissants aux clients récents qui nous ont fait part de cette question. En ce qui concerne les prix, nous savons que nos prix restent compétitifs, même si notre succès signifie que nous avons dû nous enregistrer à la TVA et à la SSCL, ce qui ajoute un total de 21 % à nos coûts. Dans le monde entier, les hôtels ont du mal à répondre au désir des clients d’un excellent niveau de qualité tout en souhaitant des prix identiques à ceux d’il y a 10 ou 15 ans en période de crise économique. C’est un véritable défi et la plupart des commentaires de Tripadvisor suggèrent que nous sommes en train de le relever.
Cordialement
L'équipe Suite Lanka
placeInfo/address: 868 Galle Rd Thiranagama, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
roomTip:
Un petit resto super chouette juste en face de l’hotel   : two brother’s palace. 
Tres bon, tres sympa!
text:
Nous voyagions en famille avec nos 2 enfants. 

L’hotel est joli mais a besoin d’un petit coup de rénovation. C’est agréable d’avoir un accès direct à la plage qui est très belle aussi. Attention, ce n’est pas une plage de baignade, on peut jouer avec les vagues prudemment et nous y avons passé de très bons moments. 

La piscine est sympa aussi même si finalement pas indispensable tellement la plage est agréable. Peut être bien pour les plus petits enfants. 

Je mets 3 étoiles car pour moi, le service n’est pas à la hauteur de tous les autres hôtels que nous avons fait au Sri Lanka alors que celui-ci était de loin de plus cher. Parasols cassés dont personne ne se soucie, vous devez trouver quelqu’un pour demander un matelas, pas de pro activité. Et quand je dis « trouver » quelqu’un c’est parce que parfois, côté plage, vous avez l’impression qu’il n’y a pas de personnel… 

Finalement, on est mieux servi que par soi même mais pour le prix, je ne trouve pas ça ok. 

Pendant plus de 2 jours on a assisté a des querelles et accouplement de chiens à toute heure du jour et de la nuit au sein de l’hotel, entre les transats… 

A l’arrivée, vous n’avez pas le temps de vous poser qu’on vous demande deja de payer l’entièreté du séjour. Première fois que je voyais ça. 

On sent clairement que sur la cote de manière générale, on est plus dans le business que dans l’accueil, pourtant si présent chez les Sri Lankais. 

On a passé un  excellent moment néanmoins mais le prix n’est pas en adéquation avec le service proposé par l’hotel.
title: Un peu déçu…

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Mr Mulders
As you will be aware this is the third site on which we have responded to your comments about stray dogs - the fourth if you count our private messages when I investigated the points you raised further - and provided infirmation. This infrmation has not led you to edit your comments so apologies if this is becoming repetitive but I must again provide some context to the points you raise.
As you will now be aware we have made considerable efforts to manage the recent, sporadic presence of stray dogs (a possibility on all Sri Lanka beaches). We seek to do so in a humane manner which prioritises the safety and well-being of our guests. We support all efforts in Sri Lanka for sterilisation of stray dogs where these efforts will be of benefit to local communities and we are encouraging the local Hoteliers' Association to become involved. We provide infographics in all guest rooms and in the menus in our beach restaurant (you may have seen them) appealing to guests not to feed or encourage the dogs: Sadly, a minority ignore this request out of a caring but we believe misguided desire to look after the dogs and this does not help the situation. Staff are instructed to prevent any stray dog from entering the hotel and, by and large, they take these responsibiiities seriously, but beach restaurants open to the beach, while being a dream location, also have obvious challenges. Clearly, as we seek to build Suite lanka's reputation, we would be stupid not to take them seriously.
We also asked you to give us more details about which member of staff you spoke to about the problems with the safe. We regard a working safe as an essential basic facility. The person you reported the issue to simply forgot during an emergency 14-hour shift caused by illness to other staff members. As far as we know, you did not remind anybosy after your initial reporting of the issue? Please correct us if not. Despte the staff member's obvious commitment, on this issue we fell  below our expected standards. We regard a working safe in every room as a basic necessity. 
On the subject of the towels, we have replaced a huge amount of towels this season and we use the best laundry in the area and we cannot identify any problem.
As for the sea, you came to the south-west coast in low season in August - a time of year when, although the weather is normally good, the seas are still high and when swimming cannot be guaranteed. Safe swimming can be relied upon perhaps only on the east coast at this time of year. We are grateful for the efforts of our neighbouring hotel to provide red flag warnings when they deem this to be appropriate, as well as the presence of a lifeguard.
Thank-you for staying with us and we regret that you do not appear to have found the same satisfaction as the vast majority of our guests this year. We wish you had given us more opportunity to address this during your stay as we believe that amicable communication is the best way to ensure a happy holiday. In the meantime, I have noted your instruction to us to address these matters promptly. Travel safely.
David
placeInfo/address: 868 Galle Rd Thiranagama, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text: Suite Lanka is a boutique hotel in Sri Lanka that offers nice and spacious rooms. The accommodation is comfortable and provides a pleasant experience. However, there are a few areas that require improvement. Firstly, the staff should prioritize ensuring that stray dogs do not roam around in the dining areas. This can be unsettling for guests and affects the overall dining experience. Secondly, during my stay, the locker in my room was promised to be fixed, but unfortunately, this never happened. This lack of follow-through on promises was disappointing. Additionally, the towels provided had an unpleasant smell, which was not ideal for a hotel of this caliber. Lastly, while the hotel boasts a beachfront location, it is important to note that swimming in the sea may not be feasible due to the presence of red flags and strong currents. Overall, Suite Lanka has potential, but certain aspects need attention and improvement for a more satisfying stay.
title: Suite Lanka is an oke place to stay

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Dina,

first of all thank you for having stayed with us and for taking the time to write a review.
However I would have appreciated, if you would have told me, what has made you unhappy, as we had a nice conversation together.
As I always appreciate guests feedback to improve our services and facilities, it would be great to understand what you meant with "A/C just ok". What the A/C should have done besides cooling down your room?

With regards to the "dirty bedding", what exactly do you mean? When you realized that the room boy saw stains or similar, but didn´t change it, why didn´t you tell him to do so?  Every room has a note mentioning, that we change the bedding every 4 nights unless the guests requests an early replacement. However I apologize, if you felt that your cleaning has been neglected.

Regarding the breakfast, please be so kind and give us your "constructive" advice, what could be done, that the breakfast doesn´t appear "basic" to you, especially because usually we are praised for our first meal of the day.

Again thank you for giving us the opportunity to improve our services.
I hope, that we will have the chance to serve you even better on your next visit to this beautiful country.

With kind regards,
placeInfo/address: 868 Galle Rd Thiranagama, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text: Basic room, a/c was just ok, unfortunately we had dirty bedding (the cleaner saw that while cleaning the room one day and didn’t change it), the breakfast served on the balcony with a wonderful sea view was basic, the staff was very nice and courteous. 20-25 minutes walking from main Hikkaduwa beach.
title: Basic

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Eva,
thank you very much for taking your time to comment on your stay, which is always helpful to improve the standard and the services.
But let me comment on some points you have mentioned to clarify:
1. You are right that swimming in the sea in front of the hotel is not advisable, but mainly during the months may through november. The remaining months the sea is fine. However one should be a good swimmer, because the surf is pretty strong and challenging even for body surfers. This year the sea became more rough earlier than normal.
2. Curtains: Yes, they are white and therefore they don´t block the light during the day, but the view. 
3. Towels: We use only towels fresh from the laundry, but as I am not 100% satisfied as well, we have just changed the provider to THE LAUNDRY GALLE (provides laundry services to the AMAN hotels etc.). 
4. Toiletries: We offer shampoo/shower gel in the shower
5. Hair Dryer: Can be obtained on request, because they turned out to be preferred souvenirs.
6. Air Condition: We had some problems with your particular A/C during your stay. Due to the strong seabreeze we have A/C problems more often than one would face them in city hotels. However that´s why generally maintenance staff would be on site within a couple of hours. Unfortunately your stay felt into the srilankan new year period, where almost "everybody" is travelling home and services are very limited. In your case we were helped only the next day. I apologize for that. However you were offered instantly an "upgrade" to one of our suites downstairs or even to our Penthouse on the top floor. Plus we offered you a free dinner. Please let me know what else we could have done to make you happy?  

Again I am sorry that the technical issue has caused so much trouble on your stay with us and I hope that you will give us the chance to serve you better during an other stay in the future.

With kind regards, Roland
placeInfo/address: 868 Galle Rd Thiranagama, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Don't book the corner deluxe room due to old noisy a/c.
text:
Location 2.5 hrs from Colombo airport, don't follow the GSP as wrong location in google maps. Right on the beach but you can't swim there or even jump in the waves. You can swim in front of Hikka Tranz or take tuk tuk to Unawatuna. Plenty of restaurants around, JHL next to Hikka Tranz highly recommended and Cinnamon guest house next door had amazing seafood platter.
Charming building with colonial feel and great spacious balcony with beautiful view, wifi signal strong, comfortable bed but pillows very hard and high. Breakfast can be served anytime and on your balcony if you wish. Staff welcoming,friendly, always smiling and trying hard to please the guests especially Damith but clueless most of the time as speak no English and often get things wrong. The only person who speaks English is the manager but he leaves in the evening so at night there's no one (only security guard who can not communicate). 

Curtains in the room are thin and don't block the light so the room is very bright since early morning and it wakes you up.
Towels old and worn out with strong smell, was reluctant to put them on my face, no toiletries, no hair drier.
Pool useless as located in the backyard surrounded by walls and kitchen entrance and window so no privacy and no nice setting.
The biggest problem is the a/c, in the deluxe corner room its very noisy with constant rattling sound and located just above the bed so peaceful sleep impossible. It regularly stops working and trips the circuit breaker so we had to always look for the staff and ask them to put it back, obviously when it stops at night you're left sweating in a steaming hot room. Manager was really apologizing and looking for a solution, offered higher category rooms on ground and 2nd floor but we opted to stay as we specifically booked the room for the balcony. We got a free meal then.

The property is advertised as 4* on booking.com and "luxury" on trip advisor however this is misleading as amenities offered don't match the price tag. Bottom line do your research as for the same price you can get much much more in Sri Lanka.
title: Nice setting, faulty A/C and terribly overpriced

placeInfo/address: 868 Galle Rd Thiranagama, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text: We managed to get two nights in the suite as a walk in and got a good discount.Relaxing set up with loungers in the shady garden Bed big and comfortable , however the shower despite looking impressive was a shambles with hardly any water pressure and an age for warm water to appear and then dissappear if you tried to add any cold water,  the same problem with tap water,  manager said he would fix it but never bothered so he'll have the same problem tonight!! Very expensive despite our discount but a lovely place to stay.
title: Peaceful retreat

placeInfo/address: 868 Galle Rd Thiranagama, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text:
Compared to some of the places we stayed in Sri Lanka, this was 5 star!! It is a beautiful building and I loved the traditional furnishings. I knew it wasn't going to be a modern 4 star lodging, this is a small beach resort in Sri Lanka. It backed on to a vast stretch of beach and this was on the quiet stretch. Had the place to ourselves. It is true that the sea is dangerous here. The waves are huge and the current too strong to paddle in. 

Food choice was limited and getting wifi was a mammoth challenge daily. I would advise picking time of year wisely as we went in rainy season and 2 of our 5 nights we were bedroom bound becasue the rain was torrential and impossible to go out in. We had to order room service which of course was limited. 

Staff were very friendly and there is a small pool in the courtyard to enjoy in the heat. 

Hikkaduwa is a strange place and perhaps best for young crowds, not romantic couples holidays.
title: Quiet and private lodgings.

placeInfo/address: 868 Galle Rd Thiranagama, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text:
There is no doubt the position of this small hotel is excellent, the staff were very pleasant, but the rooms were dated but had lovely views. Food was good but not excellent, broadband reliability was poor. 

Although the beach is only 50 meters from your door the ocean is too dangerous with under currents and rip tides to swim in, a point the brochure do not mention 

We sadly had a poor experience. We somebody walking off the beach and trying to get into our room at 4.15am one morning. It was all a bit scary but highlighted by the fact the would be villain must have walked straight past the "all night security" who are supposed to prevent this. 

The manager did not take the situation seriously, although he promised the windows would be screwed shut for the next evening, this did not happen. I eventually at 10pm at night had to find some wire and do the best I could and wire the windows shut.

Nice place, nice staff, superb position, very poor management
title: April 2012

placeInfo/address: 433 Galle Road Colombo 03, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Excellent stay
text:
Our stay at Mandarina Hotel Colombo was excellent overall. The rooms were spacious, well-maintained, and extremely comfortable. The food was delicious, offering a variety of options, and the housekeeping service was commendable.

However, we did face some service issues. When we checked in, Mr. Abdeen, who was responsible for taking our luggage from reception to our room, refused to lift my handbag, stating that he could not carry a bag containing a water bottle. Additionally, he did not handle the luggage carefully, and my bag was nearly damaged in the process.

At the restaurant, Mr. Ashwin's behavior was disappointing. He repeatedly asked how many people were dining and the ages of the children. During final billing, he unnecessarily checked the passports multiple times for age verification. Worse still, he added extra persons to the bill assuming we wouldn’t notice, as we were a group. But we were very well aware of our count and cross-checked the bill, asking him to revise it. After being corrected, he responded by saying he would check the CCTV footage to verify, which was quite unprofessional and uncomfortable. As we were honest, he found nothing wrong.

Mr. Ashwin needs significant training in customer service and polite behavior. His attitude affected an otherwise wonderful stay.

Despite these issues, everything else—from the rooms to the food and housekeeping—was excellent. With better training for some staff members, this hotel can truly offer a flawless experience.

Would still recommend this hotel for its overall quality and amenities.
title: Got it! Here's your updated review with all the new points added clearly and professionally:   ---  Excellent Stay with

text: The hotel is clean and offers a good selection of non-vegetarian dishes, with a decent buffet overall. However, the vegetarian options are limited, and the taste is average, making the buffet less appealing for vegetarians. No alcohol is served. While the hotel claims to be 4-star, I have my doubts. The rooms are not spacious, the services fall short of expectations, and the reception area is quite small. Housekeeping was inadequate, as rooms were not restocked with essentials like toilet tissues or coffee after cleaning. Additionally, there is no luggage storage available after checkout, which forced us to book an extra day to accommodate our flight schedule. There is a small swimming pool and a gym located on the rooftop.
title: Clean hotel

text:
The hotel doesn’t feel like a 5 star hotel and looks better than in pictures than in real life. My room needed a bit of an upgrade with visible mold and humidity damages on the wall and ceiling. The staff were not the warmest and sometimes it felt like you were bothering them when asking for something. They had trouble locating my booking at first and was trying to figure it out and they let me sit there for 45 min without an update which isn’t ideal after traveling 24 hours. Also note that the pool and pool area is a lot smaller irl where only 10 people can fit in the pool at the same time which might cause a problem during peak season. I also ordered a burger with room service that was unbeatable. Chewy and not nice, couldn’t finish it. My stomach also didn’t feel great after so I’m happy I didn’t. 

If this was a 3-4 star hotel my rating probably would’ve been better as it wasn’t a bad stay but it’s just more compared to the expectations I had going in.
title: More like a 3-star hotel

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Paajakri Juhani,

Greetings from Mandarina Colombo!

Yes we know who you are. You may have a pseudo name on TripAdvisor called tooteem, but your fake and false review will not phase us. 

Why is your review false and fake? It is so because you had put the same exact thing on Tripadvisor during your stay at the hotel on 07th JAN 2020 and as we do with all feedback, when we checked on it and met you, you clearly stated that you did it because you were upset that we didn't give a late checkout till 5PM for free.

Didn't you read the email which we sent you on the 05th JAN 2020 when you inquired about a late checkout. We had clearly stated that we will offer a free late checkout till 2PM and after which it will be chargeable.

Obviously we only give late checkout till 2PM for free after-all we are a business, but you were upset that we didn't confirm a late checkout till 5PM for free, 

You may not recall but we do have records to prove that you yourself stated that you will only remove the fake and false review which you had put on TripAdvisor during your stay after we spoke to you. You also claimed that this was put in anger because we didn't agree to a late checkout till 5PM. 

We have the entire conversation recorded because we knew that if you could falsely accuse us just out of anger, then you would not have it in you to honor your word but we gave you the benefit of the doubt and trusted you enough to give you your late checkout.

We thought you were genuine and but its our fault too. It is our fault too because we you took advantage of us and you took your late checkout for free, you yourself removed the review and now it's back again because you just could not be genuinely happy that you got what you wanted.

We honestly believe in ethics and a gentleman's word as being his bond and when we promise it, we deliver and we honor it. You however have failed to stick to your own ethics and given word.

It truly hurts to know that there are unethical persons in the world who do unethical things just to get what they want.

When we now reached out to you on WhatsApp asking you why you did this to us, you simply had no remorse that you took advantage of us.

We are ashamed of you and please never come to our hotel again.

We would also like to put it on record that, we do get negative feedback from time to time but we take them in high spirit as there is always something there in the feedback for us to improve, but with your fake and false review, we outright reject it and hope that you grow out of this ethic-less ethos.

Kind Regards

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Mathias, 

Thank you for taking the time to leave a review regarding your recent stay with us.

We usually receive high praise from our guests and the team is known to reach out and ensure that your stay is kept to be as comfortable as possible and we are glad that our colleagues were able to assist you during your stay, but it seems that despite our best efforts, we seem to have let ourselves down and not lived up to our reputation. 

Please accept my sincere apologies on behalf of the entire team but we would also like to bring to your attention that whilst you stay at Mandarina Colombo, it is our responsibility to ensure that you have a wonderful stay and being located smack dab in the middle of the city centre in close proximity to the most prominent restaurants and outlets there definitely is a tradeoff we have to be close to the main roads for the easy access and connectivity and this unfortunately does mean that you do witness the hustle and bustle of the rapidly moving Colombo City. 

With all that real estate is very expensive and we're certain that you will agree with us on this as such the pool has been designed and built right on the rooftop such that we maximize the space we have available to us but also at the same time ensuing that our guests have the best view and the best experience. 

As for the construction taking place on a site opposite to the hotel, unfortunately the same is beyond our control as it is not construction to do with the hotel and leaves us with no jurisdiction to intervene. Nevertheless as rightfully observed there is indeed a lot happening in Colombo as the city is rapidly developing, nevertheless we do apologize for any inconveniences caused in this regard. 

As for not having a bar, you are absolutely right, we do not have a bar and we do not serve any high spirited drinks simply due to the fact that we conform to a crescent rating standard which is quite popular in many countries, which revolves on the idea that guests can still have a wonderful stay "bar the drinks". 

With that being said, we are aware that some guests would love to enjoy this facility and such our front desk team is equipped with information to direct our guests to the closest bar which is only a stones throw away.

Your feedback will certainly allow us to stay true to our promise and offer guests exactly if not more than what they book and nothing less. 

Warm Regards, 

Sales Manager

title: Disappointed

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for sharing your honest feedback and for choosing to stay with us at Jetwing Lighthouse. We sincerely regret that the communication about our dining arrangements did not meet your expectations and impacted your overall experience.

We understand how important transparency is, especially when guests are planning their stay well in advance, and we apologize for any inconvenience caused by the lack of prior information regarding our buffet policy. Your feedback highlights a vital area for us to improve, and we will be addressing this with our management team to ensure clearer communication moving forward.

We appreciate your kind words about our staff, who strive to provide warm and attentive service even in challenging situations. Your comments are invaluable in helping us enhance the guest experience.

Thank you again for bringing this to our attention. We hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back in the future and provide the exceptional stay that you deserve.

Ayubowan! (May you live long)

Indika Gamage
Head of Galle Hotels
Jetwing Lighthouse
placeInfo/address: 433 A Dadella, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
I stayed at Jetwing Lighthouse last year but decided to write this review now, as I believe it might help others who are considering booking this hotel. 

While the hotel itself is beautiful and the location is stunning, my overall experience was disappointing due to a lack of proper communication. One of the key things guests should be aware of is that buffet meals are only provided if there are more than 50 guests staying at the hotel. Otherwise, meals are served as a limited set menu — something I was only informed about after I checked in, despite booking my stay a month in advance. 

This isn't just about the buffet. It's about how the lack of transparency can affect the entire guest experience. When you're paying a premium price, there should be more consideration and flexibility around such matters. 

I’ve stayed in other hotels across Sri Lanka — even during the fuel crisis — and they still managed to provide buffets and excellent service, regardless of guest count. So it’s disappointing that a hotel of Jetwing’s reputation doesn’t communicate clearly or make such efforts. 

To be clear, I don’t blame the staff — they were friendly and did their best. But this is a management issue. Guests should be informed of important service limitations ahead of time so they can make informed decisions. 

Again, it’s not just about the buffet — it’s about how such things, when poorly handled, can negatively impact what could’ve been a memorable stay.
title: Beautiful Hotel, But Poor Communication and Disappointing Guest Experience

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you very much for sharing your feedback regarding your recent stay at our hotel. We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed the lovely room, our friendly staff, the restaurant and the beautiful view from our property. We appreciate your kind words and are grateful for your positive comments.

We also truly value your input on the aspects that could have been improved during your stay. I would like to address a couple of concerns you raised regarding the service and the level of attention given to guests of Indian descent.

Our hotel is proudly owned by a Sri Lankan company and we are committed to treating all of our guests equally, regardless of their ethnicity or background. However, I would like to clarify that during your stay, we had a particularly high number of Indian guests, many of whom had specific dietary needs, including food allergies. As a result, our team took special care to ensure their dietary restrictions were properly addressed, which may have led to the impression that additional attention was being provided. We always aim to give all guests the best service possible, and it was never our intention for you to feel overlooked or second-rate.

Regarding the repeated request for your room number, we understand your concern. Please note that this is a standard practice we follow only in the restaurants to ensure accuracy for our guests. However, apart from the restaurant, it is not our usual procedure to request room numbers in other areas of the hotel. We will certainly look into this matter further to ensure it does not happen again.

Once again, thank you for your valuable feedback. We will continue to focus on improving our service and ensure that all of our guests feel equally valued during their stay. We hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back in the future and provide you with an even more enjoyable experience.

Ayubowan !(May you live long)

Indika Gamage
Head of Galle Hotels
Jetwing Lighthouse

text:
Lovely room, great staff and restaurant. Beautiful view and grass lounging area.

Negatives were sadly that Galle is run down unless you go to the fortress which is lovely. Therefore the hotel backs onto a busy street with 1.5mile of rubbish and traffic until you reach the fortress.

In the hotel we were regularly asked our room number. Which I understand in the restaurant is essential, but there was no reason to be asked in the corridors etc

Also the hotel is Indian owned, and managed.. sadly we experienced that Indian guests, or foreign guests of Indian descent received far more attention in the restaurant or around the hotel than western or white ethnicity guests.
Initially we shrugged this off, but over our 5 night stay this made one feel second rate.
title: Indian owned and Indian guests given preference

placeInfo/address: 433 A Dadella, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed at this hotel for two nights and overall had a great experience. I really enjoyed the hotel's environment, being right next to the coast. Imagine having breakfast while listening to the waves crashing against the rocks—it’s truly delightful.

As for the hardware, the rooms are very spacious. The room we stayed in had a great view of the pool and the sea. The hotel has two swimming pools, and the restaurant wasn’t crowded for dinner since it’s currently the off-season.

However, one issue led me to give a 3-star rating for this stay. If it weren't for this incident, I would have given a 4 or 5-star rating. The issue is that some basic appliances in the room need to be checked and replaced! If not, they can pose a danger to guests.

Here’s what happened: The iron in my parents' room wasn’t working, so my father came to my room to borrow my iron. As soon as he plugged it in, there was suddenly a loud BOOM like an explosion, and bright sparks came out of the socket. My father got an electric shock, and there was a one-square-inch black mark on his right palm where he was holding the iron. We were all very shocked! Then the electricity in the room tripped. After we calmed down, I checked the iron and found that the end of the cord was already cracked and damaged (but you wouldn’t notice it unless you pulled the cord out a bit).

This incident was very concerning, and I believe it’s important for the hotel to regularly inspect and replace such items to ensure guest safety.

We value your loyalty and hope to have the opportunity to serve you again in the future. Please feel free to contact me directly, and I will be happy to assist you with your next visit to Jetwing. Thank you again for your feedback, and we look forward to welcoming you back soon.

Ayubowan! (May you live long)

Indika Gamage 
Head of Galle Hotels
placeInfo/address: 433 A Dadella, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Avoid weekends, only take rooms from the reception wing if you need some quiet time and good views.
text:
Lets start with the positive :) This is a beautifully designed hotel by Bawa and i love the architectural touches present throughout the resort! They are well preserved. Sunsets are amazing here and the lobby and the restaurant has nice views.
But avoid the weekends like plague if you are looking for some peace and quiet downtime. The weekends are discounted and the hotel gets packed with screaming kids and family. If the rooms aren't in the reception wing, you are in for a shock, as you can hear all the kids screaming from the pool even when you are inside the room :(
We were shifted to some other room then which had a sewage smell when going into the balcony. Overall a very bad and tiring stay which weren't relaxing at all. 
Food is average. Dont expect anything spectacular. Although checkout is at 12 noon we were asked to leave around 1030am by a guy knocking on the door - so that they can make the room ready for the next arrival. Will avoid jetwing lighthouse at all costs on my future visits to Galle. Not worth the money and most importantly not worth spending your valuable spare time hassling over these things - which are quite basic for any luxury hotel.
title: Avoid

placeInfo/address: 433 A Dadella, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Main wing rooms have a better view of the ocean.
text:
Booked a much needed 2 night stay at Lighthouse, Main Wing room. The views were stunning, the room was nice and well kept, and the amenities were up to our expectations. With the exception of the horrendous condominium construction a few lands from the property which slightly spoils the natural ambience of the hotel's location/ views, we enjoyed our time in the pool and the room. 

However, the staff's lack of attentiveness was a bit disappointing. We had 4 meals at the hotel, and each time it was proven difficult to get the attention of staff to place orders for our meals and they also kept us waiting for the longest time for simple requests like a glass of water - as long as 30 mins in one occasion, and every single time we followed up with a new staff members, they disappeared into the abyss with no water served. Strange. My partner and I understood that the hotel may have had to let go of staff due to COVID, however the hotel should only occupy and accomodate numbers of guests proportionate to the number of staff members available. And this should certainly not be at the expense of the guests as we spend a considerable amount of money to get the same service we would have received had the hotel been under ordinary circumstances. The lack of staff was also evident when calling the front desk for housekeeping or general requests, and more often than not, there was nobody to answer our calls. 

Would regardless recommend the hotel for its beautiful views and a wonderful setting for a romantic stay, but doubtful if it lived up to the hype - sadly. Visit for stunning architecture and a homely feeling, and keep other expectations at a minimum.
title: Beautiful location! Staff could be more attentive.

PRIYANTHIKA WIJENAIKE
General Manager
Jetwing Lighthouse
placeInfo/address: 433 A Dadella, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
This was my second trip to the Galle Jetwing Lighthouse hotel.  As always, the venue is mesmeric!  However, compared with our last visit a couple of months ago, this time there were a few not so fabulous experiences that we had:
-The air conditioning was woefully inefficient in the rooms. The fact that the fan too completed a perambulation in genteel slow motion also didn’t help with the cooling.  Split units would be a much more effective option, both cost and experience wise. 
-There was an infernal noise outside the bedroom at 8am as housekeeping staff navigated their merry way across the corridor for a full 30 minutes.
-The handmade soap, although a quaintly nice touch, produced no lather and was hard as a pumice stone.
ON THE GOOD SIDE!
-Used their spa facilities for the first time.  Well trained, professional Indonesian masseuses wrought their magic on our aching legs and feet.
-The alacarte menu covered a gamut of cuisines and the food was delicious.
-The promontory seating area overlooking the ocean on the western side, as always, was the piece de resistance.  The sunset there over a cup of tea or a glass of wine is phenomenal food for the soul.  Would probably make a poet out of the most jaded amongst us!
title: Another coastal gem

placeInfo/address: 433 A Dadella, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Spa wing is in the middle of the 3 main room buildings. Good option
text:
We checked in during a fully booked weekend after the Hotel opened after Covid-19 lock down in July-2020. Staff was always wearing masked and had gloves worn all the time. Temperature checking, mandatory hand washing or any other special kind of disinfecting method was not present. Staff did not ask the guests to ware masks or insisted on any kind of social distancing of any sort during the stay (hope they did it on pure purpose of not ruining guests stay (?))

Anyway, the buffet was planned as to be served by the staff, and was very admirable. Felt no different from the norm and sometimes guests served themselves. 

As a side note, it was observed that the hotel ran kinda with a limited staff given the current market conditions. This may be because some of the amenities were not present without request (tooth paste, tooth brush, slippers). The booking was for my wife's birthday and they said there was a complementary cake, but was not received :-(

Anyhow, all in all;

* Food - Good, but not great. Very little sea food present at the dinner + BBQ
* Service - Commendable
* Location and Rooms - Exceptional. Well maintained, and the private beach area (right in-front of 1st floor) was mesmerizing! Beautiful architecture. 

All in all, a relaxing stay except for not-so-great food
title: A peaceful getaway after the Lock-down

text: Stayed at the jetwing lighthouse for 5 night. Food is ok, staff always a little confused about food orders. This is a scam and please arrange your own vehicle from outside the hotel, which is probably another scam. Photo for attention, waiting for another ride.

placeInfo/address: Kubukkadanwala, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed here for 3 nights. It’s a great location for many sightseeing places including Sigiryia. The hotel was rated 4 star but it is definitely not to this standard.more a 3 star.
The positives- location, the staff are very friendly and helpful. The beds are large and comfy. The shower has a good shower head and lots of hot water. The buffet has a good selection of food and is quite good. The pool is really nice and large and clean. 

The downside- the rooms- our room was so dark inside we couldn’t see to unpack. When we tried to open the blinds we realised you couldn’t open them. The door had a dodgy lock and the key needed to be in the light switch so in an emergency you would have to take out the key and find the key hole to get out. This is pretty unsafe we felt. 
We had five hangers for all our clothes, to be fair they did provide more but seemed shocked we asked for more. 
The shower was mouldy in parts, the toilet didn’t flush properly and needed about fine attempts. The hairdryer was useless and melted around the rim. It was like it was from the 70s. The bin was rusty. 
The floor mat needed dumping it was so stained as was my pool towel. The pillows were so stained they needed replacing. We noticed this by accident and it really put us off. 
The chairs outside were so uncomfortable you couldn’t sit on them. 
The pool although nice only  had about 8-10 sunloungers for the whole hotel. 
This hotel needs a serious upgrade. It should not be classed as four star.
title: This is not four star. Don’t read local reviews

placeInfo/address: Kubukkadanwala, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Bring plenty of Insect spray with you !
text:
After arriving on a morning flight from London, we were transferred to the Occidental Dambulla which in hindsight would have been better to arrive a day earlier and stay in a Colombo hotel. After nearly 4 hours on the road upon leaving the airport, we arrived at the hotel and were greeting by lovely staff on and shown to our room which was very outdated, dark and unfortunately home to a good many mosquitos.  The rooms did  it have enough power points. The rooms were  a duplex set up which as a couple we didn’t need, but the upper area was  where all the mozzies were waiting to come down the stairs and attack us !  Fortunately we had brought plenty of repellent and only had a bite or two.   The food was poor in my opinion.  Plenty of options but 90% was vegetarian and meat quality tough and poor. Nice soups and sweets but not enough to give it any more than an average rating.  The staff were exceptionally polite and friendly and a credit to the hotel. Some of our group were not happy as they had problems with being overcharged for wine, and not being served with what they had ordered.
Steep stair leading up to reception area and also down the other side of reception to rooms, so beware if you have difficulty using stairs.  I personally would say the hotel should be rated only as a 3 star hotel.
title: Plenty of room for improvement

placeInfo/address: Kubukkadanwala, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka
text:
Stayed here our first two nights on a group Sri Lanka tour by mercury holiday’s. We were a group of 10 and after a 11hr flight we had a 4 hr transfer from Columbo airport , first impressions in the rain was it looked lovely and set deep inside a forest location .

Plus points

Massive room with a mezzazine level with an extra bed and another AC unit 
Was clean
Very large shower which shower looked a bit ropey but turned out to be the best shower for heat and pressure out of all five hotels we stayed in , 
Plenty of variety for breakfast and lunch .
Monkeys,peacocks and chipmunks all around hotel in morning when walking up to breakfast .
Great Massive pool , biggest we had seen on our trip and very nice to cool down in .
Towels supplied 
Umbrellas supplied to get to main building 
Nice bar
Surprising we didn’t get hardly any mosquito bites considering it was raining a lot and in deep jungle/forest.
Ideal to visit caves and lion rock 
Staff fantastic

Negative points

Rooms very tired flooring wise , all the flooring popping up due to moisture or water leaks , was same in another couples room but worse than ours .

Restaurant is buffet but open to elements which meant a lot of stuff if not covered has flys swarming 
all over which is very off putting
title: Lovely hotel in nature location

roomTip: Don't book through Agoda
text:
First the pros:
1. The location is great and the expanse of the property is huge. It is really staying in the midst of nature 
2. Rooms are large and on paper amenities are good 
3. Breakfast and dinner buffet spreads are good, and quality is what you would expect from a 3-4* star hotel

Cons:
1. Lot of things dont work. Our toilet flush wasn't working and we had to keep calling people to fix it.
2. Even the booking was an issue, though here the blame is on Agoda. We had booked two Garden Suites. Hotel gets Agoda bookings through Booking.com and what they had was for a lower category room. They showed us the message so have to trust them. We had a problem with Agoda bookings in Nuwara Eliya as well, so something clearly messed up there. 

This is not a complaint, but just an observation as language constraints is ours. Among all the places we stayed in in Sri Lanka, it was toughest to communicate in English here.
title: Could be a lot better, and avoid booking through Agoda

text:
This was a beautiful hotel and my chalet type room was set in well kept grounds. I was part of a tour group and so was only there for two nights.
Food was amazing with lots of choice . Staff were helpful and welcoming.
Sadly, on our second night there, the hotel had a function which had very loud music, thumping and drumming which kept me awake and despite calling reception at just before and after midnight, nothing was done. The manager told me they had had complaints from other guests too and assured me the music would be turned down and it would be finished within 15 minutes. It was just after 1 am when the music stopped which didn’t give me much time to try and get some sleep before having to be up at 6 am.
Such a shame as I would have liked to have given a higher score.
title: Lovely hotel let down by the noise from a function

text: Very nice looking hotel. Good was ok. We stayed for 3 nights. The safe wasn’t working so they sent someone twice to fix it. We got eaten alive in our cabin as there was no mosquito nets. placeInfo/address: Kubukkadanwala, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka
text:
We were part of a group tour for a week around various places in Sri Lanka. This was our first hotel of the tour. 

We got to the hotel in heavy rain in the evening and were allocated rooms straight away. There were 21 people in our party. Unfortunately almost everyone on our party got large duplex suites but we were given a basic one. We only found out later when we were chatting to others in the group. As we were there only for 2 nights, we didn't bother complaining. 

Shower was not always hot especially in the mornings. Room was basic and needed to be upgraded. To be honest we were glad we were here only for 2 nights as rest of the hotels on our tour were excellent.

Breakfast and dinners were good and there was a large variety of food. Pool was large and enjoyed swimming on the second evening. Staff were friendly too.

On the whole, a decent stay but shame about being given a basic room compared to rest of our group despite all of us paying the same for the whole tour. Also our room was one of the furthest away from the main reception area.
title: Sadly the worst hotel on our Jewels of Sri Lanka Mercury Holidays tour!

text:
The first room we were given, the AC was not working and had a malfunctioning fridge. then they replaced the fridge and mentioned the AC was not cooling because of incorrect settings. however even after the settings were corrected it was not cooling. then the management took more than 2.5hrs to give us another room in which the AC was not working as well!! finally we were moved to a better room at around 6pm which was more than 4hrs past the check-in time. so much for choosing this hotel to RELAX!

placeInfo/address: Kubukkadanwala, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka
text:
This hotel is in a lovely position. We enjoyed watching the antics of the monkeys and peacocks. Our bungalow with a spacious balcony had a mezzanine floor was very dark. The blinds on the windows and doors were broken and we were unable to lift them to open and let in more light. Everything was very clean and toiletries replaced.
It is very much a transit hotel with very large groups of tourists. So the dining room was quite noisy. We thought the food only average. 
One breakfast was absolute chaos because a couple of coach loads were leaving at roughly the same time. So they all came in to the dining room together and the staff just could not cope, although they did their very best. Meanwhile four managers were in reception chatting, instead of lending a hand.
Live music was played during dinner, which was pleasant, but somewhat loud. 
Reception staff were very helpful and arranged for us to have a cake at our table as it was our wedding anniversary, which was a lovely touch.
title: NO ATMOSPHERE.

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,
Thank you for choosing Occidental Paradise Dambulla, A member of Barceló Hotel Group for your holiday and for sharing your honest feedback.

We're delighted to hear that you enjoyed the authentic Sri Lankan desserts at our dinner buffet and found our gym facilities to your satisfaction. It's also great to know that our hotel's location served as a convenient base for your excursions to the nearby historical sites. 
We understand that the noise from the air conditioning unit was a concern, and we are looking into quieter solutions to ensure our guests' comfort. The condition of the toilet facilities you described is certainly not up to our standards, and we have addressed this with our housekeeping team to ensure that all rooms meet our strict cleanliness criteria. Regarding the safe in your room, we apologize for any inconvenience and have reminded our staff to diligently check all room amenities as part of our service protocol. We also acknowledge your feedback on the food labelling at our buffet and are implementing clearer signage to better cater to our guests with dietary preferences. 
Thank you for acknowledging the value and service provided during your stay. We strive to offer an exceptional experience, and your insights are integral to our continuous improvement.

We hope to welcome you back.

Guest Experience Team
placeInfo/address: Kubukkadanwala, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka
text:
This was a very average experience. The property itself is in a beautiful setting and is well located for excursions to the various historical sights in the area. This is a major positive. Otherwise, there were several small things which combined to undermine the experience:

1. Room air conditioners are noisy. This was not so bad as to prevent sleep but was just enough to be a nuisance. Maintenance came over when I called but they could not resolve the issue and insisted that it was normal.

2. The toilet bowls were yellowing and a little gross. This was the case in more than one room. It looked like it needed a clean with some bleach. The plastic toilet seats were also in poor condition. A small leak in the cistern meant that there was always a small puddle around the toilet in my room (#511).

3. The safe in my room was faulty. A maintenance crew came and fitted a new one. The safe in my sister's room (#503) was locked on arrival. This is an easy thing to get right and is why, at other hotels, management use checklists when rooms are reset.

4. The food labelling at the buffet was not friendly to vegetarian / vegan guests. I saw several cases of other visitors struggling to figure out which dishes contained eggs for example. This is again relatively easy to fix.

On the plus side, the gym had decent freeweights up to 25 or 30kg. The benches were horizontal-only, but this was not a major issue. Also, the dinner buffet served some authentic Sri Lankan desserts such as Watalappam and Bibikkan which were delicious.
title: Wasted Potential
