placeInfo/address: Kubukkadanwala, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Not a geart place if you r looking for R&R
text: The location is absolutely wonderful.The surrounding area still stands untouched by modernities boasting the ardent beauty of rural Sri Lankan village culture. The establishment maintains a beautiful lush compound but sadly the near by jungle erea is polluted by the hotel garbage. Sadly some reviews are misleading regarding the property. This place is definitely not peaceful. House keeping staff Garden staff and even some managers were surprisingly so loud around the compound chattering among them selves or on their phones. The food was avarag not a highlight. The Spa treatment( managed by Balinese Ayu Spa) was amazing.
title: Not much of a "Paradise"

placeInfo/address: 842 Negombo Road, Katunayake, Negombo 11450 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Ramada by Wyndham Katunayake Colombo International Airport
text:
This hotel has two advantages and two disadvantages (in addition to being an OK but not exceptional hotel as regards the basics):

On the plus side, it is close to the airport and offers a complimentary shuttle service. 

On the minus side, the food isn’t great - half of the meat in my Beef Stroganoff was unchewable. 

A bit more importantly: there is an aspect of how the A/C works that is different from any if the other 10+ hotels I stayed at in Sri Lanka (or indeed any other hotel): The rooms do not have any way for the guests to adjust the temperature of the A/C themselves. Instead you have to call Housekeeping, who arrive with the one and only A/C remote control that the hotel possesses. 
I kid you not! What I should have done if I wanted to adjust the temperature in the middle of the night I don’t want to think about.
title: OK hotel close to the airport if you have an early morning departure flight

placeInfo/address: 842 Negombo Road, Katunayake, Negombo 11450 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Ramada by Wyndham Katunayake Colombo International Airport
roomTip: Clean but there may be better options
text:
This hotel is extremely dated. Unbelievably so actually. The beds were clean but nearly everything was worn out and partly broken. One of the lamps had exposed live wires dangling from it. In desperate need of a makeover. Arrived at 1:30 am to really lovely staff but the check in of our small group took forever. Why didn’t they have the keys ready?? 

On the upside the staff are beautiful.
title: Well past its glory days

placeInfo/address: 842 Negombo Road, Katunayake, Negombo 11450 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Ramada by Wyndham Katunayake Colombo International Airport
text:
We arrived very late from a flight around 5 am so had booked the rest of that night and the following night. Room was pleasant went to bed around 5.30am and were woken up by a family next door who sounded as though they were in our room. They weren’t particularly noisy but had loud voices and a young child. We were woken up after an hours sleep because the rooms were adjoining and not sound proofed.
It took ages for reception to respond but they did eventually move us to another adjoining room but with no guests next door.
This was much better.
Coffee not great/ breakfast nicely presented  but lacking compared to all the other hotels we stayed at.
Bar staff were friendly
Pool was lovely but sun beds only on one side.
Noticed that there seemed to be heaps of staff ready to serve for eg lunch outside but very few guests so food might have been there for a while perhaps. 
Enjoyed  our stay - good to use it as a base but food towards Shangri - la in the shopping
 complex at Centrsl cafe eg buffet was a lot better
title: Nice pool - great piano music - average breakfast-not great if you get an adjoining room which lots of them seemed to be

placeInfo/address: 842 Negombo Road, Katunayake, Negombo 11450 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Ramada by Wyndham Katunayake Colombo International Airport
text: Stayed here for a few hours before departing Colombo. Rooms are quite old and dated, but comfortable. Free wifi worked ok. Bed was comfortable and the bathroom was small but functional. Conveniently located about 7km from the airport and offering a free shuttle in a 22 seat bus. The hotel has a swimming pool, bar & restaurant. Food and drinks are good and very reasonably priced. Staff are all wonderful. I would consider staying here again if flying out of Colombo.
title: Convenient to airport

placeInfo/address: 842 Negombo Road, Katunayake, Negombo 11450 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Ramada by Wyndham Katunayake Colombo International Airport
text: My first time in Sri Lanka, I came to this hotel because of my delayed flight. This hotel is not bad, let me point out some things. First of all, some of the things are used and thet didn't put a new one.The AC is kinda giving less air.TV Is not working.And the tables in the restaurant/buffet are not that clean.They didn't bother.But overall everything else is good
title: First time experience

placeInfo/address: 842 Negombo Road, Katunayake, Negombo 11450 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Ramada by Wyndham Katunayake Colombo International Airport
roomTip: Ask for a quiet room. Whilst it was a walk away from reception both our rooms were quiet so had a good sleep
text: We stayed here for one night on two dates using the hotel as a transit hotel on arrival and leaving Colombo. This is not really a tourist hotel and more suited to businessmen. The hotel has so much potential for overseas guests due to its close location to CMB airport (15 minutes by car) but needs a lot of repairs and improvements. The overall decor is dark and gloomy. Exterior of building needs painting. The hotel has poor streetscape appeal so on first arrival a guest feels they have made a poor decision however on entering the lobby and met by friendly staff it becomes more reassuring. Lots of doors and passageways make the hotel feel uninviting, dark and old fashioned. Stayed twice and never saw the swimming pool which I understand is somewhere in the hotel. The restaurant food does not suit overseas guests, was expensive with limited choices so we ordered room service twice. Reception staff were kind, helpful and friendly. I hope the owners put some money into refurbishing this hotel as it could be a fantastic hotel for overseas guest coming through Colombo. Until it is smartened up I would only stay 1 night whilst in transit.
title: Close to CMB airport for 1 night

placeInfo/address: 842 Negombo Road, Katunayake, Negombo 11450 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Ramada by Wyndham Katunayake Colombo International Airport
text:
A decent option to stay near Colombo's Katunayake airport though its a 20 minute drive. I spent a few hours to sleep as my flight landed early morning and the check-in time at my Colombo hotel was 12 noon. The hotel was empty of guests which is understandable for this time of the year. 

The room was nice but had no views - it looked into other rooms and not a very pleasant view at all. 

The dining area had a really nice view of the pool but I was too sleepy to try that at 7am. 

The property has a lot of rooms so its definitely an option for large groups.
title: OK

placeInfo/address: 842 Negombo Road, Katunayake, Negombo 11450 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Ramada by Wyndham Katunayake Colombo International Airport
text:
This hotel is as it appears in the Photo. It is an old property and definitely need renovation. Room size is big but the interiors are very old.
It took 15-20 minutes to the Airport. Quite far from Colombo city. you can get UBER for commute but when i tried booking for teh airport no UBER accepted the request.
Pro - Close to the airport
Con - Hotel provide Airport drop but very expensive that they charged USD 12 non negotiable rate to drop for 8 KM. 
Very average hotel
title: Close to Colombo Airport

placeInfo/address: 842 Negombo Road, Katunayake, Negombo 11450 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Ramada by Wyndham Katunayake Colombo International Airport
text:
Rooms are still equipped with old sockets (3 cords) , not according to international standard, Almost impossible to charge your phone 
Also should provide internet not just in deluxe rooms but in all rooms
title: Can't charge phone  and no internet in rooms except deluxe rooms

placeInfo/address: 842 Negombo Road, Katunayake, Negombo 11450 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Ramada by Wyndham Katunayake Colombo International Airport
text: Sri Lankan Airways asked me to forfeit my seat due to downgrading of their plane. I was adamant that I would not do so, but the attendant said some of us had to forfeit and take the next flight.The next flight to Bangalore was next day 5 PM. The airline offered me stay and food. When he said the stay would be at Ramada, I was happy as I had stayed at ramada properties before and expected similar 4 star or 5 star treatment. We had to wait for more than 2 hours and were driven to the hotel at about 12 AM. Reaching the hotel, I was shocked to see an old building that was different from the ramada Colombo I checked online. The driver said, this was ramada kaunayake near airport. Check in was smooth and the room was very old, old cot, old furniture, bad view , cigarette smell, no AC. I was disappointed and was too tired to protest. I had not had my dinner and requested the staff to prepare any vegetarian dish which can be cooked fast. I was given fried rice at that late hour and I thank them for that service. Breakfast was elaborate and staff were friendly. One over friendly waiter asked me to take up body massage in the hotel spa by a female masseur. I gently refused and he said that the I could avail all favours from the masseur. That was quite embarrassing as the waiter was elderly. I did lose respect for him and ignored him. Lunch was also good and the restaurant was empty. They have a small pool and could not see much of any other facilities. The travel desk helped me in the closest sightseeing places but I did not take it up as they were far from the hotel and was too hot outside. All in all, an old hotel and needs upgrade badly.
title: Old and needs upgrade

placeInfo/address: 842 Negombo Road, Katunayake, Negombo 11450 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Ramada by Wyndham Katunayake Colombo International Airport
text:
Hotel desperately needs a makeover, Found staff at reception extremely helpful. Rooms ok but old.
I guess this hotel is ok as a transit hotel just to freshen up etc but if looking for a location that has a few shops etc handy - forget it, its got nothing around it.
title: September 2019

placeInfo/address: 842 Negombo Road, Katunayake, Negombo 11450 Sri Lanka

food not at all good - that one point makes down for all other aspects
improve the quality of breakfast. prepare food one or 2 items according to citizens who check in. so that they will be more happy.
title: ABOUT BUFFET BREAKFAST

placeInfo/address: 842 Negombo Road, Katunayake, Negombo 11450 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Ramada by Wyndham Katunayake Colombo International Airport
text: Stayed with family for an overnight transit. Airport pick up was on time and the hotel is located ideally for transit. The room was clean and spacious. The air conditioner was not really up to the mark and was not fixed even after several calls to the reception and visits by the mechanic. We did not sleep well due to the warmth. Breakfast was reasonable but not much choice for vegetarians. Would recommend this place for transit at Colombo airport if you are looking at basic, clean option at low price. However they can definitely do much better in maintaining the rooms and hygiene at the restaurant (we were swatting away flies...)
title: Transit hotel: Good location and price..

placeInfo/address: 842 Negombo Road, Katunayake, Negombo 11450 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Ramada by Wyndham Katunayake Colombo International Airport
text: If you are transiting through Colombo airport, this is a good hotel for a short stay. Rooms are quite spacious and clean. One downside is that it is in a remote location with limited scope for any activities. The hotel staff are very courteous and professional. However, the bartenders and restaurant staff are annoyingly pushy in enticing you for alcohol and beverage purchases.
title: Good Transit Hotel

placeInfo/address: 842 Negombo Road, Katunayake, Negombo 11450 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Ramada by Wyndham Katunayake Colombo International Airport
text: This is a relatively basic but clean hotel with friendly service that is near the airport. During rush hour it can take up to 30 minutes to reach the hotel but during off hours it is only about 10-12 minutes by taxi. The check-in process was a little slow but friendly and included a welcome drink and a cold towel. There is a restaurant on the ground floor that has decent Sri Lankan and continental food. We had dinner there but left well before breakfast was served. There is a pool in the back that looked inviting but we were too exhausted from travel to enjoy it. All in all, a decent place for stop on the way in or out of Sri Lanka.
title: Decent option near the Colombo international airport

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Mr. Robert, 

Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We deeply regret that your recent visit did not meet the high standards of service and hospitality that you have come to expect from us. As a valued repeat guest, your satisfaction is of utmost importance to us, and we sincerely apologize for any inconvenience caused during your stay.

Following an internal investigation, we have identified that one of our front office staff members provided incorrect information regarding the happy hour discount at our restaurant. We understand how frustrating and disappointing this must have been, and we take full responsibility for this oversight. While this mistake should not have occurred, we strongly believe that the situation could have been handled better, especially by offering the discount as a goodwill gesture to acknowledge your continued patronage with us. We deeply regret that this did not happen at the time.

Additionally, we are very sorry to hear that you found the service at reception to be below the level of warmth and professionalism that you had previously enjoyed. We will be addressing this with our team immediately to ensure that all staff members are well-informed, proactive, and always ready to assist our guests with accuracy and care.

Regarding the hot water issue, we understand how essential this is for guest comfort. We sincerely apologize for any inconvenience caused and have since addressed the matter with our maintenance team to ensure that this does not happen again.

We truly appreciate your loyalty and are saddened that this experience has left you feeling disappointed. We would love the opportunity to welcome you back in the future and restore your confidence in our service. Should you reconsider visiting us again, please do not hesitate to reach out to me directly so that we can personally ensure a seamless and memorable stay.

Once again, our sincere apologies, and we thank you for your valuable feedback.

Warm regards,

Kevin Schumacher 
General Manager

text:

placeInfo/address: 32 Alfred House Ave, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka
text: He visto en algún sitio que es de 5 estrellas esto debe ser de coña,,,,, yo le daría ......3...También he leído alguna opinión que dice de lujo,, me da que quien ha escrito ese comentario, no ha viste un hotel de lujo en su vida,,,, Quieres ver un hotel de lujo de verdad, vete a dar un paseo, y te vas al hotel Sangrila,,, en el paseo marítimo. .Nos cambiamos de habitación , nos querían colar una que estaba frente a un pared, 3 noches frente a una pared,, como que no.... Nos dieron piso superior...Buen tamaño , con ventana, frigo, caja de seguridad, tele, muebles, pero la distribución de los muebles y la cama de pena,  estaban ubicados de pena, ni que estuviéramos en una pensiona sin gusto, techos altos, baño bien,, pero nada mas entra la ducha,,  inodoro empotrado , muy mal distribuido.. Resumiendo esto no es un hotel d 5 estrellas... todo con mal gusto y sin encanto.. Tiene dos piscinas pequeñas y una especie de estanque.. Tal vez hace mucho tiempo fue un buen hotel,,, pero lo fue,, desayuno bien...Al centro se va en tuc tuc por unas 6000 rupias , no pagues mas. Saliendo te vas ala derecha, andas 100 metros y coges 1 calle Izda., andas unos metros y hay una pizzería a tu derecha, no lo dudes quédate a comer o a cenar....parece un poco cutre , pero merece la pena,, esta frente a un restaurante Thai. a unos 3 minutos a pie...
title: normal..........................................................................

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Ms. Rumno, 

Greetings from Colombo Court Hotel & Spa!

Thank you so much for your valuable feedback. 

I personally conducted an investigation on this matter and came to understand that you had arrived late to the hotel (past midnight) and not with the rest of the group. Our restaurants operate until 11 PM for dinner and this has been clearly communicated with your travel agent which I believe has failed to communicate the same to you.

With regards to breakfast, all breakfast orders were taken at the time of arrival on the day before you check-out but except for yours since you had arrived very much late in the night and our restaurants were closed. 

However, I believe that our front office staff has failed to check on this matter with the tour leader when they had arrived prior to you. They could have checked if you require dinner and on your meal preferences for breakfast. 

Ms. Rumno, I will assure you that we will take this as a learning point and will make sure that serve our guests better in the future. 

Best Regards
Kevin Schumacher

placeInfo/address: 32 Alfred House Ave, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka
text:
We had an overnight stay in this hotel last May 18 while my brother had a two night stay from May 17-19. We booked the airport transfer ($29) and arrived at about 11 pm. The person who welcomed us at the airport was more friendly and warm compared to the staff who welcomed us upon arrival and processed our check in. Even the driver who took us to the hotel was friendlier and shared with us the nice sites to visit in Colombo. Among the 5 hotels we stayed at in Sri  Lanka (Aryana, Aliya Resort and Spa, Theva Residency and Jetwing Lagoon), we did not have the same warm welcome and departure in this hotel. 

The only saving grace in our short stay was the restaurant staff during breakfast who was warm and always smiling as well as the delicious Sri Lankan breakfast. There was only one other table occupied during breakfast as there were not too many guests after the Easter bombing. The room was also comfortable. It's also good to read about the hotel being eco-friendly.
title: Friendly restaurant staff

placeInfo/address: 32 Alfred House Ave, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka
text:
We spent one night in this hotel, but  to be honestin our opinion is expensive. The room was acceptable, clean and well decorated. We had breakfast and it was horrible, not tasty food and low quality.
The price for this hotel should be lower, you can find other options for 130$
title: Expensive hotel

placeInfo/address: 32 Alfred House Ave, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka
text: The staff here at this 32 room boutique hotel makes it all worth it. I arrived and was welcomed with an ice tea and foot massage. The rooms are large and comfortable, lots of hot water. The only problem I had was I couldn’t open my blinds due to the location of the room which made for a cave like atmosphere and the room was over the restaurant so you hear loud music until the restaurant closes, Request a quiet room, I know they have them. This place has  a library but unfortunately it is very musty. The pool is nice but when I was there there was a private birthday party so the pool was off limits. The restaurants serve good food. The location is pretty central.
title: Wonderful place but beware of noise

placeInfo/address: 32 Alfred House Ave, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka
text: The pool was nice surrounded by trees and a nice shade and luckily we had it all to our self coz no one was using it . The pool side menu was very limited and the food was basic and with not much of flavor
title: Visited for a swim

placeInfo/address: 32 Alfred House Ave, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka
text:
Sadly we were disappointed with this hotel for our last night in Sri Lanka. Based on the reviews we were expecting a boutique hotel experience. This hotel is at best average. On a positive note all the staff were warm and friendly. Plus the pool area is very nice.
Room is OK but nothing special or particularly unique for the price. Red/brown stain running along the wall next to seating area easily cleaned with a cloth but obviously nobody had bothered.
World Cup soccer has just started and the hotel had added several tacky cardboard advertisements throughout. Went to enjoy their “happy hour” at the roof bar but  apparently it didn’t apply as usual because of the World Cup. No mention of the change to usual operations because of the World Cup on their website or when we arrived. More importantly why would it change because of the World Cup? As a guest from half way across the world I didn’t come to a “boutique” hotel in Colombo to view, hear or have anything to do with the World Cup. A national Sri Lankan holiday or even a significant western one (eg Xmas , NYE) is an understandable reason to change normal offers but a football tournament in Russia.....Really? Got the discount in the end after insisting but soured the experience.
Then asked at reception about airport transfer, quoted a price I thought was too high which is fair enough and common at hotels. So asked for normal taxis and was given a phone number to call myself and book a taxi. What?? Have travelled extensively around the world and never received such a response, if a guest wants transport arranged any decent hotel will assist even if you refuse to use their specific vehicles. Of course try to sell me your hotel service but when I say no and ask for an alternative then tell me you will call and book on our behalf a standard taxi or find us a taxi at the time required, don’t just had me a phone number to call myself. That’s not how hotels and particularly boutique hotels look after their guests. Disappointed that our last night in Sri Lanka was at this hotel and would not recommend, for the price paid I’m sure there are better hotels in Colombo.
title: Nothing boutique about this hotel

placeInfo/address: 32 Alfred House Ave, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka
text: We had the club floor rooms. Not once were we welcomed in the lounge. The staff still have a very unfriendly attitude to South Asians, and are unable to standardise their service. Greetings and welcomes are driven based early nineteenth century biases. Overall quite disapponting. The property is nice and rooms are modern.  Loved the toiletries excellent quality. The oriental restaurant was amazing and the service in the multi cuisine restaurant was good. Essentially lacks standardisation.  Improving staff etiquette to avoid dated attitudes can make the place more exciting.
title: Undistinguished service

placeInfo/address: 32 Alfred House Ave, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka
text:
When choosing a hotel on booking,com I don‘t usually spend a lot of time cross-examining prices, assuming that the indicated level on the website will approximately represent the comparative value of service accomodation etc. obviously slightly fluctuating with demand. This is how we paid approx 220$ for a “superior“ double room in the Columbo Court Hotel. This hotel is located very conveniantely in a central location which -naturally- is also noisy. Hence the rooms are oriented inwards but not only to a courtyard (as one might assume given the name) but also towards light shafts doubling up as locations for air condition equipment. These shafts provide obviously no view and little daylight and most unfortunately act as amplifiers for the noise emitted by the technical equipment and all activities that are happening on an open ground floor (from kitchen cleaning, to Bar music and party chatter). The rooms themselves are ok in size and clean, if not particularly pretty or well illuminated (day or night). 

Given this situation we already felt slightly irritated, but were really annoyed when it came to breakfast (which was included in the price). It was served in a tired looking restaurant by a large quantity of waiters who mostly seemed to watch that you would pay once you deviated from the prescribed route of “English breakfast”. Top of the list was “fruit platter” that consisted of a few tiny pieces of Watermelon, papaya and banana on a huge plate. Mango (delicious and in season) was not available and more banana cost extra. After this we asked the hotel to book a taxi for us, which they refused to do lest we would use the hotel’s own service. By now we were really enraged and demanded to speak to the manager whom we met in the evening. The perfectly nice young Pole explained that he had arrived only two weeks ago and was given the task to give the place a lift. Well, he has a task at his hand. He was very apologetic and promised imminent improvement of which future travellers may benefit. We were leaving early the next morning and were given a special fruit breakfast in the foyer. Even a mango was delivered after a repeated request into the rolling taxi. A second view into booking.com on the next day showed our room on offer for 89$ in the coming days, which - I would say- is a fair price. So if you want a bargain stay in a hotel that is trying harder, this might be your place in the next year or so; We, however, will probably try somewhere else when returning to Colombo.....
title: Rip-off Artists (no more?)

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Rachel,

Thank you for taking the time to write us your feedback. We appreciate all comments, our commitment is to provide our guests with the highest standard of service in the industry, thus constructive observations are welcomed positively & these issues will be addressed seriously.

placeInfo/address: 32 Alfred House Ave, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka
text:
We had read such great reviews about this hotel but were quite disappointed. 

The staff were all really friendly and helpful. However the hotel itself needs a bit of a upgrade. 

We were given a suite, which was lovely but things in the room didn’t work. The TV had limited channels and rubbish reception. Hairdryer and iron didn’t work. Plugs for items provided didn’t fit the plug sockets. 

The pool area is nice but seating and loungers are a bit dated. It is also not very relaxing as the area is right next to the busy main road. 

The cafe and rooftop bar are nice and offer happy hour drinks. 

When you pay so much money for a hotel I expect it to be a better standard.
title: Great staff but otherwise disappointing

placeInfo/address: 32 Alfred House Ave, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka
text:
We selected a mid priced , well reviewed hotel for our first two nights in Colombo whilst we acclimatised for a couple of weeks in Galle. 
The CC is quite OK, clean and with all amenities as advertised. But, be careful what room you end up with. Our room looked out onto a walk way....conversely, everyone on the walk way looked into our room, unless the blinds were tightly shuttered making the room very dark and grim.  The other aspect was that all of the noise from any functions and a kitchen area also drifted up to us.  On our first night, the function noise died down around midnight following two calls to complain.  It s a hotel after all, not a night club.
Having had a whinge, the wifi worked well and the breakfast was excellent.  The service was willing and able.  Probably would not stay here again, but still early into my SL trip.
title: Pleasant but noisey

placeInfo/address: 32 Alfred House Ave, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka
text: I have been there many times for lunch and had discussions and a place without disturbance and I did not stay there. For a stay it seems a nice place but pool area is just next to one of the restaurants may not be the best.
title: Place for a chat

placeInfo/address: 32 Alfred House Ave, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka
text: We stayed 2 nights at Colombo Courtyard on our way home.  First impression was great and the staff were excellent.  Rooms are clean and well kept.  There was a few issues with the internet and the shower pressure was cold one second and boiling the next.  There is also no window on the bathroom (it is screened and private) however you can hear the next door bathroom which is quite disturbing.  The biggest let down was the food.  It was average at best.  Breakfast I ordered the English breakfast.  The fruit platter had fruit that tasted like it had been cut 2 days ago, I had poached eggs the first time and it was served on hard toast and an omelet the next day which was ok but the cheese they used was processed.  We also had lunch when we arrived and we ordered a pulled pork sandwich.  It arrived as a sandwich with bacon and processed cheese.  They did apologize and didn't charge us however it was really unacceptable to just blame the chef.  In a country that has such amazing fresh fruit and good it was disappointing.
title: Good Hotel and location

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Surabhi A, 

Thank you for your review. I am pleased that you enjoyed our team's hospitality, food and our central location. About the room, our windows are triple sized to avoid street noise but still we will certainly review this matter with our higher management and I hope you will allow us the opportunity to regain your satisfaction on your next visit to Colombo Courtyard.

We look forward to serve you soon…
placeInfo/address: 32 Alfred House Ave, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka
text:
Well located hotel , if you have meetings lined up in this part of town, not far from main city centre.  Strategically located if you are in look out for tuk tuks.  
Loved the hotel, smiling staff, food not only delicious but well presented.  My only grudge was the room, I stayed in 201 and traffic noise was a menace.  Wooden blinds were used as curtains which nicely let in all the streetlights at night, so could not get much sleep to top it all I had back to back meetings, my bad!
title: Read my review before you decide.
